hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: ProsLocation is very convenient, sleeping was nice, cold in the room, ac was working, couldn't hear airplanes from outside.ConsRooms are small, price is expensive.Overall I am definitely going to come back whenever I have a late flight but the rooms are small.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Level 3F. Free Shuttle bus to Domestic terminals from station 0. You can buy bus ticket to Haneda on level 2 for 3100 yen. Station 5. Small rooms. Good quality. Coffee and tea kettle in drawer. Great bathroom. No exercise facility. Nice bed and pillow. Very friendly staff. Can’t beat the convenience of the location.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed for a weekend with my parents & son. My mom had polio as a child so walking is difficult. The hotel was perfect since it’s in the airport. Front desk staff are friendly, speak English & helpful. There are things to do in the airport itself - restaurants & shopping!
user_name:
Cecille L
Ventura County Coast, California

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed at the Royal Park Hotel Hanedafrom February 14-22 2020, Hollywood TwinRoom 731. The staff at checkin was every warm and welcoming. At checkout again the staff was very sincere and wishing us a safe flight and wish us to return again, and we will.On our departure the hotel staff offered us complimentary breakfast because of minor problem with the hot water which was not under their control in the late evening, affected the whole hotel, but in the morning the issue was fixed.I would like to thank Mr. Kato at front desk who handled our checkout and the complimentary breakfast. I also want to thank Mr. Shohei Honda, for personally coming to explain the water issue from the night.I want to say Thank-you to all the staff at Royal Park Tokyo Haneda. We will return again in the near future. Sincerely, Mr. Caldera Roberto Antonio Mr. Poon Tak LokRoom 731 February 14-22 2020

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Since I booked a night via AGODA and outbreak crisis raised, I cancel my booking but was charge so I tried accessing hotel’s official website and submit e-mail - NEVER GET ANY RESPOND! Paying overseas call fee does NOT make sense!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Conveniently located inside Haneda’s International Terminal this hotel is brand new and features some small but clean and fully equipped rooms. There is a shuttle running pretty often and connecting the other terminals so if you happen to be bumped from a flight because of a snow blizzard in Hokkaido, which was eventually our case, you might comfortably pop in here and wait for the storm to calm down. But if you have more than just few hours, I suggest that you look for a better location in town and enjoy a little more of what Tokyo has to offer

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room is small but modern and it was the perfect stay as i was in transit and just needed a place to sleep. The staff was friendly and the location perfect was it was right atthe airport. The breakfast buffett was really good, a lot of choices.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Easy and very accessible hotel. It is very convenient for travelers who want to travel on a early morning flight and who are in a transit. Very friendly and humble staff. The rooms are clean, very well laid and very cozy. Good place to spend overnight while travelling.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My wife and I boarded the ANA flight from NYC with our final destination to Manila in Economy. While ANA Economy class was better then anticipated, 12 plus hours of not being able to sleep adds up. We were at Haneda Airport- Tokyo International Airport - for a 12 hours 25 minute layover before our 5 hour flight to Manila. After the flight we decided to stay at this property to freshen up and catch some sleeps before the upcoming flight. This property was what the doctor ordered. Yes the rooms are on the tighter side but, when your objective is resting and freshening up for your connecting flight, the size of the room is not an issue. They had all the bath amenities that was needed with a bath tub a complementary water in the fridge and they even had a lounge with drinks (orange juice, water and coffee) and, to my surprise, cup noodle for a little snack. All these and efficient service from the Night manager(?) for $141 was definitely worth it. We’re adding this property for a long layover pit-stop at Haneda Airport. Also, if your layover is not as long, we’re talking about few hours, they also have a refresh room starting at 3,000 yen (roughly $30) for an hour.
user_name:
Japandroid89
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed there after coming to Japan from UK. It has been a long day so I needed somewhere I can check in straightaway. The price wasn’t cheap but if you consider the hassle to go to elsewhere where you need to hop onto a hotel shuttle it was absolutely worth it!Also, they can lend you an adopter for your mobile free of charge. The room I stayed was downstairs and couldn’t see run way but I was so tired so couldn’t really bothered lolThe bed was really nice and the bathroom / shower was very nice too and clean.I am happy that I stayed there!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is so convenient for a last night stay before an early flight. We booked a Premium Room and got room 861 at the end of a very long corridor, overlooking the front of the airport. It was still a small room, although bigger than others on the floor. There was a fridge, bottled water, a kettle and mugs. The bathroom was very small with a bath, a shower over the bath and a Toto. The shower was very powerful.It had an interesting check in where you pay at a separate terminal point and check out is at the same machine terminal. There is a vending machine on the corridor with soft drinks and beers.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Asked about a room and was told they were sold out and they couldn’t sell me a room for the night. I made sure to ask the manager and was told the same thing. Strange then I was able to make a reservation online for the same night and walk in to get the room. The staff seemed very unhappy I was able to get a room. What’s the point of operating a hotel if you won’t sell rooms to a guest flying from the airport?

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It’s literally a minute from the check-in and departure area, so you can skip the hassle of traffic before a flight. The international terminal houses many interesting shops and eateries and I easily spent 3-4 hours there. Room was spacious and the bathtub was long. Great view of the runway through misty glass. You only get one hard pillow in but it didn’t impact my sleep; minor point only if you really need comfy pillows. Bed head rest showed signs of wear and tear but again, minor issue though it was obvious enough for me to notice. Overall I enjoyed my stay especially since it afforded me great convenience. Staff was friendly and all greeted me every time I passed the lobby. Check out is easy through a machine.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Let's be honest, you are paying for convenience not luxury. Stayed during 12 hour layover in Haneda and was totally worth it. It's not widely advertised, but found out that you can get rooms by 6, 12 or 24 hours. Recommend booking ahead, it's not a large hotel and sold out quickly when we got to the airport. We opted for six and was great to just get a quiet place for a solid nap in a real bed and a shower before taking off next day. (I spent 9 hours on the floor in Singapore and was NOT doing that again!) Rooms clean, staff friendly, also they give you a sleeping gown so you don't have to sleep in travel clothing. Nice touches like extra toothbrush, hair dryer, clothing refresher, in the room. Only recommendations could use some lotion in the bathroom and some better pillows - they were not very comfortable (as least not for a Westerner...) Will definitely stay again if travels take me via Haneda again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My family and I were arrived at 1 o clock past midnight using Singapore Airlines in Haneda Airport. Therefore before hand, I had booked this hotel. Apparently it was a wise choice to do so because after passing thru the immigration process (which was very2 long), baggage claim services plus baggage quarantine area, the time already showed at almost 2.45 a.m.So, after went thru the baggage quarantine area checked, I was looking for an elevator to go up to the 3rd floor (the arrival hall is on the 2nd floor). Once I reached the 3rd floor, I was looking for the counter L in the foremost left side (3rd floor is the departure counter). Once I found the L counter, I just follow the hotel sign for the entrance, which was very easy to locate.The check in process went smooth. The room was very Cosy and comfortable as I booked two room (one with two single beds plus a sofa bed and another one just a regular single bed room). It was a very modern room and doesnt feel like an airport hotel at all.The breakfast was also had a very good food selections considering it was an airport hotel.So it is an excellent choice for arriving late in Tokyo Haneda International Airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Reception and Front Desk staff were exceptional, friendly, polite, efficient and very helpful. As many flights arrive early in the morning and check-in opens at 3.00pm, once the reservation has been verified your luggage can be taken and stored until later. Such convenience. The room was great, very clean, quiet and I could even see Mt Fuji.Would definitely stay here again, you can't beat the location, within the actual airport. Many facilities are on hand, including internet solutions, obvious availability of Information Personnel, travel and ticketing offices plus the regular train departures and arrivals.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Landed in late with kids. Reception was efficient. Room is clean with decent sized bathroom. Given its winter, shower was quick to rise up to the right temperature. Provided good amenities with comfy Pj’s. Jap Breakfast was conveniently not overcrowded.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Because we enjoyed our first stay in this hotel, we decided to book one night again for this trip, and it didn't disappoint. With a flight scheduled at 9AM, staying in this hotel the night before takes so much of the stress away. Yes, it is pricey, but I can honestly say that the whole experience was worth it.For the food and shopping scene, you've got a lot to choose from by just going up one floor to the Edo Market. There's also a 7-Eleven convenience store near the monorail terminal, in case you need something else.The room is big (It's even bigger than our hotel room near Tokyo Station), the toiletries smell good, and my sleep is good.It was my first time to use the computer in the business corner to print out our boarding passes, and it's very dated -- it's still running on Windows XP with just Internet Explorer or Firefox as the browsers available. It's also hard to switch from Japanese to English. Maybe it's time to upgrade, guys?That's about it.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here one night between flights. The location is super-convenient and they’re happy to look after your baggage if you’re too early for check in. The check in process is partly automated, as is checkout, which means there’s no queueing at a desk to check out, you just feed your room card into the machine. Surprisingly, given its location by the runway, we slept really well thanks to excellent soundproofing. The air con was quiet and efficient but only operates when your room card is in the slot by the door so the room felt stifling when we first arrived but soon cooled down. We didn’t try the breakfast.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed here because I was arriving after 15 hours of flying and knew I would be too tired to navigate the train system to my final destination. This airport is inside the Haneda Airport International Terminal. It was quiet and friendly. The room was spacious with a very nice bed and bedding. I did not eat at the restaurant, but it looked nice, if pricy. There were many other dining options in the airport terminal. Altogether excellent stay, and good way to start my visit to Japan.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived at 1am from Singapore hence we decided to stay over at the airport hotel rather than go straight to Tokyo city. Hotel lobby looks grand however the room is very small for 2 adults and 2 young kids. For the price paid just for a stopover is on the high side, as a good 3 star hotel in downtown Shinjuku is way cheaper. The good thing is Royal Park Hotel is very convenient if you are arriving at Terminal 1 International airport as you just have to walk over from arrival hall within 10mins. Free Shuttle service between domestic and internatipnal airport stops operating after 11pm so if you are arriving at the domestic side then it is advisable that you book the other hotels located at the domestic arrival airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The staff spoke good English when I checked in, which I am glad. The hotel entrance and lobby looks fancy. The room was small and basic. Everything you need is there and everything looks clean. It’s just a little pricey for a night stay since I just needed a decent place to sleep when my flight arrived at 1am. Other than that, nothing really to fault about, but nothing too memorable as well.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is very basic, though convenient. Service was poor. The room was tatty and very small. The breakfast was inedible - cold watery eggs, chewy bacon, undercooked sausage and watery coffee. Stay here for convenience, not for comfort or service.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here as we were catching a 2.30 am flight the next morning.We paid full rate (they don't offer hourly rates), even though we checked out at 11.30pm to catch our flight. So we stayed for 11 1/2 hours, and (obviously) missed breakfast the next day. Nevertheless, they still saw fit to charge us 1,000 yen extra to check in early (noon). Bit of a nickel-and-diming approach (many others have mentioned this fact).Room was exceptionally basic, and rather poorly laid out. The bed was right up against the window on the one side. No bedside tables or reading lights (??)Bathroom was compact, with the shower over the bath (with a shower CURTAIN, which freaks me out a bit)We were very far from the lifts, so at least the room was quiet,The hotel is expensive for what you get. (They obviously know they have a captive market, as there are a number of flights that leave between midnight and 2am)Average

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We found the hotel quite easily, right on the international departures floor. Checkin was easy but we had to pay ¥1000 to check in an hour early. The room was clean and quiet and well appointed. The hotel restaurant has a very Japanese menu, not surprising really, but there are,any cafes and restaurants outside in the terminal. We also had to pay ¥2000 to stay in the room two hours beyond the 11:00am checkout time. If you’re looking for a place to stay at Haneda Airport, it worked quite well for us.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We chose this hotel since we were arriving late into Haneda. It was not a disappointment since the hotel was conveniently located at the end of the International Terminal’s departure floor (third floor). It was a 10-minute walk from the arrival hall.The restaurants in the airport (4th floor) was a 5-minute walk from the hotel.Our standard room size was of Japanese standard of about 18 square meters. The breakfast was average without much variety. The breakfast area was a bit small but the seating area was spacious.Overall, I would recommend this hotel for its convenient location. Suitable if you have an early departing flight or late arriving flight into Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I did a last-minute, 6-hour stay in the Royal Park's transit hotel area in the international terminal, and it was the best decision ever. I was feeling unwell and couldn't fathom sitting at the gate for my nearly 5-hour layover. It felt amazing to be able to nap and take a hot bath between my flights. Check-in was easy and quick, and the room was exactly what I needed.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We flew from UK and spent our first night here in Japan before travelling on to Sapporo . The hotel is very conveniently located within the airport. The rooms are quiet. There are lots of places to eat within the airport terminal.
user_name:
Caf92
Henley in Arden, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We only stayed here for one night, we flew from Hiroshima and had an early morning flight to London the next morning. The room was clean but very tiny ok for an overnight stay with a short walk into departures.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you have an early flight out of Tokyo and don't fancy negotiating the morning rush, then I'd highly advise staying here the night before. The location is fantastic, right in the International terminal just to the side. Rooms were luxurious, clean and most importantly very quiet. The restaurant and bar was very nice although Haneda terminal offers around 20 or so restaurants / food outlets of multiple choice also. Check out isn't until 11am so literally popped my suitcase down to the airline check in early and went back up to the hotel for a very wide variety breakfast and show. Would highly recommend if your flying out early.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located in the International Terminal building access to the hotel was subtlety hidden, although this was not helped by ongoing building work.Check-in was quick and efficient, with the staff, thankfully, speaking excellent English.The room was compact by Western standards, although spacious by Japanese standards.The room was well equipped and, of course, came with the obligatory all singing, all dancing (or should that be all washing) lavatory.Breakfast was included although it was very much geared towards being Japanese style which may be something of a culture shock to first time visitors to Japan.There is an automated checkout system which makes the process simple.Is it value for money, that’s subjective, for an airport hotel and the convenience it probably is - just.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very convenient as the hotel is located within the airport. Easy to find this hotel after arrival. Room is small but clean and decent. There are many toiletries provided as well. Subway to city is not too far.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The lobby looks great once you can find the hotel tucked away in a corner of the airport. Check-in was robotic. The room was small and boring but quiet. The restaurant. Tailwinds was APPALLINGLY BAD. Most restaurants in the airport only serve Japanese food. This looked promising as it served Western food. However do not make the mistake of going after 21:00hr as I unfortunately did. The menu is seriously reduce to almost nothing of interest and the staff lose the service idea and don't really serve you. I ordered a salad waited nearly an hour (when there were 2 people in the restaurant!!!) to be told they hadn't taken my order! How rubbish is that. Go anywhere else but here. Awful!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The reason why I booked this hotel is purely it's close to the airport as we had a transit for overnight. As planned, we just go downstair (or up depends what floor you are in) to 4/F and you are straight to the departure hall for the international flight.The hiccups we got was the staff was not flexible in providing early check in (just two hours) and requested charge Yen1000 per hour. In fact, we have an early flight in the next morning so in total we only stayed about 12 hours in the room.All the room facility is good and clean. However, the tap handle in the sink of the bathroom is a bit dangerous. When I turned on the water at the middle position it hits my forehead when I lower my head and wash my face. Lucky it didn't hit my eye.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Nice hotel right inside the Haneda airport. The rooms were not big but comfortable and very clean. You don't hear the airplanes at all and we slept very well. The decor however could be brighter. The breakfast was delicious with Japanese options along with tasty pastries and juices. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Easy access to public transportation. Overall a very good experience.
user_name:
Alexz10003
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived at Haneda airport at 3am from Manila. Our flight to SF was 7 hours away. It was a great decision to check in at the royal Park Hotel at terminal. We had a good sleep, refreshed and ready for the long flight to the USA.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We were concerned about getting stuck in the morning rush so we decided to spend our last night at the Royal Park. It really made for a stress-free morning and easy access to the airport is the best feature.Plenty of places to grab some food. Well worth the stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Excellent location for early morning flight - located in the international departures terminal. Nice hotel, clean rooms, quirky design, helpful check in staff etc. Let down though by the quality of the food and service in the hotel restaurant. Far below international / Tokyo standards. Best to go into the airport terminal where there are many choices

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Our flight arrived after 11pm from Okinawa and the connecting flight home departed the next morning. So, we chose to stay at the airport. The hotel is very conveniently located inside the departure hall of Haneda’s international terminal. Check-in and check-out were extremely quick. Room was rather small but got all the amenities. If you have an early connecting flight to catch, stay here.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had an early morning flight to Beijing so we chose to spend our last night in Tokyo here. Having left the Park Hyatt for here the room was relatively small but still ideal for the one night. The hotel has a reasonable bar and restaurant but there’s still a good choice of other restaurants within a 5 min walk in the airport. Staying here certainly beats worrying about the Tokyo transport in rush hour

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed in the Transit Hotel side, having to endure a 13 hours layover overnight. This place really made our wait bearable with their 12-hours block, perfect for a good night sleep to have us refreshed and ready for our next leg of long-haul flight. With windows overlooking to the Tokyo skyline, we felt like as if we were spending a night in Japan without having to clear Immigration. The bathroom is particularly excellent.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This was a great find, right in the international terminal. Modern hotel with good restaurant and literally a short walk to departures. Ideal for stopover and rapid checkout is a real bonus! Recommend going for the breakfast to get a good start to the day.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I did not have a reservation with this hotel but took the chance there might be a room available. Finding it was fairly easy - there are large maps positioned throughout the airport that clearly indicate locations of everything.The check-in desk and area is very small and basic. I was lucky that one last room was available. Check-in was fast. There is a small lounge area next to the check-in desk where you can relax and have a hot drink or snack.The room was very small, but well-furnished, and everything looked brand new. As a single traveller, I did not find the room size to be an issue, however if the double rooms are similarly sized it would be a tight fit for 2 people.It was immaculately clean and there was a decent size bathroom with a bathtub and good shower. Pajamas, slippers and all toiletries that you could need were supplied. The bed was comfy but the pillow was a bit strange - it had a hard plasticy end which was a tad uncomfortable.It was very quiet - surprisingly so for a transit hotel.Most airside transit hotels are quite mediocre and well used. And expensive. That being said, this one was quite pleasant and I thought not badly priced for what you get. All in all a comfortable and ejoyable stay and I would not hesitate to stay again should I have another long layover in Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Pro : quiet, 20 seconds from departure gates, many restaurants at 2 mn walking distance, perfect small room, simple but good breakfast with local specials like "sesame tofu" Cons : terrible, weird, uncomfortable pillows

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Me & friend arrived almost midnight, so checking in was a breeze. Staff can speak good English. There is still eateries then and we had supper before we slept to prepare for next day tour. JR office opened at 645am for us to exchange our JR Pass and we were well rested enough to begin our Tokyo tour!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: we had a just one night stay, during a stop over. The hotel is located inside the airport, it can be easily reached by feet, so no transportation is needed. We had a standard room, quite small honestly, but had all we needed. Clean bathroom, comfortable bed. The breakfast was fantastic, unforgettable. Price was fine. Recommended

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My flight from Hanoi arrived at Haneda at 10pm, and my departure to SFO wasn't until 3pm the next day. The hotel is located on level 3 of the airport, behind section L. Not too difficult to find and not too far of a walk from the arrivals area.The room was rather small but comfortable - fine for one person, would be a bit crowded for two. The hotel provided pajamas which was nice, as I didn't have to dig through my suitcase to find them. The room had a TV, A/C, and a small but efficient bathroom with hairdryer and toiletries. Unfortunately I didn't see a coffee or tea maker in the room. The restaurant associated with the hotel - Tailwind - stops serving at 10:30pm. All in all, a good choice if you have to overnight at Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Our flight arrived into Haneda Airport from Okinawa at 3pm and we had a flight out of Haneda at 8am the next morning, so it made sense for us to spend the night here. Check-in was swift and professional, the room was small but very clean with a nice bathroom and gowns/slippers etc. We dropped our things and headed straight into downtown Tokyo to spend the evening with friends, taking only around 30 mins. Obviously, you wouldn't opt to stay here if you were looking for a fancy extended holiday but for the purpose it is built to serve, it does a great job! Also, as others have mentioned, though we didn't spend time there, the airport has loads of shops and eateries, plus the observation deck just upstairs.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We made a booking to stay over as we landed near 2am. Superbly convenient for those who have early morning flights too. Room was clean, with sleeping robes & all things to clean oneself so no worries of having to open/re-pack luggages. Love the fact that Haneda Airport is filled with so much shops and food eateries! The viewing zone in the morning is also a great place to start/end. Easy access to various hotels using Limousine Bus .. in our case was to Tokyo Disney Resort, at a breeze n comfort of 20mins!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I usually don’t rate hotels as high as I am about to but this hotelDeserves a special mention.I have travel the world over for the last 25 years working for an airline and can definitely say that this hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed at.Service is faultless, staff are the most polite and accommodating I have ever come across.Not cheap but well worth the expense.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived at 11:30am and was told that we couldn't check in before 15pm. Although this was expected, we brought our 2 toddlers around the airport to wait for the check-in time. The kids were tired by the time we return to wait for check-in time at about 14:30pm and understandably they were making not so quiet while waiting at the lobby. The hotel front came and told me to tell the kids to be quiet, lecturing that as a parent I should keep the kids quiet (try telling a 1-year old toddler to keep quiet). This should be a hotel front staff, servicing guests, and not a moral police! They should have large warning messages in their booking site that they do not welcome young children.Seeing that the hotel has ZERO empathy, we decided to cancel immediately and move to another hotel, towing 2 toddlers along. If I could have given no stars for this hotel if possible. We have booked 2 months in advance and was excited with the location and reviews. Never have I been so disappointed with a service property.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: There’s nothing ‘royal’ nor ‘park’-like about this hotel.We were told that we couldn’t check in before 15:00, which was exceptionally frustrating, but when we saw some other people checking in to their rooms at 14:00, we asked why we couldn’t do the same. We were told there would be an additional charge of 1,000 yen, and that this was hotel policy. Given our room was ready, and 2 of our other cases were already in the room, I spoke with the Duty Manager, and eventually we were allowed to check in.The hotel only had the one restaurant, with an exceptionally limited choice of menu for lunch, so we ate our in the airport.There was no lounge to relax in, and no bar, other than in the restaurant.Even though we’d booked a deluxe room, it was very small, although the bed was large and reasonably comfy. The bathroom was also exceptionally small, but then I guess this IS an airport hotel.Aside from the convenience of being adjacent to the airport, this hotel has little to offer, and I wouldn’t recommend.PS. Although the hotel website says it does room service, we couldn’t find anything in the room with a menu or even offering room service, so we had to abandon that idea .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Unusual charge - we stay in quite a few hotels during our travels and at times would stay at a hotel near the airport to facilitate an early departure or a late arrival. After visiting Osaka and area, we left Tokyo via Haneda airport with an early departure the following day, so we decided to stay at the Royal Park Hotel after reading some reviews and thought that it would be alright for 1 night, knowing that the room will not be luxurious or big with the normal amenities.We arrived at around 1.30pm and were told that yes, the room was ready and available, so I thought great, we could unload our luggage and have lunch somewhere. The check in person followed with a comment that check in time was 3.30pm and if we wanted to check in right away, there would be an additional charge of 1,000 Yen. I thought that common practice for most hotels is that if the room is available upon check in, then we could check in and have access to the room. I understand that if the check out time is noon and if you stay beyond that, then an additional charge could apply. The question then became that since the check out time was noon the next day and our flight was at 10a.m., so we left the hotel 2 hours before which would be 8a.m., should we not be compensated for the early check out? This became the rhetorical question since the check out was done by a machine.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I usually stay at Hiltons, but given the location chose here. We arrived at hotel at approx. 11am, so they minded the luggage which was very helpful. Check in was easy, however, there is an extra visitor fee to pay on arrival. Room was tiny, with only room to walk around the edge. Beds were good for us (firm), but pillows are Japanese type, so have something extra if you don't like your head lying flat on the bed. We ate dinner and breakfast at the hotel restaurant which was good. Our plane did not leave until 5pm, so the hotel minded our luggage again until check in time of 2pm. Only recommend for one night.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Our flight was at 9AM the following day so we decided to book our last night at the Royal Park Hotel. We're glad that we did.The room was surprisingly spacious. It has almost everything that we need except for a place to plug our devices next to the bed. That's about it. The water pressure was excellent. I had the best shower experience for this trip in this hotel. As for the food scene, there's a convenience store near the monorail station, and restaurants and shops just one floor up the check in area. Really awesome. The check out was so fast and convenient. We'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is located on the same floor than the international departures. Very convenient for early flights. Rooms were spacious and with all services. Check in and check out were quick and efficient.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed 1N in a premium room during a hectic layover, and is definitely recommended for late international arrival and layover.Likes:- Extremely convenient to reach via the departure hall of Haneda airport- English is widely spoken- Clean room with all amenities needed for quick layover- Nice big bottle of free mineral water - Fast to check in/out with automated kiosk- Comfortable bed- nice view of airside from my room and you don’t hear any airport noise- decent breakfast spreadDislikes- rooms are tightly packed so inter room and walkway noise is apparent. Especially a bunch of noisy kids were playing along the walkway during my stay- Is not the cheapest place to stay, so while recommended, would still recommend research and considering other nearby properties should your schedule permit

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night as we had an early morning flight from Haneda. We stayed in a premium comfort room which was reasonably large (for an airport hotel) and comfortably furnished with small bathroom and shower over bath. We ate in the Trade Winds restaurant which had both Western and Japanese food and were happy with the quality. As it is part of the International Terminal building, the Royal Park is very convenient for the airport and is only steps away from the check-in area. We would stay there again, but overall we would say it is functional rather than luxury.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights and checked out to catch a flight on 19 April 2019 at 2019 at 0900 hrs.The only lady (A) at the front desk refused ( yes refused) to check us out but instead insisted we use one of 2 machines. When we had a an issue as the machine that swallowed up the 2 room cards and I could not proceed, I had a piece of paper saying that I should proceed to the same front desk lady (A) as there was an issue. She then asked another lady (B) to deal with the issue. I handed that piece of paper ( error message from the machine expecting help and assistance but instead the second lady (B) went inside the office and never came out hiding and avoiding us ( Hiding - no joke) and I waited for ca 5 mins before asking someone else ( man) who appeared. asked for help and he could not resolved the issue either.At the end he kindly checked us out as we need to catch a flight and I was more irritated with the behavior of the front desk lady ( A+B) who went hiding. We stayed at this hotel many times and this was the worst experience I ever had for many years. The hotel website is not interested in feedback as there is no option to write to them to help them improve so I had to use tripadvisor as the last resort.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Too expensive for the quality. Front desk service rather confusing and minimal english. Hope I was only charged once for the room. Bed itself is ok, sheets are clean, toilet clean. Not too sound proof, can hear corridor noise.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After travelling around Japan we decided to stay here for 2 nights as we had a 6.30 am flight. Stayed in a twin Hollywood room which was very small and had 2 beds pushed next to each other but was ok. It’s only 30 minutes into central Tokyo on the train. Check in and out was smooth. The sound proofing is great apart from the hall and you can hear people coming and going. I would stay here again if I was flying out of Haneda as you cannot fault the location but would stay in a bigger room.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We came here for a few hours of sleep before boarding our plane. We specifically asked for 2 separate twin beds and what we got in this tiny room was 2 connected beds. Throughout the booking process this was not mentioned, nor was the photo indicative of these 2 connected beds. After asking reception to change rooms we were told there’s nothing they can do and we could upgrade for another 5000 Yen. We obviously refused and asked to talk to the manager (did not help whatsoever). We are left very disappointed and will not come back here even if it’s just for 1 night. Would not recommend this hotel- you don’t know what you’re getting. Avoid if possible.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After finding that Haneda TIAT would not honor any elite airline or credit card arrangements for lounge access, I shuffled out of their faces and located the transit hotel (near Gate 114). The Royal Park Hotel has industry standard six hour rates of ¥11,000 ($100); but, no discounts for any reason, affiliation, or lame excuse! However, they do have a small freshen up room with a shower, tv, internet (no bed, no toilet) for ¥2,000, that turned out to be just what I needed and worth it. Still, I will likely avoid Haneda in future for connecting flights only. It’s a great airport if your destination is TYO.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is actually part of the airport so perfect for those early morning flights. Check in was not that good we arrived at two in the afternoon (Check in 3pm) to be greeted by a grumpy receptionist who simply did not want to do anything. I insisted that we could do all the preliminary checks like passport copying and sign in, then return a 3pm to access the room which is what we did. We returned at about 3.30pm meeting a new receptionist this was a young trainee she was completely different from our first being perfect smiling and very welcoming. The room was OK but nothing special displaying signs of being what one could say well used. Our room was on floor 8 which gave us complementary breakfast and a coffee in the afternoon (only one coffee each). Overall the hotel is OK but not as good as some in Tokyo for the same price. If we had been on an afternoon flight my preference would be to stay in central Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Unless you enjoy sleeping on the hardest mattress and most uncomfortable pillow, avoid this hotel. We complained about the pillow (half normal but very soft and half Japanese beads) and eventually we were bought one rock hard pillow. I asked for two and it was refused. After a lot of backwards and forwards I was told I could not have another pillow and I could not receive any money off the room despite being unable to sleep. I cannot believe that a 4* hotel only has one spare pillow. Absolutely disgraceful. The hotel is dark and gloomy, very unwelcoming. The staff could not accommodate us. The room is very small and hard for two people to fit in with cases. Only benefit is we can roll out of bed into the departure lounge.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is located in the international terminal so if you are using it to before a early morning domestic flight you will have to transfer via the free airport bus.The beds are very hard and the pillows of Japanese persuasion with beans? and very little filling.The breakfast was actually pretty good with a wide selection of offerings.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The only reason I am rating this hotel at this level is because I found hairs in my bath tub and that is like a violation to basic cleaning standards for a hotel. However the hotel is great, the staff is brilliant and it is perfect if you have an early flight the next day. With the monorail you can be in central Tokyo in 30 min and it is only 5min walking distance from the hotel

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel can easily be found in the Haneda international airport by going to section L of the check-in desks. We stayed a couple of times before early onward travel. You can leave luggage there between visits. There is an excellent restaurant, with a wide range of European and Japanese cuisine but be warned last orders are 9pm. The breakfast was very good again with European and Japanese cuisine, lots of fresh fruit too. The hotel rooms were completely soundproof despite building works right outside. the lifts did not work without using your key card so only guests had access to floors other than reception. A good security measure.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Being at the Haneda airport, the Royal Park Hotel is very convenient to travels. The only draw back is that the rooms seem very small for westerners. Even selecting what we thought would be a larger room, my husband and I were very hardpressed to keep our luggage (two carry on bags and two snowboard bags) in the room with us without getting in the way of the exit.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived quite late so decided to stay at The Royal Park Hotel in Haneda for one night. It is located in the departure terminal of the airport and the hotel is near aisle L. We booked the Hollywood twin room however they are small (18-20 sqm) and we just about managed to fit in 2 big suitcases. They offered us night suits which was quite nice. Though they was a strange smell in the toilet - seemed some plumbing issue. We didn't bother to complain as it was already past mid night and we had an early start the next morning. It was fine for a one night stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The location is obviously good for early departure. The main problem is that the wall is very thin and Chinese crews come and go; but they don;t shut up in the corridor. as a result, after spending too much at this hotel without breakfast for a nothing special small room, I could not sleep at all. I was waken up so many times every time some crews leave the room with their colleagues.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I decided to spend here my last night in Tokyo, having a flight to HK at 6.25am. The location couldn’t be better! 5m walking gym the departure/check-in area of the International Terminal. Very nice lobby, fast and efficient staff. Unfortunately I was given a room at Floor 2 which is basically-2, no view at all. However the room was quite ok in terms of space, nice bathroom with bath tub, immaculate clean, super comfy bed. It’s definitely on a pricey side (although I had found a deal for $150/n) however it’s very good value for money and so handy, if you’re departing very early to your next destination.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Right at the Haneda airport international terminal very convenient even I’m arrived at 2 am with my next connecting flight at 11 am. Clean room with nice shower and . Feel so good to soak in the tube after long flight. Easy to find something to eat as well if you are hungry. The bed is comfortable. The room is a bit small but it big enough for 1 person with 2 luggage.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Landed in the airport around midnight and got hit with a long line at the arrival checkpoint. Got lost a little bit trying to find this place, but here's the main gist on finding this place: you go to the third floor (departure area) and go towards the "L" section and head toward the back (opposite of the prayer room) there should be a long hall and squirreled away in the back of an escalator is the "Royal Park" sign light. Got checked in at 1 AM and requested late check out until 2 PM, at the time it was around an extra 2,000 yen for late check out. Got my key, scanned my key on the elevator to get to the designated floor, and into the room I go. Not much space to work with, but serviceable even with a check-in luggage. Found a complimentary water in the refrigerator. Bathroom was surprisingly big. I can extend my foot fully in the bath tub, which is rare for me in Japan (I'm 5' 9" or 175 cm). Bed felt a bit on the firm side and be careful when you lay your head on the pillows, they provide two completely different pillow: one thin and pretty soft; while the other one is rock hard with nearly inflexible beads inside! Sound wise I was really surprised that I can't really hear the airplanes going off, but I can hear people outside the halls talking. Definitely recommend this place if you arrive in Haneda late or preparing for an early leave!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It is very easy to get confused booking Royal Park Haneda: there is a transit area airside, and an overnight hotel land side. I don't think the web site distinguishes these clearly enough, and I regrettably had a reservation at the "wrong" location -- but this got fixed upon checkin.Rooms are small, clean, perfect for a few hours to have a nap on a long layover without having to clear immigration. There are plenty of places to eat in the air terminal not associated with the hotel.
user_name:
TransConFlyer
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We were 3 people/adult, family, stayed 1 night before departure to our home country. The hotel is very clean, cozy athmosphere, spacious and nice bathroom with bathtub.The loby at same floor with airline check in counter. Its very easy access and near to find foods and other shops within the airport. We can even take the airport troley to our room

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: So glad we choose a airport hotel for 8 hour layover. We were going to just wait in the lounge, but decided to pay the extra. So glad we did. We felt fresh as a daisy on our next flight. Great hotel. Money well spent .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located airside at HND this hotel is perfect for a short stay 4 - 8 hours nap and shower. The rooms are small and but comfortable. Quiet, no airport noise and the bath room is well stocked with all you need to freshen up.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Love it. We arrived at 7:30 pm. We visit Tokyo very often, but this time we have a lot of luggages, and staying in Tokyo for only 3 nights, so we use this hotel as our base. From Haneda to Shinagawa is only 10 - 15 minutes depends on the train, or 25 minutes to Hamamatuscho on Monorail so it's very convenient to get around. Lots of eatery in the airport as well as 7-11. Next time we are in Tokyo for a short time. This is where we will stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I was a bit reluctant to stay here considering it was part of the airport terminal but am glad I did. I had an early arrival into Tokyo well before hotel check-in time and was able to leave my bags with them and start exploring on the same day. The hotel is easily accessed with train and monorail lines connecting Tokyo really quickly. The hotel rooms are compact but offer a decent amount of space. The bathroom is very clean and modern and the window opens onto nothing but a wall. There is no view in the room I had but there was ample light come into the room. The room was quiet with no aircraft noise. There were plenty of venting machines and food outlets nearby. Overall for the quality of this hotel and the 3 nights I stayed here I would definitely stay here again if having a holiday in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I was traveling through Tokyo and my connecting flight was 24 hours apart so I decided to stay at this hotel since it is conveniently located in the International Terminal at the Haneda airport. I arrived at almost 11pm at night and passing through customs and immigration was pretty quick. After doing a little research on this hotel online I was able to find the hotel easily at the far end of the check in lobby of the international terminal. Look for a travelers review with good photos on how to get here if you find it difficult. There are also signs directing you to the airport hotel. The hotel is outside of the security check point so you do not have to worry about that step in trying to access this hotel. Just go through all the check points, pickup your luggage and after you get to the arrivals lobby, go upstairs one level and walk to the end of the check in lobby on the left side (by the "L" counters) and follow the signs.I had booked a standard single room for a pretty good price considering I was staying here the night prior to Christmas Eve. I booked the room in October and was able to get the early bird rate. Check in was easy and quick despite a slight language barrier and the nice woman at the front desk gave me a room on the premium (8th) floor at no extra charge. She did this on her own accord, I did not ask her for an upgrade. I am not sure of the difference in a standard or premium room, but for this type of "single" room it was pretty nice and roomy in comparison to other single rooms I have stayed in during past visits to Japan.The room was neat and clean. There were a set of pajamas and house slippers for my use. All the needed amenities in the bathroom. The bathroom has the usual Japanese bidet type toilet, sink and bathtub/shower. The wall separating the bedroom and bathroom is all glass so if you have a room with more than one person, there is absolutely no privacy if you are on the toilet or in the shower. Not that I looked for one, but I did not notice even a curtain to pull shut. I was there alone so no problem for me there. The bed and pillow was comfortable enough for me, and I slept good. The door doesn't do a good job of blocking noise coming from the hallway outside the room as I could hear some children and their parents talking as they walked by. There is construction going on outside at this part of the airport, but I believe since it was the day before Christmas that morning, they had the day off so no noise problem.I checked out at the designated time of 11:00 am that morning and since I paid for the room when I checked in the nice lady at the front desk said I was good after I turned in my key. My flight was not until 9:00 pm that evening so they let me keep my luggage stored there. I took the monorail into Tokyo city and went exploring and shopping for souvenirs before coming back at about 6:00 pm picked up my luggage and checked in for my flight.I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the same scenario. I guess it would be good for a longer stay if you like staying in the airport environment for an extended period. I did that once at another airport hotel and though I enjoyed by stay, I wouldn't do that again just because I want to be away from an airport as much as possible.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It’s a little pricey but you pay for the convenience. The hotel is literally inside the International terminal of Haneda Airport and even with luggage, you wouldn’t need more than 5 minutes to get to the counters. Facilities are modern, and the room is decent in size. My one and only complaint is the weird pillow. It’s some strange hybrid of a fluffy and a Japanese pipe one sewn together. Ultimately gave up on it and used my own travel neck rest instead.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here for 1 night on our flight arrival day to Japan as it was already close to 10pm. Very conveniently located inside the airport. Check-in process was quite fast so you can get to your rooms quickly and have a good rest. Bathroom had all the amenities and sleeping robes provided so there was really no need to open our bags to take anything out. The only downside was we were given a room on the 2nd floor facing the carpark/worksite so there's not much of a view but it's only 1 night stay!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed for one night and found this hotel to be very convenient as it's connected directly to the airport ( departures level 3). My double room was very comfortable. Reasonable size, good free wifi, appreciated the free extra toiletries such as toothbrushes/shaving gear and bath tub. Responsive a/c and comfortable bed ( tho the pillows have an unusual neck roll). Didnt use any of the hotels facilities but the airport has loads of cheap eat options and a great observation deck. Well recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We checked in to the hotel as we will be catching a flight from Narita Airport the next morning. The bed was very comfortable and provided a good rest for the family. We had our buffet breakfast at the cafe and the food was good. The only downside is that the room was quite small in size.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After two days in the Mountains and a long train journey back to the Airport, the overnight stay at the Airport before the long journey back to the UK was just what I needed to recharge my batteries.The service was let down a little by the surly waiter in the restaurant who had advised us we had 10 minutes to order before they closed. The room and bathroom were lovely, comfortable and slept very well.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Arrived in Tokyo late (around 11pm) as such booked this hotel at the Haneda International terminal. Great location, just go down one floor from arrival level (2 min walk). There is convenience store on the way. Staff are friendly, room is spacious, clean and nice, with all amenities needed. They helped me receive a parcel before my arrival. Reasonably priced.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This would be my favorite hotel to stay at if you need a convenient place prior to a flight. The place is extremely clean, updated, spacious and quiet for a good rest. The room I got was very large (not sure if I got upgraded?!) and had a king bed, bathtub and shower. They also provided toiletries and bathrobe. I had a wonderful stay and everything was very modern and updated. I will definitely stay here again. Haneda is far from the major attractions, but it's a great strategy to stay here on your last day if you have an early flight out the next morning, so you can beat the commute, be well rested and spend some time exploring the beautiful airport!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel makes me want to stay at airport hotels in the future! We had an early morning flight, so we decided to check-in during the afternoon and spend the rest of the day exploring the airport shops. It's so convenient to go in and out from the airport to other stations, and then you don't need to worry about your luggage or finding coin luggage space. You can come here, wake up, and shop at a leisurely pace around the airport. The amenities are amazing! This was the most spacious hotel all the places we stayed at in Japan. They provided toiletries, bathrobe, and their amenities were all very new. The place is extremely clean. The washroom was extremely spacious and luxurious. I took a bath in the large bathtub and there was also a shower. The bed was a king sized bed too. I highly highly recommend staying here if you need a place for a quick night or two before flying out. The staff here were also very friendly and efficient.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights pre cruise, iris in the hotel itself so a quick place to find when getting off a 10hr flight, rooms small but had everything needed, very clean bedding lovely, beds comfy. Staff excellent very helpful, we did. Day trip from there public transport all the way, easygoing Japanese people.food excellent plenty of choice.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed there on our last night before flying back to Europe. The room was nice and comfortable. The hotel is ideally located IN the airport, on the departure level of the international terminal. Even though we could see the planes taking off and landing from our window the room was very quiet. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Perfect place to stay if you are on a long layover without the hassle of commuting to the city. Service was good and efficient. Room was typical Japan clean. Easy check-in, simple and clean rooms. One can get a mini experience of the quaint small alley Tokyo restos inside the airport. Simple walk to the airline check-in counters. Will definitely stay on my next long layover in Haneda!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A decent hotel right inside the Haneda international terminal. They run a strict 15:00 check in, we arrived at 14:35 and were told to come back after 15:00, really, you’re in an airport show some sense? Stayed here deliberately because they have a bar and you can get late food, however disappointed to find the hotel was under refurbishment so when we returned at 9pm we had to go into the terminal to eat. Rooms are tidy and well equipped, I’ll come back next time, hopefully the bar will be open!!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had a Premium Double Room of 18 sq metres, of which the bathroom occupied 3 sq metres. Staff are friendly and speak good English, with reception open 24x7. Good soundproofing kept the airport noise out. Room features free wifi, airconditioning, safe deposit box, flat-screen TV, humidifier and coffee machine. Adequate powerpoints to charge devices. Good breakfast spread of both western and Japanese dishes.The hotel is directly connected to the 3rd floor of the International Terminal, a 5-minute walk from the arrival hall. A convenient layover for those connecting with a domestic flight the next day, as there are check-in facilities nearby for the domestic flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Got to the hotel @ 2:15 and was told my room was ready, but if I wanted to check in before 3 they would charge me extra. Seriously? If I hadn’t already paid for the room when I booked it, I would’ve taken my business elsewhere for that reason alone. After a long international flight and that is what you tell your customers? No thank you.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Need to stay overnight waiting for transit,Hotel size quite big,Room are small but comfortable,It has everything except body lotion,It sits right upstairs in Haneda Airport,Food court inside airport has choice of food,It's more money dine at the hotel restaurant,Beer machine on every floor,No need to go anywhere.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My international flight got in too late to make a domestic connection in Japan so I booked this hotel. It is quiet and clean with friendly staff- most of them spoke English.Rather than paying the overpriced fee for breakfast I just wandered out of the hotel for a 5 minute walk to one of the many cafes open at the Airport.Also s wonderful bathroom with a large walk in shower- just the thing after a 10 hour flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Rooms are clean and comfortable and have most amenities so you don't have to unpack anything if just there for an overnight. Rooms are small and priced based on convenience but very worth it for early departures. I've stayed at First Cabin a few times but staying in this hotel is so much quieter and easier to relax. Entrance to hotel is way at the left of all the ticket counters on 3rd floor.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had an early morning flight so it was easier to stay at Haneda. Hotel was very convenient. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was huge by Japanese standards! Also had an actual bath! Overall felt relaxing and luxurious.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It was proving difficult to get reasonably-priced, accommodation in downtown Yokohama, so I opted to stay at the Royal Park, Haneda Airport. Enjoyed my stay. Hotel staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Rooms are compact, but ultra-clean and comfortable. Train and bus access to Yokohama and parts of Tokyo was surprisingly cheap ($4-$10) one way. All public transport was wifi-enabled. Staying at the Royal Park was a good move.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Only location was good, although the entrance was far difficult to find. Completely overpriced for such a tiny room, as even a middle sized suitcase can't open on the floor. No table/chair available, smelled bad from bathroom. Not friendly reception, no bell service. Unless you are desperately wanting to stay in a hotel INSIDE the international terminal, I wouldn't recommend.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a very good airport hotel. You’re directly in the airport close to all the great Haneda eateries and shops. There are slippers and pyjamas, the shower is great and the beds are comfy. Rooms are small but it’s Tokyo, they all are. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed for one night before early flight home. Vehicle entrance was closed so transfer driver had to park in multi-storey and we walked a fair way through the terminal which was ok though. Check-in and out seamless. Easy lift access to room with luggage trolleys. Room on the small side but fine for a night with three beds, clean and smart enough. Bar area soul-less airport hotel. Acid test-slept fine, up and out early and 15 mins after leaving the hotel we were checked-in, through security and in the JAL lounge!Efficient airport hotel. Fuji view in the morning a bonus!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed before an early morning flight. Based right adjacent to the departures terminal. Signs to the hotel weren’t very obvious at first. Staff efficient. Suitcases arrived by luggage forwarding and waiting for us on arrival. Room fine and quiet And clean.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I booked a Premium Comfort Single room for day use following an overnight flight, while I waited for friends to arrive later on in the day. The room I had was tiny, but functional with an equally tiny washroom/shower! Given the purpose of my stay, I did not need anything more, but a consideration for someone who might plan a longer stay.Breakfast was in the form of a buffet; it was decently stocked with mostly Asian but also Western food options and drinks. I received a breakfast voucher upon check in which enables access to the restaurant.The hotel is connected to the International Terminal only a short walk from both Arrivals and Departures. A clean, basic and functional stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Good overnight stopover hotel adjoining the departure area of Haneda's international departure area. Friendly, good staff, quiet rooms and a decent breakfast. However, the room layout feels distinctly unfinished (or not very well thought through). This is especially the case in regard to power outlets, which seem to have come as an afterthought. There aren't many and their placement is weird. Not enough what most business travellers will need. The same goes for a lack of desk space.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We booked this hotel because we wanted to catch the early train out of Tokyo, and we arrived in the night.Some quick facts:1. This hotel had everything that travelers need without having to use any of our toiletries in the luggage. 2. The hard pillow took a while to get used to. 3. The free WiFi was fast and you could watch movies online with no problem.4. Room is comfortably sized, quite huge for a Japanese hotel.5. Water pressure was good.6. Warm water in shower stayed consistent throughout.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed one night here during a trip from the US to Hiroshima. The hotel is very convenient, with an ideal location for transiting passengers. It is attached to the International Terminal (terminal 3). I arrived at Narita and took the Limousine Bus directly to the International Terminal and was there. The room was fine and quiet, and the bed comfortable. There are many choices for food at Haneda airport, so you don't really have to go anywhere else. There is also a free shuttle to the other terminals to get your domestic flight the following day. This hotel is a very good choice if you are transiting at Haneda. I would not choose this for other purposes, despite it being a perfectly reasonable hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After my long day of traveling, The Royal Park Hotel at Tokyo Haneda was an Oasis. I did not have to open my suitcase. Nightshirts were laid out along with slippers and bathrobes. Bottled water was in the mini-fridge. In the bathroom, I found a brush, toothbrush with toothpaste, and razors, individually wrapped along with the conventional toiletries. There was a vending machine with beer and other drinks on my floor. This was also a convenient location for ground transportation, as buses and the rail had connections at Haneda Airport. There was some construction in the area, but my room was quiet and the view was nice. This was a relaxing and convenient stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Really superior airport hotel. Great restaurant and breakfast. Reasonable cost for food and drink. Loads of extra items provided in the rooms to save unpacking ie pyjamas shaving kit etc. 5 minute walk from BA check in so very convenient. Will return.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Pros: large comfortable room, very comfortable king size bed, air conditioning, small couch, chair & table, safe, bar fridge (not stocked), TV, hair dryer, toothpaste & brush, etc, tea and coffee making facilities, complimentary bottles of water, very efficient, friendly & helpful staff. Conveniently situated in the Haneda airport.Cons: nilHighly recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here for one night as we had an early flight. Worked out around £150 which is more than I'd normally pay but needs must. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. Nice shower / bathroom. No cupboards or anywhere to put your things as seems to be the case with most Japanese hotels. Flat screen tv and free wifi

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I arrived in Haneda at 5:30am after a red eye from Singapore. Had a meeting in Shibuya at 10 and wasn’t checking into my hotel until the afternoon. The Refresh Room was a perfect spot to grab a shower and chill out for an hour. It’s very basic. A tiny room with a chair, TV, shower and sync. Shared bathroom outside. Just shy of $20 for the hour. I wish more airports had this, particularly when traveling internationally. I have needed exactly this so many times before. Will use this again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very convenient for a quick overnight, but we had to kill 2 nights (36 hours) there which proved intolerable. We tried different rooms; they're all shoeboxes and so basic as to be almost laughable. All the photos on the website give the impression of opulence. Very distorted and unfair. It was a miserable experience all round, saved only by the reasonably good restaurant and the nearby food court (but only if you like Japanese cooking). Do NOT spend more than a few hours here. A total disappointment.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is part of Haneda airport. Just take the elevator and you are in the entrance of this hotel. Huge hotel, rooms are very small. Very clean, neat and all facilities available. There is a restaurent located downstairs near the reception. Serves breakfast. Very convenient if you have an early flight to cancel as you walk off the hotel the checkin counters can be seen. Reception can communicate in english and can understand the traveller needs. Overall expensive, but a good hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Chose this location as it was actually in the Haneda Airport in the third floor of the international terminal. The Keiko train line was there - I needed it to get to my destination an hour away. Came back to the hotel, took the free shuttle to the domestic terminal for my next flight. Simple. The hotel staff speaks English. Have them write your destination in both English and Japanese. Know exactly what stations you need for the train. Once you leave the airport/hotel area it will be difficult to find someone who speaks English. I understand there are apps to use but I didn’t have a phone package, relied on WiFi in the hotel. Get an app to make calls over WiFi and you’re set. iPhone will allow calls and texting over WiFi. Hotel is very modern and very clean. The room is small but had everything I needed - tiny refrigerator, safe, private bathroom/shower. They provide toothbrush, hairbrush, shampoo, soap, towels, slippers, pajamas if you desire. I found a pizza place in the airport. The cuisine is not the same as American sushi restaurant style. Became a vegetarian for the time I was there. Tully’s coffee - the closest to Starbucks in that location - except no real cream. Cinnamon roll was ok.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Literally part of the Haneda International Terminal, hence you cannot get more convenient than this when arriving/departing. Rooms are small per Western standards, but still comfortable and welcoming after any flight. Breakfast selection was good enough with a decent mix of Japanese and Western options, yet the terminal is literally a thirty second walk away so you still have the option of going to the terminal for breakfast. Would recommend to anyone who is flying in late or has a very early departing flight and does not want to deal with the hassle of taking transportation to/from the city.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is actually in the same building as the international terminal - no shuttles!We took the airport express bus from Shinjuku - a more convenient option than the train since we would have had to change trains and had large luggage.Check in is at 3:00 pm - we were fortunate to get a room on the same level as the airline check in gates. We arrived early and were able to leave our luggage at the hotel while we walked around and had some refreshments.So we were able to leave our bags on the airport trolleys and wheel them into our room.No need to unload our large bags - they stayed on the luggage trolleys in our room.Rooms are comfortable and quite large by Japanese standards. The queen size bed had enough room to walk both sides !Staff were most helpful and courteous - as always the case in Japan!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We have stayed here for 2 consecutive February after a ski trip in Nagano prefecture. We always choose this hotel before heading home as we enjoy seeing a bit of Tokyo and other nearby cities/towns for a few more days. The rooms are extremely clean and housekeeping always replenishes the toiletries and water. Front desk is also very helpful when you ask for tips on where to go. The best part of this hotel is that it is inside Haneda Airport so you can literally check out just 2 hours before your scheduled flight or check in for your flight and go back to the room to freshen up. We will definitely stay here again when we go for another ski trip in Japan.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here as had a very early flight in the morning. On arrival the reception staff were very professional and business like. The room was clean and, as someone who has difficulty sleeping, very quiet. Numerous toiletries provided free which meant we didn't have to search our suitcases. Free WIFI provided.Checking out the next morning was again professional and very quick. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Just a couple of things. My room wasn’t cleared properly so the previous occupant’s (probably) unused packets of wet wipes were ‘mistaken’ to be mine and left on my table. I brought this to the front desk on check out and not one word from him or the manager.My room nights were prepaid but the front desk gentleman kept looking intently at the computer screen. Would be more polite to tell me what was wrong instead of ignoring me. Maybe they were using the front desk as a training ground? Poor.The bed comfortable enough but be careful you don’t book the windowless room (unless you don’t mind). Then again, it’s an airport hotel although I made the mistake of booking in for quite a few night, stupidly. Duh

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very conveniently located, especially if your flight is very early in the morning. I strongly felt that the staff need better training - smiling to customers for a start :-). They should be more attentive to help their customers who are struggling. Perhaps the hotel's monopoly in terms of its indisputably superior location lets the management neglect customer service as they can still attract enough clients without good staff. However, we would stay here again only because of the location - pity.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Review is for the transit hotel refresh rooms which are a great way to spend an hour or two if you are able to book one. E-mailing the hotel to confirm availability is a little bit of an inconvenience, I wish there was a way to book these rooms through the website more easily, especially for foreigners. Nonetheless, the staff are wonderful and everything was great.
user_name:
vmof
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park Hotel includes a transit hotel inside the international terminal at Haneda. This is accessible on departure but not on arrival if you have to clear customs. Of course, accessing the transit hotel after check-in depends on your airline desk being open, so you should check that carefully - it works fine with JAL where you can arrive a few hours early. The transit hotel has a convenient option for 6 hours although not necessarily cheap around JPY 12,000. Small but cosy double rooms with a quite decent bathroom: some tea facilities in the room, and there is also a hotel lounge although with very limited choice for drinks. You can get in and out of the hotel into the terminal, and check-in and check-out are quite efficient.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed at the Royal Park for the first time since it is the hotel my company uses and I have to say I was pleasently surprised.The room was very clean with all the amenities and some extras in the bathroom that will blow your mind if you have never seen them. (I will leave them up in the air to peak your curiosity :-))The room was not very spatious but it was confortable although I did not understand the pillows.... (again, this you have to see)There is access to all kinds of public transportation available and the terminal has many restaurants and shops to choose from.It is an airport hotel, but it is confortable and it serves its purpose so yes.... it is a great choice if you are sropping by for a quick stop or have to wait for a connecting flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Nice, clean hotel in the international terminal. Check-in was very smooth. Check-out even faster. Nice and clean room, fairly spacious. Beds, as usual in Japan, a bit to hard for my taste. Also as usual in Japan, the inflexibility with certain things. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant. Between the time we got the menus and decided (probably 3 min) the time passed 21 pm and all of a sudden the main menu was taken away from us, with no possibility to order from that one. That's what I call inflexibility. Otherwise service was nice and prompt.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here two nights as part of a birthday celebration. The price is almost 10,000 yen above other Japanese business-type hotels with similar room sizes and amenities. We chose a double-room on the 7th floor with a view to the west. Be forewarned - on a western scale this is more like a 3-star hotel, only the premium rooms on the 8th floor could be described as 4-star. They include breakfast in only some, not all of the rates, and there are no complimentary English-language newspapers and such (and BBC is the only English TV channel despite being located at a MAJOR INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT - a proper airport hotel should have CNN, Al Jazeera, ITV - there are SO MANY CHINESE GUESTS at this hotel and they don't even have CCTV etc)The rooms are decently appointed but storage space and the desk provided are small. My wife had to bring the mirror over to the windowsill and sit on the bed because the desk was too small and poorly-lit for doing makeup at. They do provide a small table and sofa in the corner near the bed, and this was nice to have meals at.
