The carpeting is soft and nice to walk on.The bathroom is good-sized, with a decent bathtub and German fixtures in the sink fittings. One major disappointment was at all times of day the water temperature fluctuates WILDLY in the shower, which makes no sense considering the fixings and construction are new within the last 5 years! The best feature of the rooms overall is the soundproofing - very difficult to hear outside traffic, airplanes, etc (only high-pitched childrens' voices from the hall can be heard - but that's true in any hotel). Housekeeping did quite a good job seeing as they are cleaning up after travelers, but the towels are the same miniature size found in other Japanese hotels and are a little rough to the skin. Larger and softer towels are a must if this hotel wishes to satisfy customers from overseas. Check-in didn't take as long as at other Japanese hotels, but the hotel does not seem very flexible about checking in before 3 pm, and this doesn't make sense at a major airport. We did not try the restaurant as there are more inexpensive (and likely far better) options a short walk away in the terminal (and highly recommend the Turkish kebab place on the 4th floor of the terminal).Overall, because of the location and good soundproofing, I would stay here again, but probably only at a discounted price.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed at the transit hotel. I believe they have two locations at the airport. Mine was very convenient, but allowed me to catch some sleep during my 8 hour layover. All rooms seemed to be on one floor with a small lobby and reception. I thought it was expensive for my 6-hour stay, but I had to sleep. I got a very comfy room that allowed me to rest up. Convenience was the main point of this hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This wonderful hotel is just a short walk to the cruiseports. We arrived in Yokohama a day early and we delighted to stay in this beautiful full service hotel, attached to a shopping area overflowing with restaurants and boutiques. The view from our room on the 47th floor overlooked Yokohama harbor and was awesome. This area is great for strolling along the waterfront parks and the hotel is directly across from the train station if you want to zip into downtown Tokyo . Take the Keikyu bus directly to the hotel from Haneda airport.. I would not consider another hotel in Yokohama.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Clean, fast, small rooms, very small bathroom, breakfast was reasonable. This hotel is ranked a 4 star hotel. It is not. Check in is partially automated, carry your own bags to your small room, pay $200+ for the night, no other amenities that I know of. But that’s what you expect from an airport hotel I guess. It certainly makes the Crowne at Changi look luxurious.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for a night in June because of an early flight the next day. The hotel is really pretty and the perfect choice if you need to refresh, or just get a night sleep before a flight. Plus, the airport offers SO many additional restaurants and options, that makes this hotel the perfect choice for a night stay.The room was pretty small, but perfect.Breakfast was not included on our rate, and the value is not really worth it based on the options offered throughout the airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here one night after landing about 10 pm and before leaving again at 10:30 am. Quick to find in the international section of airport— lots of signs. No need to go through immigration and customs — so we saved a lot of time. They offer 6 and 12 hour options, and we took 12 hour option. Easy check in and check out. Comfy bed. Pajamas available. Good bathroom with amenities including toothbrushes. Very small room and not much space to move around the bed, but that’s also similar elsewhere in Tokyo. Quiet room and hallway. Only basic food available in their lounge off lobby— tea, coffee, biscuits, dry noodles. But you can come and go and experience the food options in the terminal— many nice restaurants. We will stay here again for long layovers. It was great to get some proper sleep and take a shower.
user_name:
jenabaintheworld
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here for one night coming in from Korea to board our plane home to the US the following morning. We were told check in was at 3pm so we called and they agreed for a Noon check in at the cost of $30. We thought that was worth it coming from an early morning flight from Korea. We arrived, bedraggled, at 11.45am and were told that we could not be checked in until Noon and were asked to take a seat in the lobby. Having been traveling in Japan for the last two weeks, we had realized that their nation is very efficient and rule driven in every aspect so we understood the request. However we felt a little more leniency with 15minutes and travelers that were so obviously worn out would have been welcomed. A little 15 minute breaking of a rule would have given this hotel a better star rating. Their inability to be flexible and make an independent decision based on what they saw was not good and my husband retaliated by setting his phone alarm to ring loudly on the strike of Noon. At which point, a staff member told us that we could now check in. As with most Japanese hotels and staff, the rooms cater for every need and we could not complain. The choice of food in the restaurants in the airport is very, very limited. However, a great spot if you will be in our position of having to travel early the next morning or connecting. Oh, and there is no gym! An airport hotel without a gym for travelers was extremely disappointing. All of the negatives for the price.....not good value for money.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here before catching flight following day. It is idealy located at one end of the International Terminal. The room is fairly compact but clean and comfortable. It was well insulated with no external noise from aircraft. We really enjoyed the breakfast selection at the attached restaurant. Very good choice if you have to stay at the airport

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed there the night we arrived in Tokyo at midnight, the best option to rest before the Japanese adventure. It's actually inside the airport and it's so comfortable considering japanese hotel rooms are very small. I recommend this for people who arrived or will catch a flight very late or early. I travel in March of 2016

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here for one night as we had a long layover in Haneda. The room was big enough for my family of three and had all the amenities we needed for the night. Will definitely stay again here if we needed accommodation in Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park Haneda is the perfect spot for a short layover. As some others have noted it is slightly expensive, but I would say the location is worth the price. There are many dining and shopping options right in the terminal, and the domestic Terminals are also a short bus ride away.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Managed to drop our bags off after arriving from Kyoto, then head into Tokyo on the monorail for a last evening of fun before returning home.Ideal!A little expensive, but worth it for the convenience of being in the international teminal and having direct and quick access to central Tokyo

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: One of two hotels at the Haneda airport. I arrived about 45min ahead of the official check-in time and thought that a slightly earlier check-in would be possible. Unfortunately, this wasn't the case. Although not ideal, it wasn't too bad either as I could leave my luggage at the reception while going sightseeing in the city and when coming back for check-in got a free upgrade. My request for a quiet room was considered. The room itself was clean but the upgrade wasn't evident if I wouldn't have known. From the bathroom there's a nice view to the airport field. The room had complimentary and good WiFi. In my opinion, the cost was rather on the upper end given what you get, but considering having to catch the first flight in the morning, ok.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We flew into Narita at 3PM and had a flight out of Haneda the next morning at 10 AM. We decided to stay as close as possible to our flight out of Haneda. You could not possible get closer. This hotel is located right in the internations departure terminal. It was a 1 minute walk to our check in area. The hotel is very comfortable. The rooms are small but adequate. We were checked in quickly. There are several places to eat in the Haneda airport terminal. The hotel has a restaurant as well, but we chose not to eat there. The rooms were very quite. In my opinion the only think that would make this hotel better is a hot tub and pool.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We are so glad we stayed here for our 20 hour layover. Landed around 10pm in Tokyo and just walking with our bags to the hotel was the best part. The next morning they kept our bags secure as we roamed the other terminals. You really don't need to leave Haneda and waste time on transport when there are free airport shuttles to the other terminals and the shopping and food was fun.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Everything provided (Pjs, hair brush, etc.)! The room was very clean. Yes, it was smaller than USA rooms, however didn’t feel that way due to the layout. The breakfast was wonderful. I didn’t expect that it would be son nice. It was also very convenient for a flight layover.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located within the international terminal the location is ideal for an early morning departure. However the location is reflected in the room price.Despite being at the airport the room was quiet and we slept well. The room was japanese-size (i.e. tiny) but that's what you get everywhere in Tokyo.Check-out was quick on a vending machine and we reached the bag drop of our airline within 10 minutes of leaving our room.We had dinner before coming to the hotel so we didn't have to eat at the airport or the hotel restaurant (which seemed to be expensive).

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The location is very convenient, the hotel is clean, the reception is ok for Japanese standards, but the room is small and extremely cluttered unnecessarily and there's so much nose at the corridors. The worse though are the pillows, extremely slim and hard. They look like 300 year old used goose pillows.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Location good given it's in Departures. The light switches next to the bed have lights around them which do not turn off. Mysterious high pitched noise at various intervals e.g. at 11pm and 4am. Woke me up. People coming and going at all times which may also wake you up. Overall, given its location I'd stay again but take earplugs and an eye mask.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: First time going to Tokyo and flying back from Haneda Airport. If you have a flight before 11am and you are staying in Central Tokyo, it saves you a massive amount of stress to not have to travel at rush hour through the city. The hotel is clean with comfortable beds and you cannot even hear any planes considering it is located between 2 terminals! The entrance is next to passport control, just on the departure floor of the international terminal The airport has about 10 different restaurants of all kinds so you are not stuck to eat at the hotel restaurant. There are also shops and a SevenEleven on the same floor so you really have plenty of things to do. Would recommend it to friends who have early flights.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived late on our flight from Honolulu, which was going to be a late night arrival anyway. So, a hotel at the airport seemed a good choice. Plus, we had the tasks of activating our Japan Rail Pass, picking up a portable wifi and changing currency. So, all of this stuff wasn't going to be handled after hours at Haneda. Thankfully, you can walk right to the lobby of the hotel from the airport lobby without leaving the airport building. Check-in was easy. There are places to eat at the airport and a convenience store on the ground floor of the terminal. The room is small, but very clean and quiet. You would have never known you were at the airport. Japan hotel rooms don't have much room for big American suitcases, so be forewarned (it's not limited to the airport by any means). I found the bed to be firm which was great for me since we were both groggy from a long flight preceded by a long day. You find nearly all of the amenities you'll need while traveling in the room. If not, there's the convenience store as well as vending machines. This hotel filled our travel needs very well. We had ample time in the morning to get our rail passes squared away and figure out how to get to our next hotel in the Ginza. The price paid for this room was comparable to an additional night at the hotel used for our Tokyo stay. A great choice for us.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We enjoyed our stay here after leaving family and before the long trek back to the US. We selected a premium double. Conveniently located in the international terminal and just a few steps from all the restaurants. Room was tight but still comfortable, every space was used well. Room & Bath had everything you could need so you hardly had to open your suitcase (PJ's & robe included.) Premium was affordable and included breakfast buffet with lots of delicious choices both Japanese & European. After checking out and making our way through security we enjoyed a relaxing two hours in the transit lounge complete with refresh rooms & snacks and beverages provided at no extra charge.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed here the night before I flew home since I had an early morning flight. The hotel is convenient because it is literally in the International terminal. One frustrating part about the hotel was the check-in. This property is extremely strict on check-in time, even though they have guests coming and going all day. I had to wait a few hours before I could check-in. This to me was annoying having to wait when I was tired and just wanted a room. My room I received was a single room. The room size wasn’t bad, it just was lacking furniture like a desk. The bed was not comfortable in the single room, which had only one pillow. The other downside was the noise. The hallway was very loud at night from guests, including some employees. The location is my main reason for recommending this hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A 10 hour transit at Haneda after a 12 hour flight from Frankfurt so needed a good sleep Not cheap but very efficient, clean, and easy to access airside . Totally silent and relaxing Used AllNippon lounges before and after 6 hour stay Stays are charged at 6 hours or 12 hours or overnight I didnt need to prebook

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Our travel agent suggested staying at this hotel since we were flying in from the States on Sunday and flying to Sapporo on Monday. Great call! The hotel is clean and the staff very pleasant. We were on the premium floor so the room was perfect in size.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is connected to the Haneda International Terminal. I stayed here the night before traveling back to the United States. The rooms were nicely appointed and clean (a bit small as usual because it's a Japanese hotel). Many shopping and dining options are available in the airport. A great value!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Royal Park Haneda is currently affected by extensive building work. In particular, access is difficult, best made by being dropped off at the ground floor car/taxi/bus stand and taking the lift to 3rd floor. The hotel entrance is hidden behind airline check-in group L. Hotel check-in was swift and efficient, with our ‘Black Cat’ luggage already in the room. We had to transport our own luggage to the room, down a long corridor, so kept our trolley in our room overnight. The room was small, thankfully we were only there for a few hours. There is a bar/restaurant by the entrance. Going directly from the hotel into departures is very convenient indeed.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights for tending to business in the international terminal building. The hotel is inside the terminal building - it's not outside. It's not a holiday hotel.I did get the cheapest, most common room as the prices seemed to be exorbitantly high for any of the upgraded rooms. It turns out that all the rooms are highly overpriced and (especially the cheaper rooms) very very small. The room did not have a desk/table to work at. There were little to no place to unpack clothes. The only window in the room was in the bathroom, which looked straight into a black wall. It's really not a great place to spend any amount of time.The reception is quite well done with friendly and prompt staff. No problems experiences here. The breakfast is also very well done with wide variety and great quality.The hotel serves a functional purpose for transiting passengers and cabin crew and for the odd business meeting in the airport. For anything else, you can get a much better hotel in the city and also take in some of Tokyo's sights while you're there.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It was a very small room with barely room to open up two large luggage at the same time and walk in room. Thankfully we asked for the beds to be set up in Hollywood style (combine the twin beds together) so we could sleep with our young kid. It was a breeze to check out and walk to departure gate early the next morning. Very convenient to walk to the train station to access the city too. Overall the room is new and clean. We would stay here again if we have early or late flight out of Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is very convenient for international flights. I am disabled and we had some assistance through security, baggage retrieval and then up to the hotel. This was fortunate as otherwise the hotel is a little difficult to find from the airport. The airport staff continued to help us through the hotel check-in and on up to our bedroom. The check-in was very simple although we arrived about midnight. The staff are friendly, helpful and speak English.Our bedroom was quite adequate if not spacious. There was no chair but otherwise sufficient storage space to put clothes the night.The bed was comfortable and the room quiet. Next morning we had a good buffet style breakfast and then waited for our son in reception which was very light and airy. The hotel provided its own trolley for our bags.If flying to or from Haneda airport in the future I would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This was our second visit to this hotel which is adjacent to the departures area of Haneda airport. It is so convenient for morning flights as it takes minutes to get to check in desks. We were given a comfortable room on the same level as Reception. We arrived in time to have dinner at the restaurant beside the hotel which served excellent meals.The night before we flew we walked round the shops in the airport . More restaurants , leisure areas and even live entertainment were available for visitors to the Airport which was beautifully decorated with blossoms in huge displays. We didn't have breakfast in the morning but went straight to check in without the necessity of a taxi. Excellent hotel for an overnight pre flight stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very good location for anyone who has early or night flight at Haneda Airport. It is right at the International Terminal. Room is nice, bed is very comfort. Bathroom is big, comparing to Japanese standard size. It is very much convenient and enjoyable to stay at this hotel. Plenty of food and restaurant at the terminal. The only minor point is fridge in the room is very small and not work properly. We put some food in the fridge, but the cooling system didn't work so well.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had an early morning international flight from Haneda airport and made the wise decision to check into The Royal Park Hotel the night before. This hotel is conveniently located at Terminal 1, and is easily accessible, clean and quiet. We loaded up our luggage on the trolley on arrival at the terminal curbside and took it right up into our room, the trolley as well. This made it particularly easy to depart quickly the following morning. The room was spacious by Japanese standards, and well appointed including mini-bar, bathrobes, slippers, TV/entertainment, a full assortment of bathroom accessories, and a deep soaking bath tub! We lacked for nothing. There's a good restaurant/bar in the lobby but you also have the choice of wandering into the terminal and dining at a variety of eating establishments. This was a wonderful find and I'm so glad we discovered it. It was good value and saved us from rising at 3 am to find an expensive taxi to the airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This place was exactly what we needed! We arrived late at night, and the staff was friendly and quick, the room was large for Tokyo standards, the shower was amazing, the bed/pillow were great (the pillow was high-tech), the WiFi worked on the first try, the thermostat worked like a charm (after discovering the English instructions on the table), and the list goes on. We got to the airport late at night after a looooong day, and we were just too tired to deal with anything but perfection. The Royal Park delivered perfection for us! If you are going to be arriving at Haneda completely exhausted, do yourself a BIG favor and stay here!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed in the hotel prior to an early morning departure from Haneda airport and the hotel seems essentially designed for that purpose: it is located in the international terminal of Haneda airport. The rooms are modern, clean and a good size.We did not eat at the hotel hence cannot comment on the food/drink.Efficient check in and check out.They have a computer and printer/scanner for boarding passes etc.Overall: Good airport hotel with the main bonus being within the international terminal of Haneda airport hence ideal for early morning/late arriving flights.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed in a family room before flights. Not much to the hotel really, just a nice bedroom (lots of beds!) with bathroom in the airport. Decided that the breakfast was a bit expensive and went for breakfast in the airport, though may have been better to eat in the hotel as the options (certainly for western food) are quite limited in Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed four nights (made bookings with hotel.com) with a friend in premium floor (recommended). Big enough (about 25sqm) and smartly furnished with clean spaces and efficient housekeeping. Bath area is wonderfully divided into two (tub and washing space); the toilet is located in another room; this means that two people can privately use separate these spaces at the same time.Breakfast buffet spread offers pretty wide variety of food (Continental, Chinese, Japanese) and beverage (juices, milk, tea, coffee) items.Convenient location as the hotel is accessed directly from the 3F of Haneda international airport, making it a great choice for late night and early morning flights. This location also means proximity to reasonably priced (but good) restaurants (on the 4F of the airport).Will return.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stopped here after a 13 hour flight from Toronto. It was just what we needed after such a long flight. We got to shower and then enjoy a good nights sleep, It's a 3 minute walk from the Airport with access within the Airport. The breakfast the following morning was delicious with a variety to please many. We've no complaints and will plan to stay there again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A great hotel very clean quiet and smoke free. Lovely firm bed and pillows. BBC world service. Easy to get in and out to the heart of Toyko.Buffet breakfast very good. Airport eateries close by if needed. Best hotel we stayed at in Toyko on our budget. Well done.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a lovely hotel with very helpful staff. It is the first time I've stayed here and was very convenient for our very early morning flight. The rooms were lovely especially with the bathrooms that are encased in glass so you can see through to the bathroom from the main part of the room - might not be everyone's cup of tea but I loved it. I also enjoyed the fact that I could sit in the lovely long bath (a lot of Japanese hotels have tiny baths) and watch the planes taking off! The check in desks of the International terminal were quite literally a couple of minutes away as well as the shopping and restaurant area, as well as the traditional Japanese bridge (a replica of the original Nihombashi bridge)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The water pressure, the calming interior, all made the shower so comfortable. Of course, hansgrohe helped. They had huge bath towels and cushy lounge wear for the premium room. Stayed one night with my little one, although she kept knocking her head into the wall for the night, it was the only hotel who provided two bed rails. The ones we visited in the city only provided one. The convenience is damn shiok. We arrived by bus at the departure level of the international airport and easily traversed to the hotel with luggages and baby in tow. Went out for dinner at night and thoroughly enjoyed the proximity of the hot and cool zone to the hotel. All conveniently accessible via strategically situated lifts.The hotel's dinner was very tempting but we decided to try the restaurant at the edo street. The hotel's breakfast was pretty normal, good, but normal.For the premium room, there is actually a free drink or lounge access coupon. The lounge is at the departures transit hotel, a little too far from the ana gate so we decided to give it a miss.I will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Hotel is in the Departured area in Haneda Airport. It is a 5 minute walk to the Train Station to take you into Shinagawa where you can get to any station from there.The room is nice and comfortable. There is a fridge and kettle in the room. The Wi-Fi worked well. There are lots of restaurants outside of the Hotel where you can eat.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Picked this hotel because of early morning flight and it serves the purpose perfectly. Tokyo metro doesn't run as early as you want them to, the limousine bus from the city also don't have very early schedule, and if you're thinking about taxi be prepared to pay apx 7000 to 10000 JPY. It is so close you can get your boarding pass and go back to bed before it's time for security. We enjoyed our stay so much that we're planning to utilize them again soon.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Transited through Haneda and need a convenient place to spend the night. Convenient location. Beds are super hard and the pillow are lumpy and scratchy. I had to wad up the comforter from the other bed for a pillow. Room and bathroom were clean. Bulk toiletries. EXCELLENT water pressure. Seemed quiet enough. Breakfast in the restaurant is objectively OK but really lacks Western food. Beef curry for breakfast is a good idea, though. Checkout is by ATM-type machine and while efficient, does not give you a copy of your entire bill, just the overage on your deposit. Not helpful when submitting expenses for business travel. Next time I’ll take the subway to Yokohama where there is a Sheraton next to the station. It’s less expensive and probably has better amenities.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Usually prefer to stay in the city,but due to early morning flight, and not liking to wake up too early to catch the train, booked into Royal Park Hotel. Food wise, no issue as Haneda airport offers a wide variety of food besides hotel F&B outlets. However, the room is a small with see through glass shielding the toilet and shower rooms. This makes it hard to have guest while using the facilities. Perhaps can consider partial frosted glass?

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park Hotel, The Haneda is a very convenient option for those in transit. I had an overnight layover in Tokyo and booked a small one bed room for the night. The hotel is on the 3rd floor, conveniently located in the Intl departures terminal. Also, the monorail/trains are on the 2nd floor, which made it a breeze to go out and explore the city. Staff is wonderful and the hotel/rooms are extremely clean. There are several restaurants and shops nearby. Their Japanese style breakfast buffet was delicious. For those that want to shower and get some R&R after a long flight, I would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is located on the third floor at Haneda airport and has access to the shops and restaurants at the departure level. The hotel is quiet, cozy, and quaint. The rooms though small have a lot of character and charm. This hotel is great for singles looking for a overnight place.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you're in transit at Haneda airport, this is a good option. It's a basic airport hotel and essentially ticks all the boxes of a place where you'll be spending a single night or maybe two. Rooms (at least the one I had) are small but clean and equipped with the usual amenities. No closets though, you hang your clothes on the wall. Hangars are provided for this. The bathrooms are small but cleverly designed to maximise the space available. You can opt to eat at the hotel restaurant, which is fine, or take advantage of the various eateries in the airport terminal which are all a short walk away and offer a huge amount of variety. WiFi is good.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a great hotel for making a very easy start for an early flight - it is actually in the airport departures terminal, so couldn't be simpler. We ate at the restaurant, which was very reasonably priced and the breakfast was fine too. Staff very helpful, rooms do the job.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Arrived in Tokyo at 12am and couldn’t visit my friend until the next day so decided to stay at Royal Park for a good night of sleep and it served the purpose. room was small which is understandable but is equipped with all the basics! in room save, coffee maker, well equipped toilet. pricy but very convenient! nice view too.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed at this hotel purely for convenience, it is inside the international airport terminal building on the 3rd floor. I stayed here because my flight arrived quite late at night and I didnt want the hassle of finding my way in a new foreign country so late. Plus many city hotels close their reception at night so it is really not possible to check in. I found it was quite expensive but i was paying for the convenience as a solo traveller. The hotel itself is really nice, the lady at the check in desk gave me a room on the 8th floor which were the premium rooms. Check in was quick and there were automated machines to take payment. The room itself was small... but during the rest of my trip i found out it was a normal size by japanese standards!. The room had all the amenities you could want, it was clean and comfortable. The breakfast in the morning had a good selection of internation and local spread. Overall great hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After a long trip from the U.S., this hotel was perfect for a 12 hour layover stay. Rooms were small but adequate for the length of stay. The hotel is very modern and impeccably clean. Front desk staff spoke English well and were very helpful in assisting us plan a short trip to the city.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel could not be better placed, connected to the International terminal. We stayed for about 8 hours, arrived late at night, the hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful. The room was small, but had everything you needed for a single night and being so close it made the overnight very efficient, I felt very refreshed strolling back into the busy airport the next morning.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Easy to find and right next to the international terminal so ideal if you have an early connection - rooms are a little basic and compact but overall was perfectly acceptable. Ate in the restaurant which again was fine - there at other options on the terminal building but I just wanted to eat and crash. This a far better overall option than the excel where I stayed a week later- see my review.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I recently spent 10 days in Japan for business/fun and my wife and daughter came too. We decided to stay our first night after a ten hour flight at Haneda Airport at the Royal Park Hotel The Haneda. Best decision ever for exhausted and jet lagged travelers. The hotel was in the International Terminal a 5 minute walk from customs/departure gates, ATMs, Tokyo Monorail, spitting distance to a wide selection of shops and high quality Japanese restaurants as well as the recreated Nihonbashi Bridge! Service was excellent which is expected for Royal Park Hotels. Room was adequate and nicely modern. And best of all the complimentary breakfast buffet was first class (my daughter concurs). Great selection of food Western and Japanese but especially for those looking to get a full on Japanese breakfast experience! For an airport hotel, The Haneda could compete with any upscale hotel. For a next level of experience I recommend The Shiodome another Royal Park Hotel in Tokyo. But if you want a stress free, enjoyable and high quality place to stay after a long flight to Tokyo before going elsewhere stay at The Haneda!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I booked this for my spouse as he had 24hours in Tokyo. We've toured very recently and he just needed a place to rest after an emergency visit to Viet Nam. This detail is included because his priority is rest, get sleep and he's fairly picky regarding comfort. Well, for the first time in 10 days, he had more than 5hrs of sleep. 9 actually. His testimony- Loved it. Very clean, very comfortable, twin deluxe was surprisingly large for a transit hotel. The room even had a soaking bath. And sooooo quiet for the whole 24 hours. Exactly what he needed and what we have grown to anticipate from Japan. He stayed in our usual resorts in Viet Nam but couldn't sleep well. The reality was it was Tet (lunar New Year) and hotels were filled with screaming Chinese tourists. Not bias or exaggerated, just a reality and many travelers have experienced and dreaded I'm sure. He really needed respite from the noise and stress.Best part were the excellent sushi, undon and ramen restaurants in the terminal. We will definitely be staying here when we transit through Haneda. Front desk staff was extremely kind and accommodating through my email communication and in person. We able to extend 3 hrs to his check-out time with minimal cost and effort.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Flying out of Haneda was a stupid midnight flight and I had been in Japan hotel hopping for a while on business, I just wanted to relax. I checked out of a hotel in Tokyo and headed straight for the airport, its a lovely airport so a good time to chill. By the time I had walked around and finished some laptop work I checked in at 2pm at the Royal Park. Nice room, clean...and quiet!I stuck a couple of movies on, relaxed all day before the long flight back to Europe. Was excellent.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Based our choice on previous reviews and was really thrilled with the way it turned out. I couldn't quite see how the hotel could be a short walk to check-in (for British Airways) but it is in the same building. It was very budget friendly to take the bus (from Grand Nikko Daiba, Odaiba) to Haneda in the early evening than a taxi at 5am. The rooms are small, but smart and very quiet. The bathroom is very generously sized for a small room. Woud definitely book this hotel again for an early flight departure. We ate in Odaiba before heading to the airport, but on the upper level of the international terminal there are smart restuarant choices at sensible prices and we would probably dine here next time.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed one night thanks to a missed connection. Couldn’t be more convenient- a five minute walk, if that, situated just off the terminal. As with most Japanese rooms, it’s very compact. Service was excellent. Great breakfast too. The convenience of Haneda and this hotel makes this an easy win over the Narita schlep.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: perfect hotel for a stay over at Haneda airport hotel entrance is in the departure lounge. not easy to find (behind check-in gates L)rooms are small but ok. great shower after a long flightrestaurant serves good food also

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Nice hotel, especially for the fact that you arrive at Terminal 1 International and move from the second floor (arrival) to the third floor (departures): turn left and follow the indication for hotel (a bed in it).No way to miss it.Breakfast is absolutely nice, too, strongly recommended.The room is not big, but nice. Absolutely recommended.PS: in 2 weeks time i have to go back to Haneda and will arrive at late night, going to book again

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We planed for a night stay here due to an early flight the next morning. The room is small but decent in Japanese standard. The hotel is at the same level as the departure hall. There is good selection of restaurants/eateries at the terminal. The only comment is that the hotel was quite persistent not to provide the baby cot to my 14mths old baby as they told me that the hotel regulation state that no baby cot for 12mths and above. I was quite puzzled but after rejecting my numerous request, I gave up.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: There are several options when you are flying in to and out of Haneda Airport in Tokyo at odd hours with no train/bus services: 1) spend a night at the airport (there are many seats available thought not as comfortable) 2) take a taxi to the city (which can be costly) 3) spend a night at a hotel nearby which offers shuttle services to and from the airport4) spend a night at Royal Park HotelI have tried all the options except the option 2. My conclusion - it is worth staying at Royal Park Hotel for the stress-free, restful night before and after the long travel. The hotel room is compact and clean with everything you need for a night stay. You can opt for breakfast, if you have time for the leisurely, buffet breakfast.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The location of the hotel is unbeatable, it is in the international terminal. The domestic terminal is easily accessible by monorail or shuttle bus. The inside of the hotel is very pleasant. Comfortable room, although not big. Very quiet. Good breakfast. Perfectly working wifi. Professional, friendly staff. I stayed before a morning flight, one domestic, one international flight. A bit expensive but pays off. Stressless.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here for two nights and was surprised how much I enjoyed it. The hotel is located inside the international terminal but the domestic terminal is easily accessed via the free shuttle bus or the monorail. Check in is later than most hotels at 3pm (2pm seems to be most common) but they are happy to look after your luggage. There is plenty to do at the international terminal as there are plenty of restaurants, shops and viewing points. I really liked the fact that if you choose B&B you can use your breakfast vouchers for either lunch or dinner, and that also includes a free drink! We used ours for dinner; show your vouchers to the waiter and you receive a limited menu with three dinner choices. The food was excellent as was the service.The hotel operates a simple policy, you have your credit card details taken at check-in which means that you can check-out in seconds using the automated machines. I really liked this. The room has a coffee machine, free water and a fridge. There is no mini-bar which keeps everything simple. Wifi is excellent and easy to connect. The room was also very well soundproofed. There is also a beer and soft drink vending machine on each floor at reasonable prices - loved this.Only downside was the strange pillows used in the rooms, half of the pillow seems to contain grains of some sort which made them uncomfortable. I would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here for one night as transitting from Sapporo through to Indonesia for 18hrs. The hotel appears brand new and situated within the much better than average Haneda airport. Rooms were very clean and spacious for Tokyo normal rooms, with all facilities one could need. Staff very helpful with a quick checkin/checkout process

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Part of this hotel is located inside the airport in the secure area. If you have an overnight connection and want to stay close to the airport this is the best alternative.If you are arriving from an International flight, you stay airside, no customs or immigration, just a quick security check.The hotel is clean and very quiet. The room is small, at least for the single person but offers everything one would need for a good nights sleep. Bathroom with shower, many personal amenities, soap, shampoo body lotion etc. Complimentary wifi is available. Flat screen TV, even slippers, and pajamas. This not an inexpensive stopover hotel but in my opinion worth every dollar.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed here with my children during a long layover. The room had everything we needed. The shower was amazing and refreshing after 20 hours of traveling (and all bath products you could want were provided - and of high quality). There were even night shirts for us to wear for sleeping. The kids made use of the fast wifi and downloaded shows for the next leg of the journey. We all got a good few hours of sleep and felt so much better for the next flight. I wish I had known about this hotel before. It was right by all the gates, so it was fast and easy to get to. The check in was super fast and efficient. I wish all hotels had such great service. We will definitely stay again if we have a layover of a few hours or more.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Getting to the hotel was easy as the metro serves it well and the trip from Osaka was very smooth and hassle free. The location was great because of the number and varied eating options the prices were reasonable but the quality was outstanding from the Ramen to the Wagu Beef.Bed was a good size but the room was small could have had a bit more space but with single beds or slightly smaller bed more space. In house restaurant, vending machines very convenient and efficient. Check in and out was very professional. A bit more facilities would help. Gym or Pool.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Over the years Haneda airport has become a very nice, convenient airport to use relative to Narita. Easy to get there on the subway, lots of shopping, many nice restaurants. The Royal Park Hotel THE Haneda is right next to the check-in counters. So convenient! It's a well maintained, good quality hotel (as you would expect in Japan). Rooms are quite small and functional, but sufficient for a layover, and a good value.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Our family stayed for an overnight layover as we switched flights between Tokyo Narita and Haneda. The staff gave us a friendly greeting and was helpful in situating us with our bus transfer for the next morning. Our rooms were quiet and comfortable. Like most Japanese hotels, the rooms were on the small side but they maximized the space with a very efficient layout and ingenious gadgetry. Internet was no extra cost so the kids were happy.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed for just one night layover. This hotel is attached to the airport, so extremely convenient for tired traveler! Lobby was beautiful with huge Christmas tree. Check in was very efficient. Room was very clean and comfortable with nice shower.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Checking in was both pleasant and smooth. Very friendly front desk staff.Although the room was small but it was well appointed and was both very clean and comfortable. Room amenities and toiletries were more than adequate. Air conditioning worked perfect. After a long flight this hotel was a great choice for us.Location is excellent. It's right at the terminal. Easy access to the rail network. Lots of F & B outlets on the floor above.The hotel is priced higher on the mid-range category.Will stay here again if we get a chance.Recommended!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It's a brilliant place for an early morning flight. Brilliant soundproofing and very comfy bed. Plenty of good food in the hotel or in the terminal. Tip: if you want cheap, the airport 7/11 has delicious and varied options to take out.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: i like this hotel since it's connected straight to the airport Departures in Haneda.Check-in and check-out are super fast and efficiently done .staff members are efficient, helpful and will do anything possible in their hands to help you out with any queries you got. Service is very good and fast.Food at the restaurant is good hotel is calm and perfect for business travelers who are there mainly for a night or 2 and need to be close to Haneda airport.rooms are clean and tidy.Amenities are readily available in the room.The only things i didn't like are the quality of the towels and the bathing cape and the fact that the rooms are super small even though it contains everything you need .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Room is not big but clean and service is very good. Handy location since it is inside the airport. Good place to take a rest before your next journey. Especially after a long flight. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Hotel is very nicely decorated. You can walk to airline checkin desks without going outside. You can go to Central Tokyo by monorail or taxi. Great also if your flight arrives very late or departs very early. You can have a pocket WI-FI delivered to the hotel and drop it in mailbox when leaving. There is a 7-Eleven Cash maching nearby in the airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The check in and out was quick and efficient. We had booked a room for 3, the extra rollaway/sofa bed was ready when we checked in. While at the airport, the location is well connected by the train system to the rest of Tokyo and because it is located at the airport, there are english speaking service staff at the train station to assist with questions. Food choices are abundant - outside the hotel on the 4th floor in the airport terminal, there is a Japan Food Street, where there are 6-7 restaurants serving a variety of good quality Japanese food.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A late arrival compounded by a flight delay was not a concern this time. No worries about missing the last train or bus to town. The hotel, adjacent to the departures lobby was a godsend. Average time to get through immigration and baggage claim is around 45 min for foreigners. Rooms are compact, like those of a business hotel. Breakfast was great with ample Western and Japanese selections. But the many restaurants at the airport give you good options too. The Lawson convenience store on street level has many offerings as well. We were so happy with the convenience of the hotel that we booked a room on our return since we had a late departure. Time to shower and nap made for a more relaxing flight home.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I am reviewing the hotel which is inside the terminal outside of security. (I note that there seem to be some reviews in this which are of some other transit hotel). The hotel is on the departure level. It took about 15 seconds from the door of the hotel to the Cathay checkin. From arrivals, about 2 minutes. About 2 minutes to the monorail and Japan Rail Pass pick-up office too. Plenty of shops and restaurants in the terminal (all shut overnight). The only restaurant in the hotel is pretty awful - very few western options in the breakfast buffet which was (imho) quite overpriced. check in is slow but fine, check out (used the machine) took about 10 seconds. staff are friendly but pretty poor English spoken. Room is tiny (even by Japan standards). I have stayed here 3 times now - 2 times with the tiny room; one time we got upgraded to something slightly larger. But expect a small room. Just enough room to walk around the bed and pretty much nothing else. But the room has TV, kettle, robes, all bathroom amenities you could want (including flannel, hairbrush as well as the more normal toothbrush, soap, shampoo etc). Bed is very comfortable (on the hard side, but this is Asia). The pillows are quite interesting - one half is hard (buckwheat I think) the other half is feather. So you just use the side you like best which is pretty cool. Plenty of plug sockets (two flat prongs). Overall very convenient hotel for airport stopovers, late arrivals or early departures. I would just avoid the restaurant. Bonus - we had a great view of Mt FUJI from the room!
user_name:
fairhsa
Various, UK, Aus, NZ, HK

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I nice cosy place to spend a night if ur travelling in or out from haneda, just at the end of the departure terminal. We came in at night, followed by a swift check in found our room which was comfortable for a good rest followed by an easy train ride to Tokyo as our japan adventure started.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed at the Royal Park Hotel before an early morning flight to Beijing. It was extremely convenient to get up and just go downstairs to the international terminal. I would stay there again based on that fact alone. The rooms are small, but it is Tokyo! The beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. The bathroom was well equipped with a blow dryer, robes, slippers, disposable hairbrushes and toiletry items. My husband commented that you could just show up with nothing and have a comfortable stay. Check in and out was very efficient and fast. We had a very pleasant stay and the price was reasonable.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is located within the international terminal making it very easy to get to check in, particularly as our flight was early in the morning. Staff were very helpful at check in, and the room although small was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was lovely and the shower was great.All you need for an airport hotel in my opinion, I'd happily stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed at this hotel twice. Best choice of hotel for an early flight from Haneda airport the next day. The room is very clean and comfy. The staff is very helpful too. Nothing to complain about. Price is not low but acceptable. You get what you pay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We overnighted at the Royal Park Hotel The Haneda after a late arrival into the airport. The in-terminal hotel feels very new and has an unbeatable location, but if you are expecting a four-star property (as it is marketed as, you will be disappointed- the amenities and room more closely align with a mid-range than upper tier hotel. So, it is either a good 3-star hotel or a not good 4-star hotel depending on how you look at it. Our “Premium Double” room was small to the point that it was difficult to move around in as a couple with luggage. It felt more like the sort of room you would find on a cruise ship. The furnishings and amenities seemed new and well-maintained and the bathroom included the standard high-tech Japanese toilet that are common in Japan. The shower also gave off great water pressure. But even so, I found the room not particularly well-designed for international travelers. There were no USB charging points, for instance, and the lack of space made it difficult for two adults to move around easily. Check-in and check-out were both very efficient, which is particularly important for an airport hotel. Overall, if you just need a place to sleep and have a shower for 12 hours, the Royal Park can fit the bill. But just manage your expectations as this is NOT a four-star standard property.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Checking-in very fast. Internet speed is fast. The room is super small, maybe this is Japanese style. Check-in staffs working attitude are bad. The room is clean, the bathroom is clean. But the pillow is bad, hard to sleep.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed one night in April 2017 before an early morning flight. Right at the international terminal. Some nice restaurants at the airport. Room was small and clean. Pretty chilled when turning on the air conditioner.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Loved the hotel location,small but extremely cozy which is of my liking.Bed was really good but the pillows needs improvements. The people made the place according to my request and emphasized on it when I arrived.Overall I would recommend people cause if it’s conscience.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Having an early flight we decided to spend our last night in this beautiful hotel. We had a triple room, large, very confortable and equipped with every comfort. Too bad we stay there just one night. The hotel is right inside the Haneda airport, at the International flights terminal. Is very nice to go out of the hotel and do the check in. Inside the terminal there are plenty of restaurants and konbini.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Friendliness is a big word for the male staff at the check in and at explaining how check out works, have to work on that guys!! Please note: Customer service is very important for every guest who is arriving and departure at the hotel, it will give you a repeat ;-)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The first time I was experiencing Airport Hotel is in Royal Park Hotel The Haneda, which is conveniently just located beside the International Terminal of Haneda Airport (you can walk there). Check in very smooth and staffs are very helpful. Next visit on late arrival definitely will stay on this hotel again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I arrived around 11pm into the international terminal, just followed the signs to flight connections, cleared security check and then 2 minutes later arrived at the airport hotel airside in the international departures area.That's just how awesome this hotel transit area is. Check in was quick and I was charged for my 6 hour stay.Used the shower in my room and enjoyed the comfortable bed and woke up at 5AM, checked out and then used the free waiting lounge in the hotel before heading to my gate.Overall a great stay and would use again, and very reasonable price.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: For a stayover between flights, the RP Haneda is very convenient - literally attached to the international terminal so you can walk there in 2 minutes or less; nice, clean, spacious room, with A/C, and a good bathroom with all the regular goodies; the wifi was spotty but functional, my one gripe was the charge for the drip coffee in-room - but the tea is free... the breakfast was good, and included with my room. Recommended for the weary traveller between flights, of if you are coming into Tokyo late at night and want a one-night stay before heading into the city.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Royal Park Hotel Haneda was a very easy accommodation just steps away from the Haneda Arrivals Hall after an international flight and a 10 minutes shuttle bus ride to the Domestic terminal. The restaurant was fine for dinner- and Japanese breakfast. If staying on the premium floor, warm pajamas are complimentary. Rooms are small but adequate and clean. There is an observation deck onto runway and airport activity which is worth the effort to find.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you are connecting flights at Haneda and need to overnight at the airport this is the place to stay. Very convenient, clean small quiet rooms in airport. Restaurants abound as well as gift shops. I would stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Needed a room since we had a late night arrival at Haneda Airport with an early am flight the next morning....this was a perfect place...in the airport..a quick walk to the check in the next morning.....hotel was clean...very quiet!!! small room but just for overnight was a perfect match.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: On 16/10, We stayed one night in a twin sharing room. Everything in the room superficially seem fine. But very soon I found out that one side of the bed which near the wall next to the toilet was sinking down and the musty smell was quite strong. I was unable to sleep well whole night. Hope this hotel can improve their mattresses hygiene standard and quality!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you're coming in on one flight and leaving the next day, stay here! Exit customs, up one floor on the elevator and walk your luggage to the hotel. Check in was easy (multilingual staff). Wave your room key at the sensor and it knows what floor you need to go to.Best of all, truly: there are absolutely no airplane sounds. No rumble. No whine. No vibration. Nothing. Nada. And I was listening for it. They must use some kind of noise cancelling technology. Amazing. Yes, the rooms are tiny, but who cares? I'm not there for a vacation. I want an uninterrupted night's sleep before catching my flight the next day. They're clean and the bed was comfortable.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It wasn’t due to the long flight from Gatwick but believe me this place was very welcoming and full of smiles.check in was brilliant and we walked ourselves there from the Arrivals in no time. The place reflected the true image of Japan-cleanliness, punctuality and courtesy. The breakfast was good and we had decided not to expect a full English breakfast. We had decided to travel light and eat small and frequent and try the local delicacies.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had a ten hour layover in Haneda and this was perfect for 6-7 hours sleep in between flights. I originally booked through hotels.com but cancelled due to possible inability to get on as a non-rev (airline employee) from SFO-HND. Thankfully we did get on so I just walked into the hotel upon arrival and had no problem with a new booking. In fact it was about $45 cheaper ($115/USD total versus hotels.com). Room was probably the smallest they offer (per photos) but king-sized bed, no extra seating and not much room to walk around but when you're exhausted and need sleep it is only a shower and a comfortable bed that you crave. The room was soundproof and immaculate as was the full bathroom with all amenities. The location of this hotel is excellent, tucked away in the terminal and up an escalator, almost secluded. It was perfect as an "in-between" refresher prior to another long flight (7.5 hours) to Kuala Lumpur. Shhhh......I almost want to keep this a secret.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Celebrating my wife's birthday by meeting her at Haneda to welcome her home from Los Angeles, I rented their best and largest twin room. But we were given a free up-grade which made everything seem like a dream. Instead of an expensive room, we got a real bargain on a lavish and luxurious suite.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: after fighting our way through customs for an hour and a half , i swear there were at least a thousand people there that night, we dragged ourselves to the hotel at 1.30 am , the staff were super friendly , the room was awesome and we slept the sleep of the dead . So close to check in and food A1

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you are staying here it surely is not for a luxurious Tokyo visit. You would only stay here if you are in transit or have a late or early flight. For that purpose it is top notch. You won't find a better airport hotel anywhere. Bed-good, linens-good, cleanliness-good, quietness-good, location -perfect, price -reasonable. Only thing I could even find that was not perfect is the check-in process. Staff could be a bit more friendly for Japan but still good.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My friend and I stayed here on our last night in Japan. The hotel is conveniently located within the international departure terminal. There is sound proof glass on the windows so you don’t hear any of the airport noise outside. Comfortable, nice facilities. My only complaint would be that the bathroom had no ventilation, which is the case in most of the places we stayed at, it just makes it very difficult to get dressed in there.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is the 2nd time I have stayed here prior to catching our flight from Tokyo Haneda. The check in was friendly and quick. Our room was on the high floor and it was very quiet. The room is spacious and the shower is spacious as well. The bed is very comfortable and the sleep quality is fine. We ate dinner in the bar area and the food and drink was very nice. We also ate lunch in the main restaurant, and again, the food and service was quite nice. Check out was simple and quick-just. The location cannot be beat, as the hotel is attached to Terminal which is a short walk away. It really helps for early morning flights. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed one night at this hotel before flying back to the UK after our Japan holiday. With an early flight this hotel couldn’t be more convenient as it’s situated right in the international departure building. Our room was small but perfectly formed and had everything we needed for a one night stay. We had a lovely meal at the restaurant and as everywhere in Japan the staff were courteous and efficient. If you fly out early from Haneda there’s really no other place to stay the night before if you want a stress free start to your journey.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After a 11+hour business-class flight and 50 minutes queuing at immigration until midnight, The Royal Park was a dream haven. We hugged ourselves that we'd had the good sense to lay-over at the airport as we sank into that soft bed. Well-set up and quiet room, but 259 was a long walk from the elevatorWith an 11.00am checkout next morning (our next stop was Tokyo Ginza), we first went down to the terminal below for breakfast and to collect our Japan Rail Pass. Easy as . . .Great stopover. Indulge yourself.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Relatively new hotel , 3 years old. Modern style and simple furnishing. Yes, it's small which is typical for Tokyo and I assume. It's stay one night on lay-overs.Nice buffet breakfast, with Japanese food. No omelette station.Would like to have had a mini bar and possibly room service. But it's not a 5 star hotel.Good service overall. Convenient to leave luggage while in town

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is at the Airport. No bus back and forth - on site at international term. Really great nice room nice bathroom quiet.We were in the transit hotel behind security- 24 rooms - it was great.  This is the 5th onsite airport hotel (Dallas/Miami/ftlauderdale) have stayed at - this was tied for best with Qatar.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Before deciding to stay here, you need to realise that this is a hotel based in an airport terminal - primarily catering for transiting passengers. It is also worth remembering that hotel rooms in general within Japan are on the 'cosy' side.If you are expecting luxury, you will be disappointed. If you have just stepped off a long flight and arrived late at night and just need a clean room, comfortable bed, and a good nights rest, then this hotel is for you - but convenience comes at a price as you get very little room for your money.From stepping off the plane, getting processed through a busy immigration queue and opening the door of my hotel room took around 35 minutes.I arrived late at night and the girl on the check in was very friendly and I was in my room within minutes. I booked a double bed room (single use) which filled most of the room, but everything you need is there for a sleep and a freshen up in the morning.I can't comment on the optional breakfast as I declined it to keep the price down.Without doubt, this hotel is a good choice if you are transiting or arriving late into Haneda, its value for money however is determined by what price you place on convenience.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Negative. Small room, hard mattress (usual in Asia), no room cleaning after 3pm, no early checkin unless you pay 1000y per hour, no double bed although requested and this for €180 per night. No good value overall.Positive: Spacious Bath/shower cabin, no noise at all from the airplanes, good -though not extraordinary- breakfast both asian and non asian items. (only filter coffee, no warm milk). There is a Lawson convenience store at entrance level (under the arrivals level) with affordable packaged meals, toiletries etc). Good connections to the city by subway.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed one night for early morning flight after11 day trip to china and japan for early flight this is the place.Room are nice size bed are great . Checked out and 2mintues we checking in at air china no need for shuttle bus you are at the gates for check in very convenience.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After 26 days of cruising, a night at the Royal Park Hotel to rest up for long flight home was the ideal place to stay. Rooms are typical Japanese efficient...small, but great use of space. Shower was awesome & I have come to love the toto washlet toilets! Hotel right in international terminal with an excellent array of shops & restaurants. If you arrive before the 3:00 check in there is an option for a noon check in for a small surcharge depending on availability.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: perfect location - in the departure area of the airport, easy check in, soundproof rooms, good breakfast. mini mart down stairs. rooms are super small but all you need if just staying the night. thank you we will be back

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Place to relax between flight, close to check in desk, room service stop providing meals at 23:00 LT which not ideal , room clean and tidy but small, nice view from the window, only recommended for a stop between flight not for holiday or smaller.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed overnight after a 10 hr flight from Vancouver. It was very convenient in terms of location. There were alot of shops and restaurants to choose from. It was also near the monorail station, so it was easy to go to Tokyo Station. Also, I just love the room! because it was clean and It had a very modern design. I could see the airport from the bathroom too, planes taxiing, landing and taking off it was so cool!I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I highly recommend it to travellers who want to get some rest after a long flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I'm giving this the highest rating for what it is -- a clean, stylish, well-run hotel right at the airport. You can't beat the convenience of taking the escalator from the lobby right to the international check-in counters for a morning flight. Rooms were soundproof and we heard nothing from either the hallway or the runways right out the window. Our room was small, as many are in Japan, but tolerable for a night
user_name:
PaminatorJ
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had a great surprise to find this well organized hotel exactly in Hanada airport which made it very convenient to check in early next morning! The room was perfectly organized and it was evident that someone thought of every tiny detail to make the room so comfortable. After worse experiences in airport hotels he Royal Park Hotel The Haneda is a real jewel!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very good location smack in the main Int’l terminal building. 5 minute walk to checkin so super-convenient. Rooms very small per Jpn standard but also mine was quite smelly mainly from stale bathroom odor. Beds rock hard (which I like) but the weirdest pillows around - concrete hard and plastic ‘ball’ filling, most uncomfortable. However the big reason for low score is the absence of a gym! How can you not have at an Int’l airport hotel?!?!? Reason provided by staff was that ‘jpn people do not go to do sports’... wtf?? Of course they do. Hence, not a world class airport hotel. Food in restaurang Tailwind is good and breakfast is decent and somewhat westernized.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Excellent location, right in the terminal. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was pleasant. Rooms quite small and quite brightly lit, so not much ambience - but it's an airport hotel I guess. Clean, and so that's the most important thing

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed one night at this hotel at the start of our tour of Japan. The location was perfect and it only took us a few minutes to find the hotel in Haneda airport after collecting our bags. The room was spotlessly clean, fairly small but perfectly adequate for a one night stay after a long flight. The hotel provides pyjamas and plenty of complimentary toiletries, which meant we didn't need to unpack our suitcases - this was much appreciated! The bed was very comfortable and we both slept well, which was a good start to our holiday. Breakfast was excellent, with a good selection of Japanese and western options. All staff were friendly and welcoming. We thoroughly enjoyed staying here and would recommend it to anyone arriving on a late flight into Haneda airport. The Tokyo monorail is only a short walk back through the terminal so we were able to continue to Tokyo with ease.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My husband and I arrived at Haneda about 11pm from an overseas flight. How nice it was to just walk through the airport to the hotel instead of rushing to try and catch a train before they stopped running for the night. The staff were gracious and kind, the room was comfortable and quiet, and the buffet breakfast was delicious. We will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very comfortable hotel great for an overnight stay at Haneda airport after a long haul flight.Easy to find (2floor in departure area) and good facilities. Very quiet and hreat breakfast restaurant to set you up for your first day in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Was at the airport 6hours before my flight. I thought I could walk in and get a refresh room. Was told it was all booked. I should have made a reservation earlier but due to my itinerary, I didn't know i was going to have such a long time there. So I spent the 6 hours "un-refreshed" in the transit area. Thought it would be good if the hotel or the airport offers shower facilities like the one in Narita.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I slept one night during stopover. All I needed was the convinient location for one night at Tokyo and it was indeed the best location. Hotel is located right next to the international departure counter.Right off the domestic airplane, I moved to international terminal and put the baggage in the hotel. After that I could go out to the city and come back to the hotel at night.Even on the departure date, I went out to the city without baggage and come back before the departure. Unlike other hotels in the city, there is no hassle to go back to the hotel, get the baggage and go to the airport.Other than location, I didn't use much service, But as far as I am concerned, everything went smooth. If I have to stay 1 night at Tokyo, this is the perfect hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is located in Haneda airport international terminal. If you arrive late in the night or depart super early in the morning, this hotel would be the best choice (trains stop running sometime after midnight and until a bit after 5 am). Yes, there are many budget hotels outside if you don't mind paying extra bucks for taxi but imagine...you pick up your luggage after an exhausting long hour flight and 3 minutes later you are already in your bed!I found a nightly rate a bit pricy for a small room but this is Tokyo after all. You get all the necessary amenities in a compact size clean room...more than you need to rest just for one night. The coolest thing is that you get an airport view from the bathroom. You can watch planes come and go while taking a bath! The restaurant is closed relatively early but there are restaurants and stores in the terminal.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We booked the hotel despite really high price for 1 night as we were arriving in Tokyo near midnight with kids and didn´t want to make them even more tired by transferring to Tokyo itself that very same night.I admit it took us some time to find the hotel as the signs don´t seem to be very visible but once we found it, it was all perfect. From the airplane right to your bed without any need to bother about shuttle buses! Beds in our hotel room were perfectly comfortable and the bathroom was very pleasant as well. I only advise you to set your alarm clock as we were absolutely sure to wake up till 11 am (check-out time) but our sleep was so deep and relaxing that we overslept a bit and hardly checked out at 11.30 am. The staff was friendly though and accepted our apologies without a penalty.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Whilst the Royal Park is a touch more expensive than your average Airport Hotel, it's worth the few extra yen. Crawling zombie-like off a 14 hour flight from NYC with an 8 month old and a zillion bags in tow, I feared a long walk from the airport or (worse) some shuttle bus nonsense. But fear not. The RPH is literally right by baggage claim along with the rest of the airport shops. I could have cried with relief. With this location, the Royal Haneda doesn't need to be a great hotel in it's own right. But it is. It's light years ahead of the average airport offerings and wouldn't feel out of place downtown. Everything you want is there: good rooms, clean bathrooms, excellent breakfast, fantastic service etc etc. In short, it's a total lifesaver and I wouldn't hesitate to come back. If you're anticipating a long flight and in need of an oasis in the midst of travel hell, spend a little bit extra and stay here. You'll thank yourself for doing so.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Facing a rainy, dreary Tokyo night and five hours wait for my flight on to Singapore I checked in to the 'Transit Hotel' as they call the Royal Park Hotel at Haneda Airport in Tokyo. I didn't regret it. You book in time windows so I took 6 hours for 11,000 yen. Spotlessly clean room and bathroom. Nice to have a hot shower, drink the cold water bottle left for you in the fridge, slip in to the nightshirt thoughtfully left on the bed...and rest, sigh:)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: OK, so after travelling from Osaka and getting a taxi to the terminal, I arrived 50 minutes before the advertised check in time of 3:00 pm. I have never found this to be a problem at any other hotel I have ever stayed at around the world, but here, they charge you ¥1,000, the room was obviously ready, so why charge you extra for 50 minutes?Yes, the hotel is at the international terminal with an entrance on level 3. There is a restaurant by the entrance, the rooms are a good size and well kitted out. Couldn't resist using the nightgown provided to sleep in. The hotel is good if you have an early flight, or you want a good sleep after a long flight. It is quiet and comfortable, but why charge extra for an early check in?

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If I travel solo thru HND, this is now my default airport hotel. PROS- It took me 70 seconds to walk (leisurely pace with a roller bag) from the hotel doorway to the start of the security check-in line at the HND international terminal. - Hotel restaurant has decent fusion style buffet breakfast.
