Dinner includes reasonable udon and sashimi. - Airport food court is within 5 minute walk and offers selection of restaurants including reasonably good sushi. - 2 free bottles of water in mini-fridge- Very quiet room.- Good AC. - Good wireless. Was able to VPN to Remote Desktop for 40 min with good speed and no interruption. CONS- Room is small. Bed (feels like full-size or small queen) takes up 2/3 of room. Fine for solo. Cramped for couple.- No gym. Didn't seem to be good place to run outside (plus Tokyo summers are 90 degrees with 90 percent humidity).

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It's based in the international terminal of Haneda Airport. Great if you want to go sleep after a long flight or have to depart early. The rooms are not that big ( it's Japan !!!). But you have everything you need in the room. However it's on the airport the rooms are quiet !!! The staff is very friendly and helpful !!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed for one night with our 9 year old grandson prior to a connecting flight to Okinawa. Last summer we stayed at the hotel in Terminal 2. This hotel is better and the cost is not much different. However, I will get a larger room next year. We had a nice dinner at their restaurant. I recommend the Air Lawson convenience store on level 1. It is not that far from the hotel lobby. This hotel is inside the International Terminal at Haneda Airport. You can reserve a room on line without a credit card. When you check in, you will pay in advance and all passport info pages will we copied.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As with other reviews, this hotrl's selling point is that it's literally connected to the airport terminal!!!! The rooms are very small for that reason and pretty Japanese standards. It's definately worth staying here if you have an early flight the next morning. Rooms have everything you need. A little pricey but worth the piece of mind and being able to not get up at a ridiculous hour.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: You will experience Japanese hospitality from the moment you arrive at this airport hotel. Don't be alarmed if your room is stuffy; their rooms are very energy efficient so all the electricity automatically turns off when you leave the room. Once the A/C is on, the room will cool down quickly. This is Japan- so yes, the rooms are on the small side. But if you are here just for a night or even a few hours, you will have everything you need.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Actually we just stay 7-8hrs in this hotel from 3PM - 11PM since our flight depart at 1AM but since they don't have hours package we had to pay 1 night room chargeIn terms of location it's very convenient since it's located next to check in counter. Room is ok, not too small. Bed is comfortableIt's functioned as a transit hotel so if you have that expectation then you'll be fine.Staff is polite and friendly. No drama at c/in - c/outIf they have hours package then it'll be fantastic

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We booked one night here, so that we would have no rush in the morning to catch our flight. The hotel entrance leads directly off the check-in floor, and couldn’t have been more convenient. The hotel itself is a standard modern 4-star establishment with nothing in particular to distinguish it - apart from its situation. The staff were all, as in the rest of the country, helpful and friendly, and we had use of the hotel computer and printer to allow us to check in and get boarding passes.We spent a couple of happy hours wandering around the airport, where there is a large open-air viewing terrace and a number of shops and food outlets. Unfortunately, most restaurants were rather basic, and neither our evening meal nor breakfast was memorable. The cost of a hotel breakfast was expensive.The bedroom was comfortable and clean, with the usual wide range of supplies and facilities (including a Japanese style mechanised toilet). It was very small but we had no difficulty in re-packing ready for our journey home, nor storing an airport luggage trolley overnight which we had “borrowed”.Bed 4*Location 5*cleanliness 4*computer 5*

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It s à 2 stars hotel with a 5 stars pricing.Why ? Because it s airport location BUT when you known that the fast train rail way take you inside the city within 15 minutes, you known now that better to stay in great Tokyo hotel and get the fast small train to the airport in 15 minutes . And very bad bed.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The convenience of a short 5-minute walk to your hotel room after a tiring flight cannot be topped. This hotel is situated right on the International terminal at Haneda airport.Very well maintained hotel, friendly efficient service. Excellent restaurant, with a great view of Tokyo city in the distance, the monorail nearby. Should you want to travel into the city there is also easy access to trains, metro, busses. If you have time to spare the terminal itself has many restaurants and stores, besides a large open air observation deck and restaurant.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We chose the Royal Park for a 1 night layover and I have to say it couldn't have been more convenient. We had a long trek through customs and immigration and found the hotel quickly. The lobby was modern and attractive and the staff were very accommodating with their English.Then we got to the room.I know that Tokyo rooms are small, but this was a VERY small room. It was musty and very warm with an ineffective air conditioner. There was also a machine on the floor that I think was a dehumidifier but the instructions were in Japanese so I can't be certain. After asking for a different room we were told that the hotel was booked. We made the best and got ready for bed. Only one nightOn the most good awful uncomfortable beds ever made with strange roll up pillows. Perhaps it is a cultural thing lost on me, but the other thing that was lost was sleep. Between it bring warm, dank, smelly and having bags of sand for pillows I probably slept 2 hours total. I could have saved the $180 and slept in the airport for free and gotten a better night's sleep.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The location is superb, right inside the terminal so very convenient. We had a little walk around the terminal in the evening up to the plane viewing platform, and over to the Seven Eleven for some snacks.The room was comfortable and a decent size, the bathroom and shower were good. Staff were very polite and efficient, gave us a wake up call as requested. I'd stay here again if I had an early morning flight, the experience was seamless.My only grip - I think they could do with a few more international TV channels, it is an airport hotel afterall. You would expect foreigners as well as Japanese people staying.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a great hotel - modern and very helpful English speaking staff. We always stay here after a long flight to rest up. It's very convenient. Normal check in is 3pm but for a very reasonable 1000JPY you can check in early from 12pm. Like wise you can pay a small fee for late check out depending on your flight departure time. But let the hotel know beforehand.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived from Tokyo on the monorail using our JR pass to Haneda airport - the entrance to the hotel is just behind the BA check in desk and was easy to find - a very serene welcome from the reception staff, our room was clean, very modern and well appointed, A\C, wifi in the room, coffee and tea making and also very quiet. The hotel makes a perfect place to stay if you are arriving late or have an early flight the next day (which we did). The rooms are not big, but they are very well appointed and perfectly adequate for one night's stay.We chose to eat in the hotel restaurant in the evening and all enjoyed food from a western style menu - breakfast was served int he same dining room, included in our stay and offered a very comprehensive buffet choice of western and Japanese food - a chef to cook an omelette or eggs on request.We decided to check in for our flight first (a very easy and quick walk to the check in desks from the entrance of the hotel) and then went back for breakfast, which worked extremely well!Well recommended for a stay actually in the airport terminal

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We chose this hotel as it is situated right within Tokyo Haneda Airport. Perfect after a long haul flight. As with everything in Japan it is spotless. In this case the hotel itself was definitely a worthy owner of its stars. We missed breakfast due to jet lag but had a beautifully prepared tempura for our evening meal. Service was perfect and the staff excellent to deal with

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Since our long international flight arrived at 7pm, a friend recommended staying at the airport then heading into the heart of Tokyo refreshed in the morning. This ended up being a great choice for us (and we were able to activate our Japan rail passes a day later extending our 14-day window a bit). The hotel location is ridiculously easy to wheel yourself from customs to check in. Our room was comfortable and outfitted with lovely little extras like breathable sleepwear and lots of toiletries. The shower was a delight too!As newcomers to Japan and not speaking the language, it worked out well for us to sleep, shower, and head to the train network with a clear head.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is an amazing hotel located at the Haneda airport.Since we arrived late at night, we've decided to stay for a night there before going to our hotel in Shinjuku the next day.Convinient and easy to find. Staff is as expected in Japan that they are very helpful and all of their staff can speak good english hence easy to communicate with.Room amenities is amazing and luxurious. Comfy bed for a good refreshing sleep after a long flight. If you ever arrived Japan late at night, you should take the opportunity to stay here before embarking on ur next journey

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We have arrived in the night, so we decided to sleep here. It was a good idea. The hotel is located directly at the airport. Rooms are clean, bed is comfortable, wifi works well. The walls are sound-proof so you can really enjoy your sleep. Breakfast is too expensive (2500 yen for 1 person)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: One thing for sure, Royal Park Haneda makes Royal Park Shiodome looks big. The room I was in is good enough for a queen bed. If you have more than 1 suitcase, good luck. However, the hotel is clean and comfortable enough for a night's stay.The selling point of this hotel however is the convenience. It is located within Haneda International Airport, hence it is a good choice for those with early morning flight out of Haneda. The lift and corridor is wide enough to accommodate a trolley, hence it is helpful for those with heavy suitcases (very important, as the hotel has a very long corridor!). Although there is a restaurant, I would recommend to eat in the airport itself as the EDO food street is just one level up (with many better choices).If one has an early morning flight the next day or arriving late into Haneda, this is the hotel to go for.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very smart (new in 2015?), couldn't get closer to the international terminal (its inside on the departure floor). Surprisingly quiet. Not particularly convenient for travel to Tokyo though monorail and JR Yamanote-sen are efficient and reasonably quick. When you wake at three in the morning and are wondering what to do then - apart from the obvious - there's a coffee shop open in the terminal. Good restaurant / bar attached to the hotel entrance. Rooms can be small so if you need to work make sure you get a larger one.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The water pressure in the toilet was good. Air con was fantastic. Nice view. Very convenient to travel to domestic airport to catch domestic flight. The yoshinoya outside the hotel is convenient to pack food at night.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After a long 6 hour flight from Hawaii, this was a perfect place to rest and recharge before heading into the city. Our flight landed about 10pm and by the time we finished going thru customs, it was late and I'm glad I booked a hotel for one night in the Haneda terminal. We also found a sushi restaurant in the terminal that was still open late and had our first meal before heading to bed. It's a very nice hotel and I would stay again the next time I travel to Japan!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I have used this hotel before when flying in and out of Tokyo and all ways found the staff to be helpful enough even though check in is usually a slow affair. However I have never used this hotel before when I have arrived during the day rather than the evening. There is no early check in and they charge to use all facilities, so what I thought was a good pit stop is actually pretty pointless unless you happen to be arriving late afternoon or evening. To make matters worse the staff were completely unhelpful from start to finish and the lobby chairs re the worst I have ever sat on, not good when you gave a 4 hour wait for check in!!!!If you want somewhere to sleep for a night then it is fine. If you want service comparable to any other hotel in this price range then I would avoid!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Had a very early flight from Haneda International Terminal in the morning so I stayed here the night before and it was an excellent stay. The room was small but very comfortable. The hotel is located in Haneda International Terminal so it was super convenient. Also, getting from Haneda Airport back to central tokyo for some late night Karaoke with friends was easy and only takes around 30 mins.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel is new and very well maintained. We enjoyed the great fittings - Toto neorest toilet and Hansgrohe shower as well as the good water pressure. Aircon in the room was very effective and the super single beds in our twin bedded room were very comfortable. The room was well insulated against noise.Front desk staff were fluent in English and very helpful - they provided masking tape and marker pens after we bought a box off them to hold our food purchases.I really enjoyed using the monorail to get into the city and will not hesitate to use this hotel for my Tokyo stays in the future.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had a long layover at Haneda and could get a few hours' sleep. I had reserved a room online, it was waiting for me as promised, and was exceptionally comfortable. Not large, but I was there to sleep. There was a television, a well-appointed room with crisp linens, great control of temperature and lighting, and a nice bathroom. Slept like a log and was refreshed for the next part of my journey. Highly recommended for a short stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: For various reasons we had to stay the night in this hotel at short notice during a recent tour of Japan. The hotel was full but they found us a room and looked after us very well. No complaints! The hotel is inside the international terminal and within easy walking distance of many shops, restaurants, cash machines etc

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located in the international terminal building, this luxury hotel has everything the tired traveler needs during a long layover. It oozes "chic". As is customary in Japan, the staff is polite and helpful way beyond what is required. I felt like a king.The rooms are small but absolutely perfect. The bathroom has the latest luxurious faucets, bath, shower and toilet. Everything one could want is provided. The air-conditioning is wonderful and quiet. The bed is great, although a bit short for tall westerners. I have seen this sort of luxury at the Prince de Galles in Paris at four times the price.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We checked in at about 6pm and were given room 726 overlooking the runway on the 7th floor. There was no aircraft noise. The decor was not great and mostly green, twin beds, tv, small wardrobe, bathroom with bath and shower, separate Toto. Wifi was fast and remembered us from the Refresh room we had used on arrival ten days before. A nightshirt was provided. There were sockets between the beds and on the desk, and a small fridge with two bottles of water. There was an ice machine and vending machine along the corridor, including Asahi beer.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We flew in from Geneva arriving at 10:45pm. We didn't want to take the train into Tokyo as most hotel check-ins close at 2am. And not knowing if there would be a flight delay with our connecting flight, we opted for a safer choice; the hotel at the airport. There were a lot of signs to help find the hotel. Check-in was fast and friendly. We had breakfast included which was really good. A mix between Japanese & some North American options. Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Wonderful location!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This really is the ideal airport hotel, since it's actually inside the terminal and you can stroll to an early morning check-in. No noise inside the rooms, yet you can get a glimpse of the outside world from them as well. The hotel restaurant is fine, though the terminal itself has many other dining options available. Access to Tokyo itself, if you have time, is easy on public transport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We picked this hotel because we were only stopping off in Tokyo on the way to Australia and because we thought it was close to the airport. Close to the airport? It is PART of the airport. Arriving at the International Haneda terminal it's a very short stroll up to the hotel.The beauty of this closeness is how easy and quick it is to get into central Tokyo from the airport via the monorail.The hotel was comfortable enough, the toilet a delight (I do LOVE Japanese toilets) and the shower excellent. Best of all, the window opened though the aircon worked perfectly.Surprisingly, being part of an airport terminal, we didn't hear a single plane in our room. In fact, even with the window open, it was very quiet.We'll definitely be staying here again.The only thing to be aware of is that the restaurant/bar attached to the hotel closes quite early for an airport - last orders at 10:30 - and it doesn't serve Japanese food. Though the Caesar's salad I had was delicious.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Front desk managed to swap booking to the transit on the fly. Extremely efficient check-in. Clean room, towel and user friendly. The hotel water storage (wooden tank) is a pleasant surprise. Of course, the bidet system.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The staff here are very helpful. Since I don't speak Japanese, the moment you asked them anything with regards to the places you want to go as a tourist, they will speak to you in fluent English and they tell you the exact bus, trains and stops so you won't have to get lost. The rooms give enough space for you to rest and put your suitcase in place. The bed is perfect and it's so quiet. It's very clean plus they have so much amenities that you would last through your whole stay. Their breakfast and lunch buffet are almost as 20-30$ but hey, it's a buffet so it's very affordable. Location wise, it's just connected in the airport so you don't have to check in late for your flight. This definitely deserves an outstanding award for a hotel

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located within Haneda airport area, the hotel is directly connected to Haneda International airport. The building is abit old, but clean enough. The room is spacious for our family with kids, but the price is a bit pricey.One disturbing is the water closet which located in separate space to the bathroom. Just not familiar with that configuration.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is located just at a far end of the terminal building where you can use the airport luggage trolley all the way to the hotel lobby. The rooms are standard Japanese business hotel size. Though a little small, it is clean and cosy.There are plenty of places to eat at the terminal and some are open 24 hours. Very convenient for those arrive late.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very convenient location, connected directly to the airport. Had an early flight out the next morning and rolled our bags right to check in from the hotel desk. Hotel itself is super clean, new and modern. Room has all the amenities you would need and more. Staff was also incredibly helpful.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is literally in the airport so on the day of the flight we walked out of the hotel and were at baggage drop! Rooms are lovely, clean and fairly spacious. The hotel restaurant is quite expensive so we ventured out and ate at one of the places in the airport!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: From Seoul to Tokyo, with Korean air, I've always arrived in Haneda airport near 11pm. I tried other hotels which offer the shuttle bus from the airport to hotel but spending little more money and staying at this hotel were a best idea! I had pretty early morning schedule next day and the bus stops at the Haneda airport was so very convenient. The room was BIG for Japan standard, the airconditioner was great, the shower was wonderful with all the nice shampoo, conditioner and body gel. I highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We spent an hour before our overnight flight. 2000 yen per person will get you an individual room with towels, toothbrush, a hairbrush and shaver. Remember your deodorant though! My room had a massage chair which was greatly appreciated in preparation for an overnight flight. Access is before immigration at the rear of the check-in hall. I'll use this hotel again next time I'm in Haneda

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: For anyone arriving first time to Japan via Haneda Airport, this hotel is a Godsend in more ways than one. First its location upon arrival after a 12 or 14 hour flight is a bit hidden but an easy walk. Then next morning to connect to a local ANA flight in Business Class, the counter is just outside the hotel entrance to the right. Good English skills at this check in and control point. Being new we had wandered around the airport the next morning looking to find our connection when it was 50 paces away from the hotel.Front desk is pleasant and efficient. The rooms are small but well designed so they seem larger than they actually are. Very clean like all of Japan.We noticed no noise or disturbances. Truly a Godsend.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a PROFOUNDLY CONVENIENT hotel for those with morning flights. Walk, inside, just around the corner to the departure area. Be advised, "the room is not ready" if you are thirty minutes early for the three o'clock check-in time. It does magically become ready if one will pay an additional two thousand yen. Rooms are "cozy"...very "cozy"..no closet at all, clean and appointed with slippers, tooth brush, all the expected from a Japanese hotel. Breakfast is a mix: sautéed chicken, curry, miso soup, salad, sausage, pickles, coffee, fruit, juice. When one views the price for the breakfast buffet, and sees that the 2500 yen price is included as well as the convenience to the departure area the steep room charge is somewhat more level.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Quick and efficient check in and check out; tiny but nicely appointed room and bathroom (with all the amenities you can think of); good quality beds. The place is part of the international departures building, so from the "arrivals" to the hotel is a 4 min walk. A perfect place to spend the first night in Japan if arriving late at Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is at the end of the International Terminal. The rooms are more than adequate in terms of size and amenities. The bed was very comfortable with 2 large pillows. room had a large TV (with the BBC), desk room for a laptop or tablet, a very nice bathroom with great shower and automatic toilet, and very close to dining and convenience stores. Very helpful for late night international airplane arrivals or early morning international departures.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed overnight when traveling to Japan from the US. After a very exhausting day it was a relief to have a comfortable place to stay in the airport. The room was a tight squeeze for two beds and I wish there was a better room service menu.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Used day room for shower before the night flight back to Honolulu. Lounge has free drink and light snacks, variety was much better than airline lounge and it was such a great deal! Loved it. Will use again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very convenient for transit or if you have early morning flight; the hotel is attached to the departure hall of International Terminal. Room is small but clean. Expensive for hotel with small rooms. Service is average. Nothing special except location.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed at the Royal Park Hotel The Haneda for one night since we were on a late-arriving flight. The hotel is conveniently connected to the International terminal. Check-in was smooth and all of the staff could communicate well in English. Rooms were a bit small, but actually larger than most business hotels in Japan. Only complaint about the room is that the pillows were filled with small beads and not very comfortable.Good place to stay if you're arriving late or leaving on an early flight. If you want to sight-see in Tokyo, though, it would be better to stay in a more centrally located hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I just stayed this room for one night.Location : No doubt this hotel is located right next to the departure terminal. Once you land you just need to take an escalator up.Room : My room is small, and normal for Japanese standards. Surprisingly you could not hear a single airplane noise, however the hallway is quite noisy when you have people slamming or talking loudly. Every room is equipped with ample amenities. I also would like to add that the room is quite clean, and looks in good condition.Breakfast : I opted for breakfast in my package, and found the breakfast to be quite adequate

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon mainly because it was right next to the airport for our flight home. I was a little disappointed that we were not given the "royal treatment" that we had become so accustomed to in all the other hotels on our honeymoon. In other words - no room upgrade or special welcome message, and the room we were given was quite basic, even after we had mentioned it was our honeymoon to the hotel receptionist. However I think this is more of a business trip hotel and the main reason to stay here is it's perfect location for the airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is the nicest airport hotel I've stayed in. Super convenient, right around be the corner from check-in counters. Rooms are small by Western standards but perfectly adequate. Any time we fly through Japan I'll now try to go through Haneda so we can take a break at this hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Utterly quiet, with drip coffee bags as well as green tea to make in the morning. All the usual amenities, plus silky sheets and on the same floor as the Departure area. In the terminal, two floors are dedicated to shops, restaurants, a stage for occasional entertainments (cheerleading squads yesterday of pre-teens), many interactive things for kids to do, including flight simulators. Enough to fill more than 3-4 hours, even if you weren't staying overnight. There's a currency exchange machine in the lobby. The terminal is also directly connected to the Keikyu-Kuko line that goes right into town (on the Sumida River side), and to the inexpensive shuttle "limousine" buses that go to the City Air Terminal, if you have heavy luggage. Like in most hotels, there is free wi-fi, both "air" and an ethernet cable, with a separate secure password for each individual room.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is inside the international terminal at Haneda Airport, right next to the departure gates and many lovely shops and restaurants. I was amazed at how quiet the hotel is. I did not hear a plane, car or anything else. All I heard was silence, except when people where chatting walking down the corridor outside the room. The room is very clean, comfortable and well equipped. There is fast free wifi in the rooms.I had a late afternoon flight, so they let me check out at 2 pm for a nominal extra fee. I woke up late, went to the shops for coffee, breakfast and souvenir shopping, then came back, showered, packed and was on my way. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: First up, there are surprisingly good choices at Haneda:—there is the Haneda Excel Tokyo Hotel attached to the Domestic Terminal, especially good for ANA travelers;—the Hotel Royal Park is attached to the International Terminal, landslide;—but they also have an airside Transit Hotel off the international concourse, with prices that are competitive with or better than your average Yotel capsule offering elsewhere. To get the Royal Park:--head to the L check in at the far left of the International Check-In/Departures level, and follow the signs to the far back corner. For an airport hotel, the Royal Park is pretty nice (and pleasant to see after reading some surprisingly churlish reviews on this site). The rooms are indeed small, but, considering what is on offer at most European airside hotels in Heathrow, CDG, Amsterdam, or Frankfurt, lavish for the price. The funny part about our room is that the bathroom had the only window, in this case a picture window onto the runway, but it was bright and well organized. Excellent wifi and water pressure. A steamer trunk bench and globe table set the travel theme. Considering what is on offer airside Sound was the only issue. There is no sound communication between rooms, but the door onto the hallway captures all the conversations of people coming and going. Most guests probably don’t stay long enough at the hotel to realize how much the sound affects everyone in the rooms until they themselves are in bed at night.There are a ton of offerings for food adjacent to the hotel, on levels 4F and 5F above the departures level of the terminal. Our favorites were Sobamaedokoro and Ginza Okura in the Edo Marketplace, each in the ¥1500-2000 range. The hotel’s buffet breakfast looked fine at ¥2200, but we went instead for the Yoshinoya set breakfasts next door on 4F, at a very filling ¥500.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here the last 2 nights of our trip and on arrival we were thrilled. Beautifully presented and just steps away from the arrivals hall. On booking in it became apparent that my request from 3 weeks prior had not been read, as my friend and I had booked a night each and I wanted to ensure we could stay in the same room.What we had not realised is, I had booked a superior twin and she had booked a Hollywood twin which was half the size and not on the premium floor. We were told because of this we would have to move. I wasn't happy with this because although the mistake was ours, had they of read the email, they could have told us this and we could of made arrangements or changed the booking.However I didn't need to worry as the hotel, through good will, waivered any additional charges and allowed us to stay in the superior room.The room itself - 100% worth the extra money. It was spacious and beautifully decorated. Extras that were missing in the 4 Star Grand Prince were all here including large and small bottles of water, coffee machine (lovely coffee btw) and even a facial skin care pack including cleansers etc.Bedding was perfect, as was the mattress and as a lovely surprise along with our breakfast voucher (which you can use for lunch or dinner too instead, of which I would recommend using for dinner unless you enjoy a Japanese breakfast) we also got a drinks voucher for the bar! That was a super lovely treat and we both enjoyed a 700yen sparkling wine.Highly recommend the Royal Park as first/last night of trips and you can use the monorail in your JR Pass Thank you for a lovely few nights Royal Park.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As many have already written this really is the perfect choice for a hotel to stay at for the night before a flight from Haneda. The hotel is connected to the international terminal and it literally is just a few minutes walk from your room to the check in counters.The room was comfortable and impeccably clean. I asked to use a computer and printer and the staff guided me to a computer and printer close to the front desk which was free to use. I will stay here the next time I have a flight out of Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room is not big for two ppl, but the good design makes the space useful!The hotel is located in international terminal, we can do the bag drop first and back to the room and get some rest before aboard.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As a stop over it's very convenient as it's attached to the international departures at Haneda airport. Very clean with small rooms. I was impressed that the room had a bath in it but a bit confused that the bar closed between 3pm-5pm. What else are you meant to do to kill time? Obviously no room service either. Very odd!
user_name:
Juliet G
London, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A very good hotel for the night before a morning flight, as it is virtually steps away from the check-in area of the international terminal at Haneda Airport in Tokyo. They do all formalities upon arrival, so you leave the hotel without stress of check-out. I arrived via train from Kyoto on March 17th 2017 and did fly back to Europe the day after. My room was very small, althought having anything you would need for a short stay. This terminal has a lot of places to eat and possibilities for last minute shoppings. The Monorail provides connection to the other two terminals of Haneda Airport as well as to Down Town Tokyo. If you are a avation fan like me, you will love to go on the observation deck of the terminal, open 24/7 and free of charge. I even took the monorail to Tokyo (it takes 15min) to have dinner with friends. I would stay in this hotel if I had to take an early flight out of Haneda Airport again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you are arriving late on an international flight, or leaving late on a return flight, the Royal Park Hotel is conveniently located just off of the international departures area.Just steps away and so, so convenient. Quick check-in/check-out. Rooms are spacious and clean.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We found this hotel well appointed but small as is usual in Japan so difficult to use the wheelchair. There were tea making (Japanese) facilities and coffee bags included with good adjustable air conditioner. Staff were pleasant and helpful but there is no room service after 22:30 hours.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had quite early flight from Haneda and the Royal Park Hotel seemed to be fine hotel to select and indeed it was really convenient. All the services of a really nice airport was at hand and in the morning I just took a free bus to domestic terminal. The hotel is at the international terminal departure level. It was not quite easy to find as it was in the "back corner" but after that everything worked fine. The room was not very big considering the price. The design of the room was unique as you can see from the photos. There was just a brick wall behind my windows but that was OK as it was big bathroom window. The room was fine for me and actually I did not need a bigger one, it was just for sleeping and final packing. I had a dinner at the airport and did some shopping. I must also say that the staff was really nice and they helped me when I needed something.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you have to catch a flight from Haneda Airport, it is very convenient to use this hotel. The hotel has modern rooms with bathroom, TV. As a transit hotel it is a lot better than most other airport hotels I have stayed in.This is the second time I have used this hotel and will use it in the future again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Perfect location. Premium rooms overlooking the runway. Magnificent view. Convenient food and amenities. Free wifi. Very comfortable for a good night's relaxation before long haul flights. Excellent to stay in.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you have an early morning flight leaving Haneda Airport or one arriving very late (like mine at 11:15pm) I highly recommend you stay over at the Royal Park Hotel 'THE Haneda'... It is right there in the terminal building (behind the check-in desks on Level 3) and it is a lovely place to stay. The room was quite spacious, the bed was super comfortable, the decor was nice and I had a great view of Mt. Fuji from my bedroom window as a bonus, (I was in room 45 on the 6th Floor). The attention to detail was great too with THE branded bedding and wooden coat hangers... All made it that bit more special compared to many airport hotels. The free WiFi was reliable and fairly fast too. I will absolutely stay here again if needing to travel through Haneda Airport at unsociable hours. The room was not that expensive either at GB£119 for the night (that's about 16,000 Yen) booked on Expedia from the UK.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located right inside the international terminal, this is a very convenient place to stay if you are taking the next day flight and want to visit Tokyo for the day. You can normally get a great deal on the booking websites. The rooms are very clean and well equipped. They are small but you are in Japan so.....

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here for 6hrs during transit. Nice view (can see Mt. Fuji) from our room, comfortable beds and we had a few-hour good rest in this hotel before taking another flight :) just a bit inconvenient as they don't accept US dollars :/

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I arrived alone in the evening so booked this hotel since it is located right in the airport terminal. What a bonus to have such a beautiful hotel to stay in on first night in Japan. The service at the reception counter when checking in was excellent which I would soon discover is the Japanese way. The room was small but so well designed to provide all amenities one would need. It was spotless as well. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel especially if you want to be at or near the Haneda airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Standard business hotel won't exceed your expectations. Clean, reasonably spacious by Tokyo standard, no bathtub. It charges roughly 10% to 20% more than a similar room in city centre for its location - the hotel's only entrance is connecting to the departure hall of Haneda airport. It's within 2-3 minutes to get to the check-in counter! Unbeatable location for travellers for early morning flights or those arriving very late at night. I recommend this hotel to them with no hesitation.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I'm a little surprised at the low rating, but if you look at some of the comments, it's clear that they may be comparing it to other hotels. Frankly, you probably are only thinking of staying here if you are in a situation like mine, getting off a 9 hour flight near midnight local with a couple of very sleepy kids in tow. For that, it was ideal.Small rooms? Of course. They are for sleeping in. Great showers, comfortable beds, really hard to find something to complain about.But, of course, the selling point here is location! Out of the plane and into a room in no time flat. I wish more of the restaurants were open later. (Yoshinoya not cutting it, and the hotel restaurant was closed.) But otherwise, pretty much ideal... for an airport :).

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed here on the last night of my vacation in Japan. It made perfect sense since I had a domestic flight from Hokkaido to Haneda, and my international flight back home left from Haneda the next afternoon. The hotel is quite literally IN the international terminal, so I was a 90-second walk from my airline's check-in counter. The room was small but clean, and the front desk staff was very polite and efficient. They secured and held onto my bags after I checked out so that I could spend a few more hours in Tokyo before my flight left. An unexpected bonus: a lovely view of Mt. Fuji (about 70 miles/120km away) thanks to a very clear morning sky!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I wouldn't say more than this is a standard hotel airport. It is very clean, has a little style to it and is equipped with everything you will probably need. It's comfortable and quiet but the one point that changes the rating of this hotel from a three to a four is the location. We were leaving on an early morning flight from Haneda and did not wish to have to rush to check-in for our flight. The entrance to the hotel is located no more than 100 metres from the check-in desks for international departures. If leaving on an early morning international flight I would recommend staying here, if not, there are similar hotels not too far away that cost far less than our stay here did.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This was our 2nd visit to Tokyo. The last time, we stayed in Ebisu and ended up taking a taxi to get to places. This time, we stayed here for 2 nights before heading home. Honestly, I would rather stay here and just take the Keikyu or JR to go to the diff places in Tokyo. It is so convenient to stay in a hotel right where the international terminal is. You can easily check in upon arrival and check out without having to hire a van or taxi for your luggages. Really clean and modern hotel. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Like most hotels at the airports, you don't look for a big room but at least neatly packed and being functional. A lot of dining options at the airport and many more new attractions for passenger that like exploring airports. This time of year, if facing north, you can also view Mt. Fuji from the rooms.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Great place to stat if you arrive late, leave early or are working close to the airport. Rooms are small but comfortable. Plenty of dining options close by and the possibility of room service. Some rooms have baths which is quite good after a long flight.There are also 'refresh' rooms you can hire for an hour with shower facilities and a massage chair.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here for just 1 night to catch an early flight the next morning. This hotel is about 30 minutes by car from the Tokyo city centre. Arriving at the hotel, you would need to get into the International Terminal building, head to the departure hall and proceed towards Check-in Row L where you can see the enterance to the hotel.Check-in (at the hotel) is a breeze and efficient. Got a Deluxe Room for my family of 3 and we got 3 single beds where 1 is converted from a sofa. The room size is comfortable and the toilet is spacious, especially the shower area. They provide lots of quality toiletries. The beds are comfortable and so is the pillow. This hotel is also very accessible to the restaurants in the airport departure area. Had a great stay in this hotel and the next morning, I woke up with a nice view of Mount Fuji!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel is ok, and particularly very well located in the international airport.No need to go out of airport. Very convenient to check in in the morning.However, rooms are pretty small.Bathroom is small too.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed overnight with my son as he had to catch an early British airways flight to London.I believed the check in time was 2 pm and as we were travelling from Kyoto we reached half an hour early. The reception asked for extra money for early check in (30 minutes early)! I refused and left the luggage there to browse the shops in the airport instead. Although the amount was not much, the way it was conveyed in a robotic way was disappointing.Apart from this initial hassle everything else is fine. Room is small but functional. The restaurant is expensive but there are lots of choices in the airport for food.Good functional hotel but a bit on the expensive side but customer service could be improved.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room rate is not cheap. But then again they gave me a Quad room, stricter hotels might make us book 2 rooms for our family of four.The hotel and rooms are in fairly new & good condition. And it's a nice touch to have 4 sets of pyjamas waiting in our room - knowing full well that airport hotel customers would not look to unpack a great deal.The added bonus is the view of beautiful Mount Fuji as one takes the 2 minute walk from hotel to airport in the morning . It sure was nice to get a night of good sleep without being too rushed in the next morning to get to the airport for our morning flight .Access to the hotel was so easy. Get on Yamanote line from Tokyo station to Hamamatsucho station, followed by Monorail, all within 30 minutes. This must be one of the easiest & shortest journeys between any City Centre & its international airport .I'm glad the Royal Park was an option to choose from .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I've stayed here twice now as a result of late night arrival at Haneda Airport and the hotel is conveniently located to reach within just a few minutes of arriving.Whether you have a late night arrival or early morning departure, The Royal Park provides a modern, stylish and comfortable place to stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is the 3rd time I stayed in this hotel. The 1st time I gave it good rating for its great location and value for money.Now, the rate is double with no breakfast included. I had no choice because I am on an early flight and the location is really great. But I dun think it worth it. The room is small. You dun get a good view if they place you at the lower floor that they usually do. I believe the upper floors are reserved for those frequently stay captains.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our overnight lay-over in Haneda. The hotel is clean and modern. If you book the secured hotel, you enter through the airport terminal and don't have to go through customs. Then, when you check out, you don't have to go through security because you never left the airport. The hotel has free snacks and water.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had a layover in Tokyo, arriving in Haneda at 10pm, and needing to transfer to Narita the next morning. This hotel is incredibly convenient, right in the international terminal, and this convenience was much appreciated after a 14 hour trip from New York. Check in was smooth, our rooms were small but comfortable, and we appreciated all the amenities so that we didn't even have to unpack our bags to brush teeth and shower. The next morning we were easily able to catch the airport shuttle service to Narita after a good night's rest.
user_name:
Juliet4701
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I was traveling from Honolulu to Hong Kong and decided to stop over night in Tokyo to break up the trip. I've stayed a number of times at this property and I've always had a pleasant experience.The rooms although small, are very stylish, clean and comfortable. They make great use of every inch of space in the room! The usual amenities are provided including house slippers and yukata robes. The staff is helpful and have a good command of the English language.There is a restaurant in the hotel and there are many eating venues and shops in the international terminal.The best part is that the hotel is literally steps away from the airline check-in counters!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This was a normal sized, and priced airport hotel, possibly a little better than most. NO complaints about the room, service, sleep quality etc. The only suggestion I have here on TA is that we didn't realise (we were tired) there were many restaurants within a short walk just inside the terminal and up one level. This gives you far greater (and cheaper) choice than eating at the hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Clean, well equipped/furnished, inside the International terminal. Wifi is decent. Shuttle bus to the domestic terminal is reachable within 2 mins walk on the first floor (hotel is on the 4th floor). Standard pricing for such quality airport hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The rooms at this hotel are tiny, but it's location is unbeatable. Nice showers but pillows were a bit weird..We stayed for an overnight let to catch an early morning connecting flight to Sapporo.The hotel is located on the 3F - on the departures floor of the international terminal. Took us 10 minutes to check in and we were in our rooms. The restaurant on the lobby floor is not 24 hours so we had to go into the airport for some food at around 11pm when we arrived.There's a connection to the domestic terminal via 1F shuttle bus at bus stop no 0. Definitely recommended for ease of access and convenience if you are looking for a stopover/long transit in Haneda airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I got a good deal on this hotel via my app. I had been in Japan for 4 weeks and needed a bit of time out, it was also my first time flying out of this airport. I went for one of the executive rooms, as a bit of a treat. While it was not a huge room, the lay out worked really well. The bed was great, the shower was excellent. Service was really good at this hotel, the girl in the lobby allowed me to check in a little early which is rare in Japan.The location could not be better, right next to the check in desks!!The attached bar was really good too, great service. Will be staying here again next time I fly from here.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It is a very confortable airport hotel, following japanese standards of room size and facilities. Nice bed with a smooth lighting system, bathroom with a good bathtub and cosmetics. The attendants are very kind and understand english. I did not have the chance to have breakfast because my flight was very early. Anyway, I had an excellent 5 hours bedtime between my flights, recomend it.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here the night before we flew back to the USA. Our rationale was since we were scheduled for an early morning flight we would not have to travel to Haneda during rush hour with all of our bags. We took the train to the monorail and the monorail stops right at the terminals, domestic or international, with extra sections set aside for your extra luggage. We arrived too early to check in but like many Tokyo hotels we were allowed to store our bags, since we had reservations, until it was check in time. A big plus since arriving early might work best with ones schedule.The hotel is at the south side of the International terminal with plenty of signage showing the way. You will walk along the side of a restaurant on the way there, just so you don't feel as if you are going the wrong way. The staff at the front desk were the usual Japanese perfect example of greetings and assisting. Always gracious hosts and very efficient while doing it. The hotel is immaculately clean in the public areas and the private rooms. It is well maintained and everything worked.If you are staying here on your journey home then you should already be familiar with the Japanese heated toilet seats, if just arriving it will be easy as the instructions are also in English. The television had three channels that were either broadcast or closed captioned in English, which was a change for us as it was the first TV we had watched in the nearly five weeks we had been in Japan.The beds were very comfortable and the room nicely laid out.There is the fore mentioned restaurant just outside the hotel doors and near the center of the terminal there are a multitude of various restaurants available on the second or third floor.There is also an English speaking medical clinic in the terminal just in case.There is a walk out area on the back side, behind the restaurants that you can go outside and watch the planes arrive/depart. There are picnic tables and the usual vending machines.The only problem we encountered was the location of our rooms, the floor below the lobby. Since the lobby has hard tile floors each and every time a guest rolled their suitcases across the floor it transmitted that noise along our ceiling waking us a couple of times during the night. If not for this I would have rated the hotel a five star.So beware if you are on the fourth floor back towards the terminal.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had approximately 24 hours in Tokyo; I arrived at 23:00, and my flight left 22:00 the next day.The Royal Park Haneda is connected to the International Terminal, so there's no need to take a shuttle (unless arriving/departing to a domestic flight).The entrance is on the Departures Level (3), so from arrivals, take an elevator up and go right (north). It's right past the last row of check-in counter (Row L).Checking in was very easy; I'd booked and prepaid so it was very easy. I thought it was interesting that they did not ask for a credit card for incidentals.When I got to the room, I realized why: there is no room service nor mini bar(PICK UP SOME WATER AND/OR SNACKS AT THE TERMINAL BEFORE YOU HEAD UP YOUR ROOM--otherwise it's a long walk back).The elevators are at one end of the hotel. The higher your room number, the longer your walk will be. The room was fine; comfortable bed, but pillows were odd. Pajamas and slippers provided. TV, cable, excellent wi-fi, and lots of power outlets. Modern clean bathroom with good amenities (shaving and dental kits, too).Check out time is strictly 11:00.From Haneda, it's very easy to get to Tokyo for the day. It's much closer than Narita. The airport limousine bus system is great, and the subway comes right to the train station. A cab would cost about 7,000 yen average to most part of Tokyo (eg Ginza).

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Good location. Within the international airport. Lots of places to eat. The room was quiet and clean. Perfect location if you don't plan to go into Tokyo city at all. Good airport view through the windows. Only problem was adjusting the heating temperature in the room was kind of tricky for me in winter. Either too hot or too cold. In the end I turn heating off totally.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We were heading to Niseko and had two days to wait out , decided to stay in Haneda rather than in Tokyo, it was the right decision. Hotel is so conveniently located on the 3rd level of the International terminal. Our luggages were literally rolled into the rooms with the same airport trolley, no need to exit and board bus in the cold winter. We easily walked to the 4th level for wide range of dining. We got on the train at 2nd level to Tokyo city in 30min to spend the whole day and stayed for a dinner in Ginza before heading back. Next morning, took the shuttle to the domestic terminal for flight to Chitose.It was so convenient and accessible.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My family of 4 stayed at the Deluxe Twin Room of Royal Park Hotel Haneda on 2016/12/24. The room was clean and comfort. It was a little bit small, however, to accommodate 4 adults with 4 regular luggages. The entrance of the hotel is right next to the departure hall of the International Terminal, very convenient for an overnight stay in case of late arrival or prior to early morning departure.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This location is handy for an overnight stay before travelling on the next day. Staff were polite, friendly and spoke English. Heading to the city area was easy with the monorail, on the rapid train it takes less than 20 minutes. Room was clean, beds comfortable and all necessary toiletries provided.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is attached to the airport, so it was perfect after a long flight. It was easy to find, and check-in was efficient. The reason I picked this hotel was because I arrived in the late evening, and I had to get my JR Pass in the morning (the office was already closed by the time I touched down). The room was pretty standard but comfortable. There was just enough room for luggage. Shower was great with a nice pressure. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay.I would certainly recommend this hotel if you have to stay overnight at Haneda, although it is a bit on the pricey side.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Royal Park Hotel gave us a wonderful head start of our 2 weeks holiday in Tokyo. We were extremely glad we booked a hotel as we arrived at 10pm w 2 kids (5 yo & 14mths old). It was raining cats and dogs outside. This hotel is at the end of the terminal. Easy to find.The room was small but there were 2 beds placed next to each other, good enough for the 4 of us. It was well equipped w a kettle, water bottles and i have to specially mention the bathroom. It was not only clean but very dainty and has more than was what needed. Foaming hand wash/facial wash, the shampoo/conditioner/body shampoo was of good quality and they even prepare cute combs, shaver and tooth brush in different colours.This hotel exceeded my expectation. We had a good sleep and was all refreshed the next day!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel is conveniently located on departure level (level3) with internal access from the airport to the hotel. There are two sections, public area and transit area, which means you don't have to clear custom if you have a transit flight.Room is small but tidy and good enough for a short stay. Staff are friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Arrived into Haneda at 7:30pm, went directly to the hotel which is attached to the terminal. No walking outside, no taking another bus, just roll your stuff to the front desk and check in. Rooms were relatively on the small side (even for Japan), but they were more than sufficient for one night and had everything you need in a hotel room. Beds were comfortable, shower pressure strong, plus you get the heated toilet seat. Room was very quiet so easy to get a good night's sleep. Would stay here again if I was passing through just like this time.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: So easy to get to simply by walking to the end of the terminal at the departure level. Its quite a large hotel, very comfortable, if somewhat small rooms but very well equipped. Excellent welcoming english speaking staff. After a long flight its the perfect place to recharge before continuing the journey in Japan.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Location is superb. Connected directly to the international terminal and easily accessible from other terminals by regular free shuttle buses.Also, we left a watch behind in our room but only discovered this after we'd gone through security and immigration. Hotel staff coordinated brilliantly with JAL staff to return the watch before our flight left.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My family recently booked a 1 night stay or the Royal Park The Haneda. As with al Royal Park hotels in Japan it was fantastic. After an exhausting flight from the US we were starving but also ready to collapse! The hotel was an 8 minute walk if that from the arrival exit inside the airport. Checkin was simple (although we had to pay for our stay in advance...not quite sure why?) and the room comfortable for the three of us and best described as modern elegance. We had dinner (very good BTW) at the (many) restaurants inside the airport. Wide selection for all tastes and right outside the hotel entrance. I highly recommend a stroll across old Nihonbashi Bridge which takes you back to old Edo! Beds were comfortable and the included buffet breakfast was excellent in selection (not huge but tasty) and quality. Great for a overnight stay after landing, a layover, or a night prior to leaving. This kind of captive hotel is exactly the kind of place that doesn't need to be good but they did not sacrifice quality and comfort...and I am glad they didn't. My 9 year old daughter gave two thumbs up and liked the observation deck to watch the planes.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is situated in the depature terminal of the international airport so it is very convinient for people who have travelled for many hours. Breakfast was good. Nice and serviceminded staff. Nice bathroom.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed for one night in a comfort single room after landing late in the evening into Haneda. The hotel is located in the corner of the departures area and is reasonably well signposted. The check-in was efficient. My room was at the end of a long corridor, but I did not mind this as I wanted to be away from potential noise from the lift/elevator. There was virtually no noise in the room apart from the air conditioning unit. The bathroom was clean and equipped with all necessary toiletries. The bed was comfortable and I had no trouble sleeping through the night. This is an excellent choice prior to or after a long flight and pretty good value considering the location.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located on the departure level of Haneda airport international terminal. Friendly staff. We asked for soft pillows which were brought to the room promptly. Room and bathroom were small but perfectly adequate. The bed was comfortable and we slept really well. Didn't hear any noise from the airplanes. Quite a few restaurants in the terminal to choose from. The bar had a great selection of spirits but only one brand of (average) gin which was slightly disappointing. Would use this hotel again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Good Japanese size room, very clean and modern, Queen size bed, air purifier, small refrigerator, nice bath room, good amenities, and good service. Very convenient.If u r visiting Tokyo for only a short time, this is a good hotel

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed here also unexpectedly after a flight was missed. It is clean, efficient and easy to get in/out of Haneda. I would recommend it. The restaurant is also good. The wifi worked well. Small rooms, but it's not meant for a long term stay.
user_name:
DCJD2012
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Super quiet, great service, good price points, located at airport terminal, efficient, friendly, multilingual - the way that all international airport hotels should be run. Tokyo Town Themed Food Court is steps away.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located at one end of the airport on the 3rd floor, it is the only hotel within the international terminal. As you walked into the lobby from the departure terminal, you will first walk past the hotel restaurant where you can take in all the delicious aroma from the food. Hotel lobby was tastefully decorated with plenty of seating space. Room was small but well furnished and very inviting. 2 sets of pyjamas and bedroom slippers were provided. All in all, a very comfortable and convenient choice!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Well, there is of course a transit hotel at Haneda airport, the kind of place where you feel locked into a cubicle without windows. Convenient and probably cheaper than my preferred option...... which is the Royal Park Hotel The Haneda. It is located in the international departure terminal, so after arriving from wherever, you don't even need to step outside if you don't want to or if it's pouring with rain as during my last visit in Tokyo. The hotel has a lovely luxury atmosphere, and staff are very helpful and multi-lingual. There is a restaurant in the hotel which looks very nice, but then there is also a multitude of restaurants and shops right inside the terminal which are well worth exploring.The hotel is comparatively expensive, but the view from my room was simply stunning. The WIFI is fast and the room snug (in a typical Japanese way) but well-appointed. If I ever spend another night at Haneda, I won't look any further than the Royal Park.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located on the international departure floor of Haneda airport, the location can not be better than this hotel. And unlike many other airport hotels, this newish hotel is spacious and very modern (you would not feel you are in the airport). You can even check the latest flight schedule on TV in the room. There is only one restaurant / bar in the hotel but there are lots of good restaurants in the airport and you can get there in 1 min without going outside. The service is very attentive and good as well. This is the best airport hotel I have ever stayed.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is very modern and in a good location. Unfortunately it's no good for foreigners, very small and very, very overpriced. Rooms are tiny, with plastic bathrooms. TV instructions on screen are in English, but remote control in Japanese and you need it to scroll through TV menus. Same with the aircon, which when you can get it working, doesn't cool the room, even though it's the size of a small minivan!Check-in and checkout take forever. Breakfast is minimal, but costs US$30!!!! A ridiculous price for what is on offer, but you are trapped in the terminal which is also way overpriced.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park is located at one end of the International terminal at Haneda, which includes a great set of restaurants. My room was immaculately clean and functional with good temperature control and free internet. I checked in at 2 PM, an hour early, for which I had to pay an extra 1100 yen ($12)-- very reasonable and they also upgraded my room. I really like the Handea airport and it is hard to imagine a better airport hotel situation. There is a wealth of public transportation available at Haneda, of course. And, my room was very reasonably priced. Note that one cannot walk between the international terminal and the two domestic terminals. There are shuttle busses for this.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you arrive late at night to Tokyo or have several hours in transit in the Haneda Airport, I highly recommend to have a reservation in this hotel.It is located inside the international terminal of the Haneda Airport. I arrived in an international flight at night and had to make a connection the next morning. I followed the signals of Connecting Flights and cross through Security. Do not go to immigration or pick up your baggage unless you want to go out the terminal. Once you cross Security, you can look for the hotel. It is not very far. All the female staff in the airport is very nice and though English communication might be a challenge, they are super nice and try to help.The hotel provides a pijama and slippers. The bed is very comfortable. The toilet and shower are great. There is a TV and a closet. You have everything. The lighting, the switches, the clock with alarm. Everything is perfectly set. These guys think twice before doing something.I paid a total of 13,100 yens (about 130 USD), tax included, in cash (they do not accept USD cash) for the night or to be precise for a 10 hours single transit room. There is a lounge room inside the hotel where there is free coffee, tea, water, cookies, waffles, donuts and instant noodle soups. I was not a fan of most of those, but the coffee, tea and cookies were good, and very convenient.I would suggest to make a reservation beforehand because I think there are few rooms. Send an email o make a phone call info-haneda@rph-the.co.jp TEL: +81 3-6830-1111This was a transit rooms hotel, but I think the Royal Park also have other hotel facilities for leisure and for sure I would like to try them in the future.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had a late arriving flight into Haneda and was heading down to the port of Yokohama in the morning so chose to stay at the Royal Park Hotel at the airport. The Hotel is directly accessible from the International Terminal and you can take the luggage cart with you into the hotel. I booked a Double which, by Western standards, was still quite small (18m on up) but was very well-appointed and comfortable, with basic toiletries provided and those terrific Toto toilets. The hotel also laid out complimentary cotton pajamas (cut for a more traditional Japanese frame, though, so a bit short on me). My rate included breakfast, which was a nice buffet with a mix of Japanese and Western items, hot and cold. If you have a connecting flight with a long layover or a later arrival, the Royal Park is an excellent choice and highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We landed in Haneda Airport too late at night to connect to our domestic flight. We did not know the city and were very tired. This hotel, located at the end of the International Terminal was wonderful, stress-free, with all the comforts one needs after a 14 hour trip.We already booked this hotel for our next trip when we, again, arrive too late for our domestic connection.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Perfect over night halt at Haneda. I would fly out of Haneda again purely based on this hotel. It is excellent and really so close to downtown Tokyo that you could get in and back easily. Good bar, quiet rooms, breakfast was good etc etc.I did notice a very long queue to register guests when I went down for a drink, people did look fairly annoyed. Not my problem but this did seem to be bothering others. Although, given it is Japan, I am sure there was a very good, if nonsensical reason, for people to being held up.Some of the flight crews seemed to stay here as well, this is usually a good sign.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Located inside the Haneda Airport, this hotel could not be better situated. Compact rooms with every amenity to satisfy travelers' needs. Their attentive staff, excellent restaurant, Transit Lounge and calm atmosphere, made our departure completely stress free.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park Hotel is part of the new Haneda International Airport complex. Unlike many airport hotels, the Royal Park is only steps away from the departures hall. The monorail (you can use your JR Railways pass) stops at the International Terminal and is also just a short walk away.Apparently there is another entrance to the hotel airside – so connecting passengers don’t even need to clear customs and immigration. Both sides are obviously kept separate.We stayed one night in the landside half of the hotel as we were flying out of Haneda the next morning.To be honest I wasn’t expecting much, perhaps a small basic room with a small bed. And that was fine for the price – just somewhere to sleep before our flight. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel was actually pretty good.Check in was smooth and the man on the desk said he’d given us a larger room. We took the elevator to our floor and realised that our room was at the end of a long corridor.When we arrived the room had a large bed and a small separate lounge area.Pyjamas were laid out nicely on the bed.The bathroom had a typical electronic toilet, shower and washbasin with multiple amenities, including toothbrushes, razors etc.We went for a walk around the terminal as I’d heard there were some good restaurants there – in fact there was an entire Japanese-themed walk, with plenty of great restaurants.We ate in Yaki Niku Champion 焼肉チャンピオン 羽田店 which was excellent.Back in our room, the pillows were a little strange – they felt like they’d been stuffed with small rocks. The bed was maybe too hard for some. But we had a good night’s sleep and were ready for our flight the next morning.We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel as we were expecting to eat this in the ANA Lounge – sadly that was a mistake and the ANA lounge had the same food as in the evening.I’d definitely recommend booking a night at the Royal Park if you are flying out of Haneda early – or even arriving late and want to rest before starting your Japanese journey.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Great hotel. The location is so convenient right inside the airport. And the train station is a short walk away. Great room and not as small as I thought it may be. Great service, which is what I experienced throughout my stay in Tokyo. I'll definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located in international permanent of Haneda Airport. It is easy to find, and my checkin with seamless.My room was well appointed with a shower and a bath. The bed looks very comfortably, and the lighting was more than adequate.There is an art gallery in the corridor of the third floor of the hotel, which is very interesting and there are exhibits of contemporary art. Very pleasant. Who is a public access computer, which also allows you to print.I very much enjoyed my stay here save two features:I have no idea what the pillow is stuffed with, but I suspect rice. I am sure the hotel will be able to find a more comfortable pillow than the one on your bed if you ask. My pillow was dreadful.Breakfast at Tailwind was poor and the restaurant over crowded. Insured, the hotel is very convenient if you are stopping over at Haneda airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Arrived late from a domestic flight before international flight next morning (wanted to avoid the red eye flight). Took free shuttle from domestic terminal to international terminal. Hotel just behind the check in desk. Expensive even by Japan standards but brand new and lively restaurant inside and multiple other restaurants options above check in. Convenient if you can afford.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Think of the smallest hotel room that you have stayed in in the USA. This one will be much smaller like cruise ship size. It is nicely appointed and the staff is very helpful. This is not to say the rooms are bad but if you are travelling with your spouse or otherwise sharing a room, you may have to sleep with your luggage.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It's actually quite fun to stay at the international terminal. There's the observation deck for watching planes taking off and landing, a flight simulator, a load of nice restaurants and shops and little Edo which is beautifully made to look like a traditional part of Japan. The hotel itself is thus a convenient place to stay. You can actually take your luggage trolley to the room. Rooms are spacious enough, comfortable and functional.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed for one night. Very good hotel with direct access from Departure Level of international terminal (past Check in station 'L'). Fast check in & check out, good sized room. Highly recommend this accomodation

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed at the Royal Park Haneda for one night before an early morning flight. Location and access are great with the option of having dinner at the airport. There are some nice eateries.Staff was very nice, but unfortunately we could not sleep. The bed was hard as a rock, the pillows were stuffed with I-don´t-know-what (rice, wood chips?) and the room was somewhat loud and we could hear other guests.Considering that a good night sleep is the most important thing I am looking for in a hotel, I cannot recommend this hotel. We were exhausted the next morning as we barely managed to sleep.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room is adequate, not large by Japanese standard. The location is great if you arrive late at night or have to catch an early morning flight. The breakfast was average but you can walk out to the many restaurants in the International Terminal which is 100m away.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel is conveniently located in the airport, less than 100 m away from international check in hall. Tens of restaurants at the airport for a dining experience. To my surprise, the room was very quiet, despite its location on airport premises.Rooms are tiny though and breakfast very expensive. In a nutshell hotel is adequate for one night stays.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
