review_body: Staff are welcoming. Decor and presentation immaculate (as you come to expect in Japan).Rooms are comfortable and well maintained. Free pygamas in the premium rooms. Free wifi.Best of all it is located directly within the terminal building.Not cheap, but you get what you pay for.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had a great stay at the Royal Park. It is attached to the airport and so was an easy walk in to check in for our flight in the morning. The facilities at the hotel are great and staff were very helpful and friendly

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This branch of royal park hotel is so convenient that it's must stay if you have an early morning flight. We were catching the 8.50 BA flight so decided to stay the night before. Got the airport shuttle bus from town which drops you right outside. The hotel is also only steps away from the departure gate. There are lots of restaurants in the departure lounge and at the hotel. They do a nice breakfast and was glad of it as they don't serve food on the plane for ages. The rooms are small but adequate. Great shower.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is super well located, very easy to get to from the airport and close to a series of restaurants and shops!The rooms are ver comfortable - small, but practical, which is really what you need for an airport hotel.I would say staff is really polite, but requests are not promptly accommodated as in other Royal Park hotels - for instance, we've checked-in 5h earlier in the one in Shiodome with no extra cost and they wanted to charge us for 30min earlier on this one!Overall, I think is a nice hotel - restaurant a bit over priced, but room prices are worth it for the convenience and comfort of the place.If you have the time, you can also pop into Tokyo as it's only 30min on the train!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Despite the hotel is nicely appointed, with clean and modern check-in area, once you get to the room is like the tiniest cage you could ever imagine. I planned to sleep there from mid-night until 6 am. Once I got in bed it was like concrete! I started getting back pain after 5 minutes, numbing all over, the pillows (if one can call that a pillow) were filled with wood or some sort of rocks!Absolutely unacceptable, for people that want to have a good night sleep, specially before taking long flights. To summarize, I slept as if had slept on the street floor, with horrible hard as rock pillows, with pain all over the body and simply did not rest. I gave up and left aroubd 5 am to the airport check-in area.I do not recommend this place to anyone, not even enemies!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Convenient 3 minute walk from the International Terminal exit but comparatively pricey for twin beds and modest amenities...guess the lovely view of Tokyo Bay over the parking lot may offer some consolation.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel in located in the HND international airport, perfect if you land in Japan in late hours and you don't want to go around Tokyo in the late night.Staff is friendly and welcoming, they were very fast in the checkin procedures.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This was the first time I have transited at Haneda airport so I needed a place to stay over night. I booked the Royal Park based on its location - inside the international terminal and reviews.This hotel is right inside the terminal. You need to go through immigration and upstairs to the departure area. The hotel is on the far left - if looking directly into the terminal from the entrance - down a hall. You have to go down the hall to the right and then to the left. There is a nice restaurant on the corner that closes at 10 pm. The check in was seamless - everyone really polite. My room was small - but that is Japan - and clean. The bathroom was clean with an electronic toilet. You have to push the button on the wall to flush it... It was quiet and dark during the night. The room service was very limited so I went out into the terminal to eat. There is an escalator near the hotel and upstairs there are several restaurants that are open late.The next day it was super easy to check in for my flight. There wasn't a lot of people so the immigration and security went fast.I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A nice stopover hotel. Room is small, but very good service! By the mistake of bookings, the counter representative helped her best to cancel another day of the booking and not charged. Very appreciated to the service.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel fit what we needed- a room with 5 beds close to the airport. We were able to check in right after getting our baggage. We got a family room- it had 5 beds and was HUGE. Of course, it was a bit expensive, but we were still happy we stayed here. The have nice pajamas for everyone to sleep in.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: For a hotel at an airport, the Royal Park Hotel Haneda was a breath of fresh air. I flew into Haneda in the evening and was flying out to America the next day so stayed here overnight. It was just what I was looking for. Comfortable, and spotless. As a female, solo traveler I felt safe, and it was easy to find. They have a restaurant/bar downstairs that also serves breakfast and the lobby will give you information on how best to travel into Tokyo if you have time. The only issue I had was early check out, so I was left wandering around the airport for a few hours, but there are a few different restaurants/shops in the airport so it wasn't a huge deal.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: i was looking for a hotel close to the terminal... so far so good ... the royal park was connected to the terminal ... hence very good location for early flights. on arrival at 1330h i was informed i could not check-in until 15h, despite rooms being available. no room for negotiation ... :-(. rooms are so small that there is a smoke detector warning if you leave the bathroom door open while showering in the very small bathroom. very little english guidance material in the room. restaurant food and service was average at best. very little, if any ambience. no business area to work in. overall disappointing experience, despite the location.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We spent one night At the Royal Park Hotel after flying from Phoenix, Arizona. This hotel is located in the International Terminal. Our room was "very" small, but the shower was excellent and the bathroom was equipped with all the essentials. P'J's were even included! The buffet was very good... a lot of Japanese food.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is directly accessible from the terminal and is extremely convenient for a quick night's sleep. We got in at about 11 pm and the hotel restaurant was closed but late night dining options like mos burger and yoshinoya are just 5 mins walk away in the airport terminal. The room, though small, was comfortable. It even had 2 air purifiers and a coffee machine. Would visit again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you have an early flight out of Haneda airport (not Narita!) or a late flight in, this is a great hotel. Clean and tiny (and tidy) in the Japanese style, you can walk to it from the airport terminal. There are two trains that connect you to the vast Tokyo rail network, including a rare Monorail, initially built in the 1960s. My room was small, but well equipped, and comfortable. I'm not sure I could have shared it with another person. It's worth booking a room with breakfast as it's pretty expensive by itself and you'll find there aren't many breakfast options at the airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is connected to the International Terminal. Less than a 2min walk from hotel reception to the check in desks. Ideal if you have a late arrival or early departure. Some of the rooms even over look the airport - fantastic views. A big 'Thank You' to Ai Matsubara in Reservations. Thanks to their advice and guidance, I was able to reserve the perfect room.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My husband and I decided to check in at this hotel because it was already late to venture out and check out other hotels that night; so glad we chose this one! Although it's a bit pricey, it was worth it because our room was amazing! So modern and minimalist in design, the bed was so comfortably delicious and just so cozy! Won't hesitate coming back here when we schedule our Japan tour soon! Best one night layover!!!!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We were in our room within 45 minutes of touching down at Haneda on a flight from the US, so it's really convenient. Great transit hotel. Be forewarned; the mattress on the bed in our room felt like a sheet of plywood.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Had a flight where I arrived late at night into Haneda airport and then in the morning would have to travel to Narita airport for next flight. This is by far the most convenient hotel. It's located on the 3rd floor (departure floor/ check in) all the way at one end. FYI arrivals are on the second floor, so just take escalator up one floor. I booked hotel thru hotels.com. There was an additional "tax" of 100yen that I had to pay. Otherwise check in was quick, and receptionist spoke friendly English. The hotel has its own dining area and bar, but you can easily access the great selection in the airport area. The room was good size by Japanese standards. Bathroom had everything you would need and great quality and smelling shampoo/ body wash/ conditioner/ face wash. The bed was comfortable and the pillow was ingenious. Pillow could be soft or firm, higher or lower. There's a small card that explains its features. The wifi is fast. I rested so well and was appreciative that it was so conveniently located because after those long flights, I just want to lay down as soon as possible. A little information about transferring to Narita. You can buy a ticket on the limousine bus on the second floor (I prefer this to taking the train because worried I'll get lost and this is the most direct). Cost for me was 3100 yen one way, or you can ask for a round trip about 4500 yen. Ticket place opens at 5am. Line looks long but moves quickly. After purchasing ticket, ask for a small map that will explain how to get to bus stop (essentially it's on the first floor). I have nothing but good things to say. I will definitely use this hotel again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As a royal park hotel regular customer I called up to book and was quoted 25,000 JPY, so I checked at haneda information centre at arrivals and was quoted 17,000. When I explained at checkin they laughed at me!! Not the best start. Service is pleasant otherwise. The rooms are TINY, more like a capsule hotel. Sadly no English channels on TV. The bar looks fun and actually would be a good place to hang out rather than the room....

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I've stayed at the Royal Park Hotel The Haneda more than a few times on layovers at Haneda. The hotel is located in the departures lobby, so if you're coming in off an international flight you'll need to go up to the third floor. The hotel gets a huge amount of use from travelers and airline crews, so the rooms definitely feel a bit dated and used. They are clean, and appointed with basic amenities you'll want during a layover. Wifi is fast. Check in was extremely quick every time I've been there, despite a large number of people coming and going. The rooms are not totally soundproof, so you can hear things in the hallway if people are being very noisy, but the rooms are quiet enough for me. Ther was a bit of a smell in one of my rooms, probably someone had smoked there (which is against the rule). Ultimately a fine hotel if you need a place to lay your head during a 10+ hour layover in HND and aren't interested in going into the city. Prices are good for what you get. Rooms are small, but I only come here to sleep. Breakfast isn't included, never ate there. Room service stops at 22:30, which isn't good. Ideally it would be overnight for people coming in late.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We spent the last night of our holiday in this hotel which is right in the International Terminal. We had an early flight the next day so this was a great option! We slept well, had an early breakfast, checked out and within minutes we were at our departing gate. Would do it again the next time!Note, you can't check in before 3 pm, unless you pay 1000 yen an hour extra.We had a nice big room, wonderful bathroom with a great shower/bath, staff was friendly. Breakfast (2500 yen) was too expensive, though. I expected more for that (as a European). It's easy accessible by train, monorail and there's a direct connection from Shinjuku Station to Haneda Airport by Aiport Limousine Bus.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed here after a long flight and really appreciated the rest before the final leg home. The room was small but well designed and comfortable. It was not cheap, but the convenience made up for it.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is clean and convenient for one short night before a 7AM long haul flight. The rooms are super small but it doesn't really matter. Here's a piece of advice about the restaurant attached to the hotel though. I know it sounds like the easy option since it's right here and you might not want to look further for dinner. However if feeling starved and robbed after dinner doesn't sound appealing to you, just go somewhere else, this place is some desinhibited trap. Well at least I learned that vegetables listed as a side with fish could be two leaves of lettuce. Did not came for nothing.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Amazingly the sound proofing does exactly "as it says on the tin". A tad far from the city centre, but it was a Fab location...we didn't have to get up so early. Check in desk just outside entrance.Didn't sample the hotel cuisine...far too expensive and not included in the price.The extra bed was a proper bed. So, a bonus. Rooms were immaculate, if a little tight for space. We only slept there so not so important. Very modern.Could have done with a little more choice of complimentary drinks...decaffeinated /hot choc would have been nice.A great location and comfortable.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I'm sure space comes at a premium in Tokyo, but the rooms in this hotel where box sized. They have no natural light and really poor ventilation. Apart from the reception area and experience, there is really nothing positive I can say about this hotel. I

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Ever seen those lost souls wandering around an international hotel, not knowing what to do with their 8, 10, 0r 12 hour layover; dying for sleep? Sometimes they sleep with all of their travel belongings next to them in some corner thinking it's safe? I discovered that Haneda Airport has a Transit hotel for times like this. This particular hotel especially needs this type of hotel because many of the flights to the US leave after 11 PM (some as late as 2 AM). I was prepared to be unimpressed and to pay too much, but I really needed to get some sleep prior to my flight to the US and wasn't up to dragging my luggage around tokyo trying to see some things at the last minute. My flight departed at 12:30 AM and I arrived at the airport at 4 PM.To my delight I found the room to be very clean, efficient, and equipped with everything I needed for a good rest plus free high speed Wi-Fi. The room itself was quite small, just big enough for the bed and walking room a dresser and small closet and luggage storage area. It also included a TV, AC, small fridge with complimentary water, clean PJs, and a fully functioning bathroom and shower. I got comfy, cleaned up, turned out the lights and was surprised how dark the room was. Because of this, a very comfortable bed, extreme quite (great soundproofing), I fell asleep quickly, and woke up to the requested wake up call from the desk. They also have a lounge with bottled water, snacks and decent coffee all included in the price. The only thing disappointing was the price. There's one price for 1 to 12 hours, but it would be nice to have this in 4 hour increments. The price was $100 USD approx. For me it was well worth the price for this very restful sleep considering my circumstances and that I find sleeping on airplanes very difficult. Something else very important is that the hotel is through security, so when you depart the hotel you are close to your gate with zero delay. I even had time for the many excellent duty free shopping stores at the airport! I was refreshed for my flight and was able to get some good solid work time and movie time in the flight instead of being a zombie. Solid 9 out of ten star for this place. Marked down one star because of inflexible pricing.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Our flight back to London is 11:50 a.m. which is not so early but I prefer to stay in this hotel the night before. The hotel is attached to the international terminal so can't be handier.There are plenty of restaurants in the terminal or you can get free shuttle bus to domestic terminals for more options.Rooms are small but as far as Japanese hotels are concerned they are normal, very clean, beds are comfortable.I would recommend to anyone and will be using them every time I'm there.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Fantastic service in this slick operation of an establishment with staff that aim to please.First of all special praise goes out the the breakfast spread which was one of the best I've had and included sautéed chicken and grilled salmon.Seconds of all the place is spotlessly clean. High praise for that.Thirds of all the room is equipped with many things that are required of 5 * hotels ie fabric freshener, robes and slippers. The shower and bath in the room is first rate too and the beds very comfy.To knit pick I'd have to ask where is the bath products? (Ie something to make bubbles) Only shower products provided which seems strange when a nice deep bath is available. Also I've never known such a top end establishment not have a gym which was a bit of a let down. Other than that I would highly recommend this excellent hotel which is 2 minutes walk from check in without going outside.Thanks very much.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I was very glad there was availability as it was a last minute decision to stay during my long layover. The room was clean, comfortable and affordable and offered a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of the airport. There were nice bathroom products, an air purifier, tea maker, and lovely touches throughout the room. Reception was very nice and spoke great English. I highly encourage a stay here if you have a long layover at Haneda and need some peace and quiet.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here on a planned layover from Osaka before flying out to Munich the next day. The staff is efficient, the breakfast is decent & plentiful and the location unbeatable. Rooms are small with busy wallpaper, showers and toilets are great. Rooms have blow dryers and lots of little travel sized amenities such as razors for men & women, hairbrushes, toothbrushes and paste. They also provide pajamas. Be sure to leave time after checkout to enjoy the cool shops, activities and outdoor observation deck at the airport before going through security.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Royal Park Hotel right within the Haneda airport. The hotel is nicely decorated, great view, friendly staff and a pleasant bar with well made drinks and snacks. The room is small but the bathroom sized nicely and we were very satisfied with our stay.
user_name:
NanNorth
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It is convienent as located next to international terminal of "the" Haneda(HND) airport.But you cannot justfy the price becassue of it. The focus of this hotel is those inexperienced Japanese travelers who seldom go abroad.Facility is just like HI express.Do not expect porte-cochere for this hotel.If you drive a rentacar, you have to park your car at the short-term airport parking and carry your luggage all the way through the terminal building for ten minutes. The hotel denied to pay the parking fee just for 30 minutes before you return the rentacar!!!!If you go to the hotel by taxi, you will be dropped off at arrival entrance of the terminal and walk through the terminal building for ten minutes.How can you think of this hotel convenient???

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Good hotel for transit customers. easy to access to the city since it's right in the airport. You can find all kinds of nice reataurants on 4th floor and also conveninet store. All staffs were very kind and helpful. enjoyed my first stay in royal park hotel the haneda. 룸이 조금 작긴하지만 있을 건 다 갖추어진 스마트한 공항 호텔. 공항 안이라 식당도 많고 편의점도 있어 접근성이 용이하고 편하다. 트랜짓하는 승객들이 사용하면 좋을 듯 하다.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: With an overnight layover in Tokyo I decided to get a room at the Royal Park. After a delayed flight all I wanted was a shower and a comfortable bed, and the hotel delivered - without the hassles of taking a shuttle or taxi as it's located right next to the check in area of the international terminal, you don't even have to go outside. Check in was friendly and quick. Although very small, the room was modern, clean, and had everything I wanted. Other reviews have given the hotel poor marks for room size etc., and I agree it's not a place I'd want to stay for a multi-day vacation, but it's perfect for that overnight layover.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We really appreciated this hotel being so close to departures. We were able to check in and shower before going into Tokyo for the evening. As we had our Japan Rail Pass, this meant we could use the Monorail for free! Perfect end of a perfect holiday.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had two nights at Royal Park Haneda. Check in was quick and I was given a room on the third floor (reception is on the fourth floor, which is the departures hall level of the International Terminal at Haneda. The room (a double) was very hot when I entered it and despite being very conversant with air conditioning units couldn't work this one out. Eventually reception sent someone up with English instructions which helped. The room was not overly large but the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was also an average size with a combined shower and bath. Although it was very deep, unless you are less than 4ft tall you'll have to use the shower as the bath is quite short. Everything was clean and worked. There was no fridge which is standard but there were ice (free) and vending machines down the hall, as well as stores in the airport of course. Breakfast will cost Y2500 if it isn't included. It was a reasonable mix of western and local dishes but to be honest for the price I would have expected more. Overall, it is a convenient hotel with friendly staff but next time I'd return to the Haneda Excel Hotel located at Terminal 2 which I feel is much better.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Sooo convenient for Haneda international. Excellent rooms if you get a free upgrade (ask on check in!) Basic rooms are small but ok for overnight stay if you have early flight etc.Breakfast expensive.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel looks clean and modern. Checking in is soon and quick. Staffs are friendly. I've checked into a single room and it is quite small, not much space to move about. I'm not sure if they have a larger room for 2 persons or more. The rooms are very clean and tidy. Only 1 pillow is supplied , need to call for extra pillow.Fridge provides a complimentary bottle of water and if you need another 1 , you have to pay 150¥. However they supply a bottle everyday. Amenities are well supplied. For 2 nights stay are the maximum, any longer will be tormenting as the size is small. Breakfast is the same spread for 2 mornings of my stay. They could change a bit.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed at the hotel in a single room for three nights. Without breakfast it was 18,500JPY per night. It is inside the Haneda international terminal, so they have a kind of monopoly. Clean, well maintained, and super convenient for departure and arrival. If you have to stay there for more than one night, the experience does not justify the price. 1. the room is so tiny you cannot really open your large suitcase. 2. You cannot open a window, there is no room to walk, there is no desk you can set up a notebook to work, and there is no public space like a lounge, fitness center where you can freshen up, 3. you are surrounded by small electronic devices/plastic materials, decorative but not poor in functionality furniture in the room. You are paying here double price for a smaller room than Ibis hotel in France. I do not find the value in this hotel. I will not return to this hotel even for one night.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Really nice hotel conveniently located at the airport, it was very clean and comfortable and the clerk at reception was very polite and professional, I would have liked to had breakfast unfortunately we had a really early flight- I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My partner and I had an earlyish checkin for a flight to London so I booked a night here to make the process smoother. Checkin was straight forward and the room may not have been the biggest it definitely met out needs. We didn't even think about it until it was in there that we had wheeled out trolley into the room. Some reviews suggest that they don't fir but we can assure that the room we stayed in enough space for us to comfortably move around.There was no noticeable noise from the planes, the only thing that woke us were inconsiderate guests being shouty at 1:30amI would definitely stay there again

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Not cheap at 18,000 yen, but for an early morning check-in the location is unbeatable – it’s inside the International Terminal departures level, just beyond check-in row L. I was given an upgrade to an 8th floor room with a view right on to the apron and runway. The room is small, of course, but well-appointed – excellent bathroom with proper tub and shower (with view over runway), comfortable bed and bedding, complementary Wi-Fi. Despite being in the airport, there’s no noise problem. Check-in and out were quick and efficient. There is a restaurant, but it looked expensive and anyway there’s an excellent choice on floors 4 and 5 of the Terminal.All in all, quite impressive, and I’d stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Nice hotel located in the Haneda Airport itself which takes few minutes to check-in from your room. A clean and modern place that will make your night confortable before embarking on your return trip. No stress anymore in being afraid of missing the fligth. Just pure breathing after discovering beautifull and harmonious Japan :)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Comfortable rooms, Efficient service and Conveniently located inside the Haneda International Terminal. Saves a trip into Tokyo if you just need to sleep before a connecting flight !!BIG watchout is that their restaurant is not open beyond 10pm - which is strange for an airport hotel serving connections. Infact most restaurants in the terminal also shut by 10pm...

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel staff was friendly and spoke English. This made checking in easy. Our room was clean and comfortable, cozy. The hotel was easy to find in the airport. Our bed was comfortable and the room was quiet! FYI the free shuttle starts up in the morning when the airport opens. We flew into the international terminal and out of terminal 2. No need to go over early like in the states because airport is not open. Wonderful hotel experience and we will stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This place has a monopoly when it comes to hotels at Haneda Airport. Clean but small (as can be expected in Japan) rooms with polite staff. Plenty of restaurants and cafes upstairs which are cheaper than hotel. Most have English menus. If going into Tokyo take monorail and then green line train, which is well signposted in English. If doing several trips get Suica card

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: For whatever reason if you end up in HND for an over night transit, look no further, this is the place for you. Great location, great service, great room, great bed, overall is an excellent experience. The only down side about the place is probably the price, it is kindly expensive. This property is by no mean designed for any stay longer than 1 night, if you're here other than transit, look for another place.Location:This is an AIRPORT HOTEL, not an airport near the hotel, but a hotel that is actually part of the airport. So you can walk directly from baggage claim to the hotel without the need of ever needed to exit the building. Pretty important time saving if you only really have 6 hrs of sleep until your next flight.**NOTE**The hotel is located inside the International Terminal, hence if your connecting flight is a domestic operation, you'll need to exit the terminal and catch a free shuttle bus to get to the Domestic Terminal. The bus operates every 5-10 minutes, and the trip is about 5-10 minutes. You'll need to allow yourself about 5-10 minutes to walk from the hotel to the bus stop. Overall, please allow yourself about 30 minutes to get from the hotel to the Domestic Terminals.Japan doesn't require a 2hrs advance check-in for domestic flights (except for LCC), you can literally walk up to the counter for check-in 30 mins prior to departure (not recommended), I'd suggest to be there 45 mins prior to your flight, doesn't have to be 2 hrs, it will get you 90mins more sleep.Room:Typical tiny Japanese room with a queen bed. The room barely have enough space to open 1 full size suitcase, let alone two. But it serves its function, the bed was comfy and large (in Japanese Standard), room was spotlessly clean, all round excellent. The window inside the room is sound proof, so you won't hear a thing from outside.Dinning:Your rate might include free breakfast, mine did, but I didn't have the chance to try it as my flight leaves at 6:30am. If you're arriving into HND late, you may buy some food at the fast food restaurant located on the same floor as the hotel, actually buy whatever food you need while you're walking towards the hotel, as it is along the way, that'll save you time from walking back and forth twice.Service:As always in Japan, excellent. Is a transit hotel, all you need is a speedy check-in and a good night sleep.Tips:- WiFi is Free.
user_name:
Crossingtheglobe
Hong Kong / Kelowna, BC, Canada

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We were travelling with a young child between Narita and Haneda airports on route to Europe so finding this hotel right at the Haneda airport terminal was wonderfully convenient. Walk direct from the hotel to the check in counters. Aside from their own restaurant which offered a good buffet breakfast, there were also a wide range of accessible eateries at the terminal. The room was spacious and quiet. Considering that Tokyo itself is at least an hour and a half travel by bus, it's location alone is value for money

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel situated just in the airport terminal. Clean, super comfort bed, pillow, comforter. Many eateries, 7-11, duty free goods, where you can buy daily necessities or traveling goods. From the hotel you can simply catch up a monorail to go to the heart of Tokyo. The monorail platform was just in the same building. What I love mist is the bathroom with shower and separated tub. The shower pressure is awesome. The breakfast is enough for you before heading for big lunch. Already plan to come back

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is located exactly at Haneda airport just a few minutes walk from all the check-in counters. Its practical if you need to stay there to catch your flight or if you have a longer transit time. The rooms are clean and the style is very modern. Staff is very kind.But besides this a few things should be mentioned here.The rooms are fitted with two narrow single beds.The space in the room is so small that you literally cannot open your suitcase if its a bigger size.I had to put my suitcase on the other single bed next to me. For this standard, rooms should be at least double the size.The other deficiency is that the hotel does not have any kind of spa or leisure facilities. No gym, pool or even a sauna. It would have been nice to at least get some exercise after my 11 hour flight.No room service available at night.On the whole if you are looking for some sleep its okay but otherwise I can't think of any other season to stay there.Maximum rating is average, nothing more.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal park Hotel at Haneda airport is great value for money. It is right in the terminal adjacent to departures and one floor up from Arrivals. Tokyo downtown is swiftly reached either by the Kikuyu rail line or the monorail - both stations are a two to three minutes walk through the airport to the platforms. The mono rail involves an easy transfer to the Toei Asakusa line at Damon station just next to the monorail terminal. The dining room is great with a choice of reasonably priced Japanese or Western food and nice wines. Staff are excellent and English is spoken. Haneda airport is quiet compared with Narita - like Melbourne really, but cleaner and more efficient. You do have to go to the bus terminal in the World Trade centre alongside the monorail terminal at Hamamatsucho for day tours, etc.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here 2 nights then left our luggage there while we flew south to Okinawa. When we returned we rented a relax room for a couple of hours to shower and repack cases etc. The location is fantastic, literally pull your suitcase to the end of the check in counters and there is the entrance to the hotel. If you want to go into the city the quickest way is via the monorail or you can use the subway system. It is between 20 and 45 minutes to Shibuya or Asakusa. The hotel rooms are new, well laid out and well decorated and very very quiet. The staff are gracious and very very helpful. We would stay there again very happily. The Relax rooms are great value and an excellent way to take the stress out of a 4 hour layover.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We came in at 11:00 p.m. from a long flt. from Lax. what a relief to see a hotel that is immaculate clean, Fantastic accommodation, and most of all very convenient. I could not ask anything more! room is actually big. there's instant Cup Noodles, orange juice, coffee and a good coffee, tea, doughnuts, Chips for grabs. the staff is very accommodating, polite and always ready to help. I definitely consider staying in this hotel again

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is perfect if you have an early flight from Haneda as it is inside the airport building right by departures. The rooms are small by western standards but perfectly normal for Japan. The fittings are nice and the rooms are clean. Recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Excellent choice when you connect at Haneda airport. This is a small business type hotel, very efficient, quiet and has nice bed linen and a comfortable bed. The staff is friendly and the breakfast buffet is very good. You can drop your bags and get back to Tokyo central by combination of monorail and metro, this takes 25 min and you sleep in the next day and wheel your bags to the check in counter. It made Tokyo a very pleasant stop over and I would do this again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park Haneda is directly connected to the airport terminal. It is particularly suitable for an early departure flight. The check-in counter can be reached in five minutes. The hotel has 300 rooms, which are functionally furnished and modern. The rooms are quiet narrow for double occupancy. However, the bed is King size. In the room ae placed a kettle for tea and coffee making, a safe for storing valuables, a flat screen TV with foreign TV channels and a free connection well-functioning Wi-Fi is offered. The bath room is new and clean. Vending machines for mineral water and beer are on the floor. The hotel has a restaurant. Breakfast is available for Y 2.500. On the first floor of the departure hall a wide range of inexpensive restaurants and coffee shops can be found. The employees speak English.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park Hotel at Haneda is exceptionally convenient if you have an overnight stopover on an international trip through Haneda. The hotel is connected directly to the international terminal at Haneda, so you don't even have to step outside to get from the terminal to your room. The rooms are what you might expect for a nice airport hotel, with a reasonably comfortable bed, functional bathroom, and excellent soundproofing (we never heard anything from outdoors). The staff was friendly and helpful. If you're arriving late, note that pretty much all food service at the hotel and the airport shuts down around 11 pm (with limited exceptions focused on very casual food offerings).

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very convenient location in the Haneda international terminal. We've stayed here twice, once on our way into Japan to rest and get our heads straight! And once on the way out to make things easy. The location is perfect for the weary traveler, but the hotel is very nice! It's clean, quiet, new, and the staff are very professional (and speak English). The hotel restaurant is good. There are also many other good restaurants close by in the terminal. We stayed in a premium room both times for reasonable cost and they are spacious for Japan! Will easily stay here again whenever flying into Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Convenience rules while traveling an infant and child and they were the best as it is directly accessible from Haneda International Terminal (departure floor; 3rd floor section L). You walk in the room and really the bed took up most space. But adequate space in bathroom including a tub & shower with many amenities like shampoo/conditioners, body soap, toiletries. Free wifi worked well also. We did not eat at the restaurant downstairs . Breakfast for 2500 yen is a lot Instead, we went to floor 4 in International Terminal to check out Edo-Koji restaurant rows. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a very charming hotel connecting directly into Haneda airport. If you need to be close to the airport, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The rooms were clean, quaint and well attended. Though a bit pricey, every amenity is provided and your are guaranteed a high quality hotel experience without the hassle of having to run to the airport. It's literally in the lobby corridor. Staff was excellent, competent and thorough. Great stay here!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A colleague and I stayed at this hotel on an 10 hour layover before a long international flight. Booking the hotel on line was easy. We decided that at $300/nt for a double room...better to share for our short stay. The hotel is located on the left side of the departure level of the International terminal. It is about a 5 minute walk to all check-in counters. Check-in was fast and efficient. The room as nice..small but efficiently arranged. The beds were comfortable with electrical outlets on the stand between the two beds. There is a desk with coffee maker and refrigerator. The bathroom was large for a Japanese hotel. Best part was the ceiling mounted rain shower head. It was the best shower I have experienced in Japan. They provide toothbrush, razor w shave cream, and brush. The hotel has a nice bar/restaurant. We did not eat that the hotel however the wine and drinks were excellent.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had a long wait to make a connection at Haneda airport. Arriving late on Saturday and the flight to Ube being at noon on Sunday, the idea of waiting almost twelve hours in a business clasas lounge was not appealing. So we decided to check-in to this airport hotel.The front desk staff looked fresh (it was almost midnight) and attentive. Their English language skill were sufficient and our check-in process was completed within ten minutes. We were given verbal directions to our rooms but there was no bellhop service. We were also allowed to wheel our airport luggage trolleys to our room but the elevators were large enough to fit only one trolley.The rooms were tiny by my experience. Too small for my liking There was no way to squeeze in the luggage trolley. Suitcases need to be unloaded into the room and the trolley wheeled back to the elevator lobby on the same floor.Even though the rooms were tiny, they were clean and modern, well-equipped, with LAN, Wi-fi, and typically Japanese toilet automation. There were two electrical wall sockets (100V US-style twin slots), which was sufficient for my use at that time. I had to also use the air-conditioning wall control pad by trial-and-error was the language of the LCD was in Japanese.Each floor had a small room for an ice dispenser and drinks vending machines and I found this an added convenience. The team were hungry and we went out of the hotel to explore, where we found two cafes just fifty metres on the same floor that served hot soup, noodles and sandwiches, both meat and vegetarian. Having Google Translate on our mobile phones came in handy,The single bed was comfortable and I had an uninterrupted six-hour sleep.In the morning, we went out again looking for breakfast and found the hotel's coffee house called Tailwind and it looked nice. But instead of going there, we went exploring into the airport's shopping arcade (that was designed to look like the streets of a town) and found several other outlets. We settled for a short-order place called Expasa Cafe that faced the exterior and had outdoor tables.The check-out process was quick too. For smokers, there was a small smoking room next Tailwind. We used the same luggage trolleys that we found at the elevator lobby on our room floor. There were LED screens showing flight schedules in the lobby.Even though the rooms were tiny, Royal Park Hotel The Haneda was clean, modern and convenient, for the price of about USD150 per night (which may be regarded a bit high for some travellers). In brief, we made a good decision to spend our overnight layover here.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a really nice, modern, clean hotel that is IN the international terminal. You just walk to one end and there's the hotel. So the location is extremely convenient for layovers. I would probably give it 4.5 stars if that was an option.I actually stayed on the way in and out and had 2 different rooms. The first was a "double" so it was slightly bigger and had a desk. The second was a single and had no desk. This is the main reason I'd take off 1/2 star. Not a showstopper, but it was a hassle finding a place to work on my 2nd night. Big TV with a few English channels. Bathroom was very modern and had a great shower. Not a lot of space for toiletries around the sink, but for an overnight, it was again OK. Bed was comfortable and the room was VERY quiet. You'd never know you're next to a busy airport. I've had much louder rooms off freeways in the US. AC worked well. Extremely clean and no stains on the carpet. Complementary water in the mini fridge.WiFi was easy to connect and speed was reasonable for a hotel.As usual, the Royal Park is small by US standards (even European), but for short stays flying in or out, its perfectly fine. I'm not sure why else you would choose to stay there because there's not a lot around the airport. Aside from the small size, the room was one of the nicest I've had in Japan. Not super fancy, but very nice.I've never stayed at an airport hotel before so I can't compare, but I'd definitely stay here again for a layover.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A very modern hotel within the Haneda airport (international terminal). Swift check-in to VERY quiet rooms. Rooms are decent-sized, as is the bathroom. No luxury, but all amenities are present. We did not have breakfast but dined at their restaurant; both the sashimi and the noodle dish were excellent. Overall quite impressive if you want value for money at a very convenient location for an early flight out.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Excellent for a nights stay before an early flight. We sent our bags from Kyoto on the luggage service, they had been put in our room before we arrived which was very convenient.The room is very small,if we stayed again we would opt for a larger one. Everything we needed,except one side of the bed had no table or lamp which was a bit inconvenient. We had a very light supper in the hotel restaurant which was good, and breakfast which was not quite so good. The position is unbeatable, literally right on the Departure level. so very quick from room to check in. A pleasant hotel in a convenient position with all you need for a one night stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My family and I stayed at this hotel before we departed on an early-morning flight out of Haneda. It was great to be able to travel out to the airport on the monorail the night before and settle into clean and comfortable rooms without the mad rush that often accompanies pre-flight time. The hotel is connected directly to the airport, and there is a good selection of restaurants to choose from in the airport complex - we had a great dinner and wandered back through the airport for a comfortable night of sleep. We opted for breakfast in the hotel after checking in our bags - a bit on the expensive side for a buffet breakfast, but convenient. All in all, we would recommend this clean and modern hotel to travellers passing through Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: You can struggle to write about an airport hotel, this is a good one. Clean and right next to departures. The rooms are tight but functional and well equipped. Sensible room rates and early check out is all in place. There is a good restaurant so close that it could well be part of the hotel.We would return if passing through Haneda with an early morning flight, or even a late long haul arrival. The airside room views are probably good - the other side is a little grim!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you happen to catch a very early flight from Haneda Airport Tokyo, you can either wake up early or opt for an airport hotel. And at Haneda Airport (International terminal) there's only one choice: Royal Park Hotel. This means there's a serious risk the hotel can ask just about every price it wants and still offer low quality.After staying at the Royal Park Hotel I'm happy to share that Royal Park is an above average hotel airport that doesn't abuse it's monopoly. It is connected to the terminal. The entrance to the hotel is next to the very last row of check in desks! How's that for a short walk the next day?The hotel lobby looks spacious and classy. The rooms are rather small, but still stylish and equiped with everything one can expect in this price range. The beds and pillows are rather firm, as usual in Japan. The bathroom is small ("stand in the bathtub" shower) but clean. Off course the windows are isolated very well, so no airplane noise reaches inside the rooms.This might not be the ideal hotel for a long stay, but for a single night just before an early flight it's a good choice. And the only choice.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My wife and I stayed in this hotel after arriving about 10:00 pm and having to connect to a flight to Osaka, Kansai this next day. This outstanding hotel was a god send. Excellent room and buffet breakfast (European and Japanese) helped us get our feet on the ground. You can walk to the hotel in the international terminal after clearing customs. There is a free shuttle bus to the two domestic terminals.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As other reviewers have noted, this hotel's rates are higher than you'd pay for the same size/quality rooms in a different location. But location is the whole point. I was arriving at Haneda very late and departing Tokyo by train early the next morning. Though I knew there were several less expensive hotel options near the airport, it sounded so pleasant to just walk upstairs after clearing immigration and then just walk through the departure hall to activate my JR pass the next morning. And it was.Yes, the rooms are small, even by Tokyo standards. But they are well designed, pleasantly decorated, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast had good variety and quality, though the dining area gets very crowded very early. (As you would expect.)Bottom line for me was that the convenience and comfort of this hotel for a late arrival/early departure made it worth every yen.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Location is exceptional for the transfers (no need to take a bus), right in the terminal: at a walking distance of everything such as shops restaurants, check-in desks. Rooms are not big but their size is sufficient for two persons. However rooms and corridors are dark due to the use of black as the dominant colour.Good food (Japanese and international) in the hotel restaurant.Finally the hotel has a strange check-in/out policy. Guests must pay on arrival and then go to the reception again on the day of departure. While we did not mind paying in advance we would have expected an express check-out.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived at 10:00 PM from Hawaii and were scheduled to leave at 10:00 AM the next morning. Had reserved a transit room which meant we never had to clear customs,or go in line thru immigration. Got off the plain and entered the hotel directly from the airport-it is in the international airport. Next morning went directly to our boarding gate for a flight to Shanghai. Very convenient.Immaculate room with everything you need. King bed,shower with all kinds of soaps,tooth brushes,comfortable beds. Great rest and never had to leave the airport. An upscale version of Narita airport day rooms.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Was impossible to pack or move in. Hotel staff was extremely unhelpful, including losing a suitcase we sent earlier. Really not the experience we need before a long flight. The location is all wrong for sightseeing but great before the flight. However the value for money was the worst in all of our trip to Japan. Try to avoid staying here.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Walking twenty meters to get to the departure hall certainly beats the fun-and-games of getting up super-early to get a hotel shuttle bus and get stressed about getting stuck in rush hour traffic.There are plenty of places to get your dinner/breakfast from and there are plenty of convenience stores around to get your bits and bobs from.Yes it's more expensive than other hotel options but it's location makes it a lot less stressful.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is situated in departures of Haneda Tokyo Airport.Beautiful luxury airport hotel. So convenient that once our luggage was on a trolley it stayed on there until we checked in the following morning for our flight. Check in at reception was friendly and professional. The room was very clean,and comfortable,especially the bathroom? It was also very quite. As it was so convenient to departures we were able to chose eat from one of the many restaurants there. Unfortunately the fire alarm went off though the tannoy system which was extremely loud. This woke us from a deep sleep,and as we had to be up early for our flight the next morning, we were unable to go back to sleep. If it had not been for this our stay here would have been perfect.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This was a fantastic solution for my 14 hour layover. The airline offered a free hotel—I didn't know this when I booked the Royal Park, and when I asked if that was the same hotel they'd set me up in, they laughed. I took that to mean that the Royal Park would be laughably more comfortable and decided a shuttle bus away and back in the morning sounded a lot less easy than the in-aiport option. I made the right choice - it was easy, clean, simple and small, but cozy. Ordered some room service and slept like a baby.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel connects directly to the international terminal which makes it so easy for an early morning departure. Just walk to the international departure lounge.We found it comfortable, new, beautifully appointed, everything you need for an over night stay. The beds were something else, especially after sleeping on a Japanese style mattress for a week. You tend to forget what your bed at home feels like!A good choice and relaxing evening before flying home via Korea.There is a Lawsons store on the lower level. We had flown into Narita Airport, so were a little unsure of leaving from Haneda, Tokyo, but our JR pass was all we needed to travel to Haneda including the Monorail. The most important piece of advice I could give anyone traveling on an early flight is to be organized, don't worry about stressing about how to get to the airport, taxi fares - stay here! They even took our luggage early after getting off the train, so we were free to look around before checking in.Amazing service, nothing over rated, just as I had expected. A very positive experience on our departure from two weeks in Japan.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: What a great airport Haneda is and the Royal Park Transit Hotel is just as excellent. I stayed here on a 6 hour layover.The transit hotel is located behind security and you must be in transit to stay here. It is a great hotel. All the amenities you will need. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable. It had blackout shades. It was also great that you don't hear planes at all. They have a lounge with snacks and tea, coffee etc. I would recommend staying here if your looking for a clean comfortable place with a shower to relax. It is best if you make a reservation prior to arrival so you know your securing a room. Then your 100% refreshed for you onward journey!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I needed to find a hotel that I could stay in as I had a 14 hour layover and I didn't want to lounge on a bench in the airport as so many people do. I chose this hotel as it was located near the departure section of the hotel. The room was small yet had everything I needed, WiFi, TV, clean bed, and a shower. It was also equipped with a small refrigerator that could accommodate two bottles of water. It was quiet and the air con was also. The front desk was very gracious and accommodating. A little pricey at 186 usd a night but very convenient. A restaurant called the Tailwind was located in the lobby. I opted to go to the airport for cheaper fare....

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I was in transit and booked a room at the Royal Park for 225 Canadian dollars. When I arrived at 10:30 in morning they said that they had no rooms I had to wait until 3pm. However for $140 more they would give me a bigger room. Because my flight left at 5pm I paid the extra money. However when I got to the room it was smaller than what I had booked. I went back to the front desk and they said basically too bad.Front desk staff was horrible and complete cold and unfriendly.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had an early flight out of Haneda so opted for a night's stay at this hotel. Basic hotel, small room, they gave us room facing out the car park. Check in staff and even the housekeeping staff could be a little friendlier, service did not come with a smile, too stoic. If I had to stay here again, it would only be because it is convenient.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Royal Park hotel is a very good value for an early flight from Haneda (cheaper than any 4* or 5* in the center of Tokyo and very convenient).Room was very clean and comfortable (the hotel is pretty new).Access to checkin area is only 100 meters from the hotel.At night, Haneda airport is very pleasant with many restaurants and shops (even in public area).Planes can be observed from Public observation deck which is very pleasant (This kind of deck does not exist anymore in Europe…)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is my 2nd stay in this hotel. For the first time, I got a very competitive offer and found this value for money for a stay when arrive late or will depart early. However, I didn't experience the same as the rate is much higher. I checked in earlier this time and thus have more time to explore the room. The room actually is small (same type as last time and not the smallest room type already). Although it is connected to the international terminal, actually there is less restaurants available than the domestic terminal.I was assigned to a lower floor this time, the view is bad, and found that the sound isolation is bad, especially when there are a group of noisy kids living in the same floor.However, I must say the staff are helpful.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed over night when arriving from Vanvouver in route to Bangkok. Hotel conveniently located at the airport making ground travel unnecessary. Check in was very efficient. Room was clean and quiet. Hotel offers a full range of services for guests. Only issue is the web site does not to appear to allow advance booking of more than 90 days and there is no e-mail contact option on the website. Attempts to book in advance of 90 days indicated the hotel was fully booked for the period requested. Not the the best for an "in transit" focused hotel. Would stay again if in transit.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I didn't feel comfortable in this hotel. The room lacked character and warmth, but does the job for one night stay for a very early morning flight out of Haneda. Each floor of the hotel is huge, so if you don't want to walk too far, request a room closer to the elevator. View from my room/bathroom was facing a wall, so again, good for one night but not beyond that.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room was small and so was the bathroom...you had to go out into the hallway to turn around! Just kidding, but it was fairly small. The check staff was very polite and spoke way better english than I spoke Japanese. I would definitely stay at this hotel again! It is in the International Terminal so getting to your next flight is not an issue!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel is located on the airport site - very easy to get to the international terminal - takes away the worry of early morning travel.Nice room with great sound proofing - didn't hear any plane noise.Restaurant good but a little expensive - worth it for the convenience.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed for one night in the Royal park hotel in a double room while waiting for my flight the next morning- the stay was very pleasant.The location is amazing, located right on the 3rd floor of the airport. The rooms are very clean and well presented.The staff at check in were incredibly friendly and helpful.However I felt that the room size did not reflect the price I paid for the room, which was a shame.Another minor problem that could be fixed is having a better aircon system! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking for a convenient and relaxed stay after or before a flight! thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: we arrived haneda late at nite and return 5days later on an early morning flight. the hotel is attached to the airport,that saved us alot of time and energy except that the rate is on high side. staffs were very frienly and helpful. sleep quality were good , room view good.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My family (2 adults, 3 year old and an 8 month old), stopped in at this hotel for a 6 hour layover between flight from Korea, and onto North America. This hotel provided an excellent place to relax and unwind. We were able to have a nap, shower, and eat, play during that layover and made the journey much more enjoyable as a result. The entrance is in the international airside section of the terminal, and for transiting guests, there are clear signs to the hotel, and no need to go through customs or fill out entry documentation. Food options in the terminal are reasonable. There is also a lounge area in the hotel with limited snacks, and non alcoholic beverages.Overall, this transit hotel was better than any other we have stayed at, and good value for money.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is the 3rd time we have stayed here on a stopover and we continue to recommend the hotel and the airport terminal. It ticks all the boxes. We will be back to Japan and Haneda is the preferred airport so will happily stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Just few steps away as you walk to the check in counters in the international haneda airport. Staff is very nice and helpful. It only takes few hours to reply my email asking for their help. Room is very tidy and everything looks new. They provides compliment water , disposable slippers and all toiletries. I personally would need a hot water kettle. Lots of restaurants at reasonable price nearby and convenient store is nearby as well. Their pillow is the best one I have ever had in hotel which you can adjust the 'height 'you need

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A interconnecting hotel to the international departure.Perfect for a early morning flights from Haneda. Quieter rooms and great breakfast with Japanese and American style options .However ,rooms are much smaller .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: this airport hotel is recommended for its location just adjacent the check-in hall at the Tokyo haneda airport, international terminal. It is located at end of the check-in hall with a friendly, efficient reception. The hotel rooms are relatively small, but have all necessary amenities. They are to double glazed windows, ensuring the room is soundproofed from the noise of the airport. There are no particular highlights, but the quality is okay and the rooms are tidy.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed in the airside transit section of the Royal Park for 1 night while spending the night in Haneda between flight connections. The transit hotel is relatively new, and is airside, which means it isn't necessary to go through immigration, etc. The hotel is up the escalator across from gate 14 in the international departure area. The rooms are small, but very well laid out and convenient. High-speed internet is free, and there is a lounge with snacks available at all times. The room itself was clean and well-equipped, and made for a great transit option. Check-in and Check-out was fast, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The rates were higher than the main Royal Park, but were reasonable for a transit hotel. Booking is in 12 hour blocks (my rate was 12,000Yen for a 12 hour block).Overall, a great choice for transit in Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Lovely quality hotel. Cost £185 for twin room for 1 night. Everything was perfect. Bathroom, beds, coffee machine. View of the river and monorail. We arrived in the afternoon. Had shower. Walked around shops in the airport. Had a lovely meal in edo village at airport. Had a lovely sleep. I'm morning we had a lovely buffet breakfast. Sausage,egg, bacon fish fruit pastries, juice, coffee everything really. Checked our suitcases in. How convenient to come out of the hotel straight in to international departures. I was delighted that we we were refreshed and dry at the airport rather than having to travel across tokyo to airport especially as there was torrential rain and wind that morning. We had time to spend the rest of our yen on presents and food at airport before our flight. All in all a great experience though a bit pricey. Would definitely stay again for convenience and lack of stress.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel has great access to the Haneda airport arrival/departure area.A few minutes walk and you are in the reception of the hotel.We arrived a little early and our room was not ready so we left our luggage and returned later.Our room was quite small but ok for one night.We had a good dinner in the restaurant next to the hotel.As our room was paid for on arrival and we didn't take breakfast we had a fast departure from the hotel,with no hold up at reception.Excellent choice for an airport stopover.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Good hotel if you are on a early morning flight or arrive late. Direct access to the departure/arrival lounges.If you can afford it go for the executive rooms on the 8th floor. Its a cost a little bit more, but breakfast is included, the room is bigger and you get use of the transit lounge room (air side) which is full of nibbles and drinks.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Spent a night there between an international arrival and a national departure. The rooms are quite small, but at the same time, they are clean, comfortable, and well equipped. They have a pleasant outlook on both sides. Choices at the hotel restaurant were not particularly tempting but there are other places to eat in the terminal, and breakfast (included in our rate) at the hotel was of very good quality and pleasant, so I would recommend it.This is not necessarily a place I would go out of my way to stay at but for an airport hotel it is excellent, and it is directly within the International terminal which is extremely convenient.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Bit pricey but you pay for the convenience of the hotel. We had an early flight was so perfect to check out and jump straight on the plane and not have to haul our luggage through Tokyo trying to get there on time. Rooms are a decent size, very clean, some amenities provided.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here twice, once for early departure and late arrival. The rooms are generous and well equipped. Very clean as all hotels in Japan. Excellent shower. Only negative was other people arriving late and talking loudly in corridor. Great service to leave bags between stays. Nice restaurant and bar.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel based in international terminal so great location, a few minutes from check in desks.Rooms small and cramped, and can be stuffyBreakfast not cheap and basic choiceCheck in and check out was reasonably quick.Great for that overnight for early check ins or quick sleep after long inbound flight or between connections

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I booked 4 night for travelling Tokyo and Fuji mt.This hotel is very easy to access when I arrived The Haneda airport.No need taxi bus or train.Good room good services ,even though room are very small.I can go anywhere in Japan by bus,monorail,train or taxi.Food was o.k.,I can change breakfast to lunch or dinner.Furthermore ,I can walk around the airport that there are a lot of shops for shopping.Next time if i will go to Japan,I will stay this place again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Yes this is a modern convenient hotel attached to the International Terminal 2 at Haneda. BUT the objective of an airport hotel is that it should be able to deal with arrivals and departures flexibily - after all you are paying a premium for the airport location.Well be warned not at this hotel. Checkin is 1500 (3PM) and checkout 1000 (10 AM). So if that does not suit your travel arrangements - be warned find another option.We arrived at 1300 (1PM) and could not check in until 3pm. Luckily our flight out was 1000 so we were away. Tough if you have an afternoon flight. Enjoy sitting in the airport concourse !

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Had a late arrival and early departure from Haneda, and for that reason - the Royal Park was in the perfect location. Rooms were a bit small, and got stung 100 yen on arrival for 'tax', but otherwise amenities seemed pretty good - and staff at the desk were on par.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hi!We arrived in Japan quite late (11pm) after a long journey from Paris. Royal Park Hotel was the perfect deal to get some rest prior our trip around Japan. The hotel is very convenient as it is located in departure terminal. Rooms are comfortable and clean. If you don't want to eat in the hotel you have some 24h shop in the terminal. It's a good option rather than running around Tokyo after a long flight. After that you just have to Enjoy your trip in Japan!!Cheers.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Our flight was from Hawaii to Philippines then to Philippines to Japan. About 17 hours of travel including layover. We knew we were going to be exhausted after the flight so we booked this hotel because it's connected to the Haneda Airport. When we arrived at 11pm, we simply went up to the 3rd floor to check-in. The Front Desk staff could speak English well and had no trouble checking-in. Bedroom we had was clean but small, it had 2 single beds, tv, fridge, some drawers, cabinets and convenient location for the outlets to charge your devices. Bathroom was also small but it had a bathtub if you are not too tall. They also have magic mirrors that don't fog up and heated toilet seat. Overall our stay was comfortable and hotel had a luxury feel to it. You won't be disappointed if all you plan to do here is sleep 1 night and leave the next day.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very convenient , the hotel is at International Haneda Airport. There are Monorail and trains which you can arrive the city in half an hour. Room is quite small but clean. There are many restaurants and shops at the Terminal .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We choose the hotel because we had a late arrival from the USA. We usually stay at another hotel away from the airport but decided that we would try this hotel for a change. To find the hotel you have to go to the far side of the L check in on 3F and go to the back wall and this was where you will find a sign to the hotel. This was the only sign that we could see but maybe we just missed them.English is spoken at Reception but it is what I call "hotel English", so if you have a complicated question you might not get the correct answer.The rooms are very small, clean with wheat pillows. You can, I think, get another pillow if you want but we were too tired to try.  We had breakfast in buffet. It was really overpriced for what we got. The Japanese menu is fairly large but the Western menu was small, bread, cereal, plain yogurt and eggs cooked to order. They we slow to refill the bread and butter and never collected the dirty plates. Should have eaten in the airport.  Will probably go back to our usual hotel where breakfast is included and the rooms are larger on our next visit to Japan.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The best thing about this hotel is that when you arrive exhausted from your long plane flight, you don't have to try to navigate Japan's challenging rail systems. It's literally at the airport. The room was completely silent - no air traffic heard at all. It was very clean and the staff was English speaking. American travelers may think the room is a little small, but it's significantly larger than the average Japanese hotel room - especially the bathroom. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel, though the airport also offers many places to eat. In the lobby, there is also a currency exchange machine. It's a little pricier than the one at the airport, but is useful in a pinch. We'll definitely be staying here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Perfect location ...right in Haneda Airport , quite handy after a long flight . Can t fault the place .Rooms are quite small and immaculate , but it is the norm as Japanese standards . Easy access to metro from airport as well . The restaurant is expensive but you get what you pay for . Forget the breakfast ...sorry to say but the buffet is really poor in choice and overpriced . All in all a good hotel with easy access to metro and just perfect to fly back as just 30 seconds away from terminal .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Last December, we flown a late arrival flight to Haneda. I assumed we hardly catch up "bus limousine", therefore, we opted to stay at Royal Haneda, due to good review at the Trip. We reserved 2 rooms for our family of 5. This hotel turned bring us a joy to offset our upset of late arrival flight. This hotel has an easy to access from arrival gate. It was located at 3F of Departure area. It has an easy checked in, then we got two rooms side by side at higher floor, as requested. It was a luxury modern hotel which worth the money to stay in. We booked a twin room, and had a window. We were so lucky since we had a view Fuji Mountain. It was crispy blue sky morning.Rooms were small but neat and modern set up. It had a good pillow, that we might flip in order to have either soft or firm pillow. Special mention for its bathroom, it was equipped with premium Grohe gauged, and new set up. Nice water pressure for shower.  Breakfast at Tailwind restaurant also was outstanding, it was combination of Japanese and Western foods and the resto has Mount Fuji view as well.. The hotel was very close to Edo Matket Place of Haneda, where MOS Cafe and Yoshinoya was among the restaurant.  Recommended for anybody who was caught in the late arrival. For tourist, JR Station was on your step to exchange your JRailPass and buy a Suida/IC Card. In addition, tourist also may buy visitors sim card at Mobile Centre/Mobil Communication Center there. All are located at 2F arrival area.It is highly recommended hotel. Our family enjoyed the experience stayed at this airport hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Extremely convenient to Haneda International terminal, this is a no brainer for an overnight stay as needed. The hotel is new, modern and clean, but I found the rooms very sterile and small, even by Japanese standards. It was quiet, which helped for a good night's sleep, but had the most unusual and uncomfortable pillows, which seemed to be filled with little balls of a corn-like substance. 700 yen for a cup of take away coffee in the hotel restaurant - make sure you eat in the airport food hall, which has a great selection and is an easy indoor walk.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I spent here only one night betwen two flights, hotel is near airport so its perfect for that, room are not big, but if you need only for sleap its really ok, clean, quaet, staff are good, I hope next time I will have more time to explore hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is directly in the international terminal, its a nice hotel for the airport, rooms are small but average for Tokyo. Bathrooms are very modern and clean. Shower did not have great water pressure and fluctuate from hot to cold. Beds are hard and pillows due to offer much comfort. Rooms are quiet, no outside noise at all from planes. I would recommend asking for a high floor room, we were on 2nd floor and had a Hollywood twin. Two twin beds pushed together. It is probably worth opting for the larger room.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Haneda Airport is very near to Tokyo city centre, just take the monorail then you can reach the city within 20minutes. I chose Royal Park mainly for the convenience of airport transit purpose. It is good and just fit my purpose. My little baby had a nice sleep too.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stated there total of 3 times after long flight from San Francisco that arrives at 10:30pm. The location cannot be better as it is literally located in the international terminal. You walk right in with your luggage in your airport cart to your floor you stay in. After sorting things out I usually send my suitcases to my parents house at the airport kiosk that is open 24 hours. Easy to do from this hotel. So I can travel light while traveling Tokyo, Kyoto or this time Nagano for a few days.Staff at the hotel is always pleasant, efficient and appeared to speak English( I speak Japanese with them.) Room is well designed yet very tiny but amenities are well equipped, with pajamas,slippers, compact brush( I always take theirs home as it is convenient for traveling), toothbrush etc. When I booked twin room( only available room for that day), it was slightly bigger.They have breakfast buffet. I used once and it was pretty good with amazing varieties but pricey. I rather go to Yoshinoya at the terminal for my 5 am breakfast, one of the few eatery at the airport open at odd hours. I have no complaints. I will stay with them again.
