hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is nicely appointed and very clean. The rooms, even the premium rooms are cruise ship small. The airport location makes getting around Tokyo pretty easy if you are here for a short stay. The airport is connected via subway and monorail. The monorail is the fastest connection to the subway but for some reason the pass for the network is not combined. This hotel has a foreign exchange vending machine in the lobby that has better rates than the vendors in the airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park is an amazing hotel since its conveniently situated inside the airport and that makes it ideal for all those of you who have to travel on business trips or get some rest between transit.The hotel is quite modern with an amazing japanese restaurant right at the entrance where u can eat all your sushi's , sashimi's to your hearts content.I could not find an In room dining menu in the room so my guess is that u either go down to the restaurant to eat or u go to the terminal to grab a bite. There are so many options to chose from and a very conveniently located 7/11 around the corner.The room in my opinion was quite small.. The bathroom has one of those glass panels that divides the room from it. So if you are planning on sharing the room with some one you dont regularly share the shower with,my advice is mail them in advance so they can give u a more private "salle de bains" if u may. As far as the hotel was concerned the noise level was the only issue I encountered. Since the walls are pretty thin and the rooms are quite small, the noise from the corridor might keep u up . I am NOT a light sleeper, I am proud of my ability of been able to sleep through basically any noise. But boy! did this hotel prove me wrong. But all in all.. Meh.The toilet has one of those perpetually warm seats, which, oh my god feels so good during winter.The operating instructions are in english and in Japanese so if you mix up the bidet with the intensity of the spray u my friend, need some help.ehem. They provide amenities such as a dental kit, q tips, a comb, shower gel, shampoo and conditioner.I saw a hair drier adjacent to the sink too.A bathrobe,slippers, shoe polisher, shoe tong,ironing board and an iron.The staff are amazing. Very helpful and friendly. For my smoker friends I have some bad news, the hotel is non smoking. So if u light up u pay up. Thats 30,000 yen. Or roughly around 260 USD. But you can turn left just outside the lobby and find a designated smoking area for the hotel guests.There is a train station on the second floor of the airport so u can get to anywhere during your stay here. It was very easy as i found out. The ticket counter and information center staff spoke english very well and helped me out with directions. It took me 35 minutes, as i remember to get to Shibuya from Haneda. As you have to change lines at the Shinagawa station keep an eye out for that too.All in all it was a good trip.I added a few extra bit of info there about traveling though this was supposed to be about the hotel. Hope that was helpful.Stay safe and Bon Voyage..!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Had an early morning flight to catch so spent last night of the Japan trip at this hotel. Pleasantly surprised to get a Superior room at 8th floor with some nice room amenities; breakfast is pretty good considering the size of the hotel. Added benefits include lounge stay after security to a transit lounge run by the same hotel, which we used and found nice. Room isn't big but soundproofing is superb so there's no noise at all. Had a side trip late night inside Haneda International Terminal which the hotel connects to directly, kind of a novelty experience. It's quite convenient there with all kinds of shops.Will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Best airport hotel I have stayed in yet! This hotel is actually inside the airport so you don't even have to leave to get there, making it the perfect place to rest up from late arriving flights. We would totally stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Great place to stay and so convenient as it is located in the airport. The trains are located down stairs and you can be in Shinagawa station in 10 minutes. Great place to stay if you are just passing through. Very clean and very nice staff.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I arrived on a short business trip and had about 8 hours between a late arrival into HND and an early departure to Hiroshima. With the only options being sleeping on a bench in the terminal and forking over the cash for a hotel....a nice bed seemed the better option. The reception area is nice and on the departures level of the International terminal. I was booked into a premium level room on the 8th floor, the washlet toilet and shower were nice and clean but the bed was a bit stiff with a strange pillow that seemed firm on one end and soft on the other.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park is situated inside the terminal at Haneda International Airport. When exiting arrivals turn right, go to the departures level, then walk to the end. It's a brilliant location and was very handy after arriving late.The rooms are very modern, clean and well fitted out. Our room had a bath and a queen sized bed. For Japanese standards we were impressed with the room size. Our room had a view of the terminal car park and from what I gather the other side isn't much better but if you just need a place to sleep this is perfect.The check-in staff were friendly and spoke good English. The hotel restaurant serves buffet breakfast but there are heaps of options in the terminal.The train to Tokyo leaves regularly from the terminal and is 5 minutes walk from the hotel.Overall this is a great airport hotel mainly because of its location inside the terminal.I would stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It was a superb decision to stay right at the airport. Room was on the small side, but very clean (as was everywhere we stayed in Japan) and more than made up for by the fact that we experienced no aircraft noise whatsoever.Food and drink great and reasonably priced: cocktails were cheap.Ordered an iron & it was delivered speedily.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park Hotel is located meters from the check-in desks at Haneda airport, making it incredibly convenient for short stays in Tokyo. I landed in Haneda at 11pm and had a 24 hour stopover - this hotel was perfect (simply collect your bags, walk up the elevator and head towards check-in desks J and L). Staff were lovely and there were no problems storing my bags after checkout. Wifi was brilliant.The rooms were small but perfectly comfortable. Overall a lovely stay. To travel into Tokyo, I would suggest the monorail (staff and help desks suggested a bus but the monorail is a cheaper and significantly faster option). The monorail goes to Hamamatsuchō station - get off there and transfer to the JR subway line to go to Tokyo, Shibuya, Shinjuku, Harajuku etc). Very quick and easy. If you buy a Suica card you can use that on any subway line or monorail.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had the premium floor. Very convenient and clean. Small rooms, very good wifi, was able to stream Netflix no problem. You can hear all the hallway traffic noise from your bed. Good breakfast is included.They have a rigid check in time of 1500 hrs even though there are rooms available. It costs you an extra JPY 1000 per hour prior to that time.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room was very good (don't expect any panorama...) and so the hotel in general.Room service ok, and the breakfast complete with local and Western cuisine choices.Would recommend if your stay doesnt last more than two nights

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Spotless, impressively shiny, friendly and polite staff and ridiculously hassle free and easy to check in next morning. I felt as though I stepped out of the hotel door and into the plane. We didn't do breakfast but food and wine at dinner were very acceptable. Not fine dining but a wide choice of international dishes served. Rooms small but comfortable, clean beds and good coffee. Just what we need before an 11 hour flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I always enjoy flying to Haneda airport as it is much more convenience than Narita. For a short overnight business trip, this small hotel is ideally situated at the Haneda airport.Basic but got everything you need, spotless clean like any good Japanese chain hotel.I will come back if I don't need to go to town.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a perfect little hotel for airport layovers. Firstly, it is incredibly convenient for travellers - on the third floor of the airport. The rooms are silent, with nice bedding, towels and pyjamas. While the rooms are not North American sized rooms they include a hanging closet, small dresser and desk. The bathrooms are efficient, clean and modern, and include a Toto Washlet toilet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a great night's sleep before they continue on with their journey.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After 20+ hours of air travel and arriving newr midnight I couldnt dream of getting on the train. Thanks for this gem you dont have to. They have literally thought of EVERYTHING! Bath products in the shower, hair brush, you do not even need bring sleep wear, its provided. I was so impressed by the professionalism of the staff and the accommodation I would recommend to everyone.Lost one star because breakfast was $20 and so/so. Hotel is also difficult to find in the airport if you do not already know where to look. (Its on floor 3 - departures. Hidden behind counter L)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed at Royal Park The Haneda for one night before my departure the next day. Great location just next to the departure hall. The check in time was 3pm but I was there at 10am, so I left my luggage with the concierge and went shopping.The room was very spacious, I could even push the whole trolley cart into the room!However, I didn't get a good night sleep as I was constantly woken up by people checking in and I could hear noises of luggage being pushed into rooms. Other than that, room was nice and comfortable with a thermostat to control room temperature.Would definitely stay again if I have an early flight in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Please try to read the entire review because I would like to be as fair as possible. I originally rated this hotel a five and actually had to officially withdraw that review because I submitted it just before check out and the experience during check out was what made me change my rating. Overall, I still think it's a great hotel but unfortunately ruined by one person, sadly it was the manager on duty last Tuesday, Feb 23 at around 12nnGreat things about this hotel1. Convenient location for transit and short stop overs. It is accessible through airport and connected through train lines. If the intent is to stay connected to airport and transport this hotel is a good choice. If Tokyo is just a day tour, this hotel is perfect 2. The room is small compared to standard but well kept, modern and elegant3. Staff was polite,helpful during check in. Check in was a breeze4. Breakfast buffet included and has a wide range of options even for vegetarians 5. Wifi was fast enough to watch Netflix without interruption 6. I would stay here again if the intent is to connect through different parts of Japan. If Tokyo is the main location I recommend to stay right in the heart of Tokyo 7. A bit pricey but I was willing to pay for the convenience and the efficiency of transit -- that made it well worth it****** my original review ended there ...but please read on Check out became a horrible experience because1. We asked if we could leave a set of clothes (a pair of pants, dress shirt and a coat) because we were trying to travel light for our onward journey in Nagano but was told their policy won't allow that. We were coming back on the 29th but we won't be checked in so that -- to me was understandable. I wasn't going to mark them down for that. I understood concerns of logistics, storage etc. it's just that most hotels would allow for it. We travel a lot and that was a first decline to such request. But like I said, that's understandable 2. The real unpleasant experience was when we were looking for our local driver and asked the staff politely if he could be kind enough to ring a local number .. The answer was a flat NO. A blank expression, no apology NO. When we asked to speak to the manager, he said, "I am the manager" and so we thought to avoid the drama, we'll use Skype and move on. Just like that, the hotel left a bad taste in customer service for us.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Rooms were small cosedering at the airport, but they were nice clean with all the amenities. They even provide you the night dress.Hotel is right at the airport, very convienent as you get off the plane, included decent breakfastStaff was very helpful, they took care of out luggage when we went out and brought it back on return

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It's located at the international terminal. It's the best choice if you just want a nice place to rest after arriving very late at night. Clean, new facilities, comfortable, but of course it's small because it's in Tokyo. Price is reasonable.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Booked: Double room for three nightsI came down with the flu the day before my flight and was not let on to the plane. After having visited the airport clinic (at which time I was running a 40 deg C fever) I thought it would be best to check in at Royal Park since I could barely walk and carry my luggage.The helpful airline ground staff told me that there are room availabilities at Royal Park Hotel Haneda, so when I arrived there and explained my condition I was told that they had no free rooms I was surprised and worried. After resting in the lobby for a little while, I decided to check online and saw that indeed there was an availability, to which the Royal Park Hotel front desk said yes there is but it has to be booked online, which is fine with me. After I've made my online booking (10:30am) I was told that check-in is at 3pm. Instead, running a fever and visibly ill, I had to sleep in the lobby for about 2 hours until the airline ground staff came around to check on me. It was only at this point that reception approached me and informed me that I can check in early.I think they should have explained in the first place:(1) That there may be availabilities online that I could book since there are no free rooms on their system; (2) that I can check in early and just pay an extra fee.Apart from that, the hotel room was beautiful, quiet, and the amenities are well though out. Most of the older staff rostered in the evening during my stay are very nice and hospitable. I'm unsure if it was because I turned up without a booking but surely those are not grounds for receiving the cold treatment?

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Nice hotel. Rooms reasonably sized for Japan. Set up was nice.We stayed twice.First was a premium room that came with coffee vouchers, a refresh room pass (didn't use) and... something else, I forgot. The room was better than the standard room, but in small ways.Second was the same room without all those extras. Size same as the above.Check in was efficient. Connections to city convenient, so much so that it actually is an option rather than going into the city, if your stay is short.Pillows were soft and yet had support. One of those with dual content and can be folded on one side so you can prop up. Nice.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: You go thru immigration and get your luggage, after your 12 or 13 hour flight from the US. Though you slept a bit on the plane, you are really tired. You walk a few hundred yards to the Royal Park Haneda Hotel, IN the international Haneda terminal! Check in is easy. There are always THREE people manning the front desk.The rooms are expensive, though the fees change almost daily, depending upon a specific date. I found using the internet to rent the room a few months in advance got me a significant discount. There are many varieties of rooms. My wife and I don't travel light...we went for the premium superior twin. The room is narrower than we find in the US, but we could find room to place 4 suitcases either on the furniture, a case holder, or in a corner of the room on the floor.  The beds are super comfortable. The bathroom is quite large...there is a walk in shower. Toilet seat is heated. The toilet fills up when one is sitting on the john, and flushes when you stand up. Of course there is a bidet function, with a variety of spritz types!! The wifi in the room worked better than the wifi in the terminal. The place is well insulated. We are IN the airport, and never heard a plane! Nice view from the large window. There is a restaurant right next to the lobby. Our room came with breakfast....which was absolutely fantastic. A myriad of choices, buffet style, both Japanese and American foods. Omelets cooked on demand...were great! Much fun experimenting with the Japanese offerings! There are trains and busses right outside the airport. Train into central Tokyo takes about 45min to an hour. Bus up to Narita airport also leaves right outside the terminal.  So if you don't HAVE to be staying in central Tokyo, or if you have an early flight out the next morning. this is a SUPERB CHOICE!!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived late into Haneda airport, Tokyo-Japan and were met with many welcoming smiles. Check in was brief, informative and friendly ( we had booked the hotel previously) we were explained on our vouchers, surroundings and where we needed to go to find our rooms. The rooms were clean and with pretty much all the amenities you could need, toothbrushes /paste, hairbrush, cotton balls,lady shavers,men shavers, shower caps, disposable underwear,earbuds, hairdryer. On our bed was a pajama set for each. One size fits all in a thick cotton and very comfortable. And before you groan with a oh no! yes possibly the sleeves and trouser bottoms were a little short, it did not matter as comfort was supreme.. Tho we did get a midnight giggle out of our appearance but isn't that ok for a holiday? The pillows were not soft but interestingly comfortable in a stiffness one does not expect. As this was our first time in Japan we really do not know what and how things will be. The bathroom was clean and with everything you would need. A coffee machine for your morning brew and complimentary water. A great place to crash after a long journey half way across the world and interestingly enough you can also rent these rooms by the hour if u need to freshen up before your flight home. Deft 5 stars!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very nice hotel for a quick Narita-Haneda transfer nap, rooms were spacious and comfortable, with features that are very often required but overlooked whilst traveling such as 2 razors (his and hers) as well as big amenities.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A Japanese business hotel as we like the . Small rooms but super clean and the usual treat: the electronic toilets, the convenient bath and all the electronic you need. It is close to the incredible Haneda international shopping mall. So plenty of good restaurant and interesting shop. Worth spending a. Igbo between flights. You will not be irked like in airport hotel and still get your plane on time.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We decided to book a night here after our flights were changed and we ended up arriving in Tokyo late at night before out previously booked accommodation was available. Check in was hassle free and the staff were very helpful. The room was lovely and peaceful. A full convenience basket was available in the bathroom so we hardly needed to open our bags. No airport noise at all! Just what we needed to start our holiday fresh and rested the next day. You don't even have to leave the airport to get here. Just go up one floor and head to the far right and you are there. Food and drink was a little pricey but there are 24hr food stalls open on the floor above that are much more reasonable. Worth every penny to start our trip on such a good note rather than trying to navigate the city after 15 hrs flying.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The perfect sanctuary for overnight stay between flights. We arrived around 900pm after arriving at Narita post 9 hour flight from Brisbane and Airport Limo transfer to Haneda. We were all fairly exhausted. Not as hard to find as we'd thought, check in a breeze. We had two rooms for two adults and three kids. Clean rooms and bathrooms, adequate size, comfy beds, quiet despite the airport location and the perfect step off point for next leg of our journey to Niseko. Desk staff very helpful and courteous. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived at Haneda International Airport around midnight. How good a feeling was it to know that your Hotel is only minutes away without having to leave the airport. The hotel is located in the other end of the departure area of the airport which is one level up from the arrival floor. The checked in was quick and within minutes we are in our room The hotel is very new and so the room and bathroom were in excellent condition. The room size is reasonable, so is the bathroom. We booked 2 rooms for family of four. The rooms were next to each other which is good since the other rooms were for my 2 boys. The staff were friendly and speak reasonable English. Easy access by public transport. As it is an airport, there are lots of places too eat inside without having to leave the building. The hotel also cater for a day stay where you can shower, change and relax before your next flight. Highly recommended specially for those arriving late or leaving early.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Pros:Clean. Modern. Comfortable bed and pillow. Huge shower and tub. A/C worked well. English friendly. Very nice staff. Conviently located in Intl terminal. Took less than 5 mins to walk inside from hotel front desk to airline check in! Could not be easier or more convenient.Cons: Confusing because they also have a Royal Park "short stay" or "layover" mini hotel in the same terminal. So if you are staying at THIS main hotel, you have to go through customs, passed baggage claim, then upstairs up escalator to Departure level, passed airline check in counters to get to this MAIN hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Since our flight arrived very late from the U.S., it was convenient to just take the elevator from arrival to departure check-in area, walk to the end where a hallway connects the airport to the hotel and where you find courteous and pleasant staff ready to get you checked-in right away so you can get into your room to rest and sleep. One cannot pay enough for such convenience. Although the room was small, it had everything we needed for comfort. The bathroom was spacious and beautifully designed just like the bedroom. My husband and I loved the shower head!! With some of the airport restaurants open 24-hours, we were able to walk out of the hotel, back into the airport, take the escalator up to the restaurant area and have some ramen before going to bed. The hotel restaurant opens until 11 pm only but the good thing is you get a discount voucher for the restaurant when you check-in which you can use the following day. After checking-out at 11am and having a meal, we did some shopping (all the stores and restaurants were open by then), took the elevator down with our luggage to the arrival lobby again, bought our bus tickets to Narita for our connecting flight and final destination. In comparison to all our international trips, we hardly felt any stress at all during this trip. Having chosen to stay at this hotel instead of any other hotel in town, made the difference.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Location at Haneda airport, nice hotel, litle room, good cleanliness, good food for breakfast, good crew service but not much crew. good for businees man. poor view. if you stay just for transit, this hotel is good, but not for a long stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A newly built hotel with quirky decor. The rooms are slightly small but very clean and comfortable. Room service is available. We chose this hotel because of the very convenient location next to the airport. The staff were very hospitable.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Haneda Royal Park Hotel is conveniently located inside the International Terminal of Haneda Airport. My family of four and I decided to stay here for one night because we were arriving into Haneda late at night from the US. Because we were traveling with two young children, we did not want to spend too much effort going to an off-airport hotel, or even worse, trying to get into Tokyo proper and potentially missing the last trains if our flight was delayed. The Haneda met my needs completely, and enabled us to get a good night sleep on our first night and potentially minimized jet-lag for the family. It was a good start to our holidays.The hotel lobby is literally located next to the check-in counters at the airport – super convenient even with luggage. We had booked a Deluxe Twin for four people. As other reviewers mentioned, the room is not spacious, but they did manage to put in four beds into the room, which was great. It was wall-to-wall beds, but if the goal is to get a good night sleep, it was perfectly fine. The room was very modern and clean, with a Japanese style bath, and a separate toilet / water closet room.The one surprise was that I did find a harder time than expected finding takeout dinner late at night. There is a restaurant at the hotel, but I just wanted something quick to bring back to the room. Although there are a lot of restaurants listed to be open 24 hours inside the airport, it turned out that most of them are “airside” after security, and only a few outside security.Other tips:- There’s a JR Rail office right at the airport to exchange your JR Rail Pass. I found it to be super crowded first thing in the morning, but not so bad if you come back an hour after the office opens.- Take advantage of the many luggage delivery services at the airport to send your bags ahead to your destination. Save the effort to carry your bags on and off trains .. it’ll be there waiting for you in a day or two, and it’s a relatively economical service.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Great hotel! Excellent service, the restaurant attached served amazing food we had dinner and breakfast! The room was perfect! A very comfortable bed and just knowing that you can get up and board your plane made the trip less stressful! Would recommend to anyone

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Well I found this hotel comfortable but rooms are too small . This is my 1st time to stay in such a small room , but somehow I like it as it meets my all needs . It's easy to catch train or bus to the city as the station nd bus station is attracted with airport . Lot of food outlet are available at the airport . You have many shop in d airport where you can pick up the green tea chocolates , Royce chocolate and many more.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a excellently quality built transit hotel that is conveniently attached to the Haneda international terminal.Everything is tightly packed into a tiny room, pretty much good for a few hour stopover. The room is clean, air conditioning easily controlled, bathroom is great with a terrific shower.It was very convenient for our 8 hour stopover.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is very nice. It is conveniently located in the airport. This was extremely helpful. The rooms are very clean. I've stayed here twice. Both visits were only overnight. Definitely would stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We arrived at NRT at night and didn't have a connection flight that goes to next destination so we planned to look around Tokyo. Although it might be a little far from Asakusa, shinjuku, etc., it's still convenient to get around by trains. It's very clean, comfortable and reasonable, and the staff are very nice and helpful. Also there are plenty of restaurants to eat at Haneda airport, which is right next to the hotel. We saw Mt. Fuji from our room one morning! That was a great surprise.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The location of this hotel is perfect for getting a good rest during a long layover at Haneda. You do not have to go through passport control on arrival at Haneda and get to the hotel as a person in transit. The airport has signs directing you to the hotel. The rooms are tiny but well designed. The beds are comfortable. The decor in the lobby is very attractive. I could not figure out how to book this hotel on-line and called for a reservation.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We were traveling from San Francisco to Hanoi and had an overnight in Haneda Airport from 11 pm to 9am. We found the Royal Park Haneda Transit Hotel and was told by the reception gentleman that I had made my reservation at the Other Royal Park Haneda Hotel. Luckily there was room at the transit hotel site and we were able to stay! ( SO, be very careful when making your reservations that it is for the Transit Hotel!) Yes the room was small but had everything we needed, a big bed, shower, even night shirt and fabric spray to freshen our travel worn clothes! The bed was a bit firm for my tastes but fine for my hubby. In the morning we ate a quick continental breakfast and walked about 100 yards to our gate without having to go thru security! Very Handy!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This airport hotel (Int'l Terminal) couldn't be more convenient or comfortable. On my first trip through Haneda (on my way to Kansai), my 10:30pm arrival (leaving noon the next day) required an overnight stay. This hotel was fairly easy to find in the airport (check-in level of Int'l terminal) and very welcoming. Check-in was easy (I booked directly on hotel website, no credit card needed) and quick. My room was tiny but very efficiently laid out, clean, quiet and comfortable. The glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom can be a little disconcerting, but as I was alone, it didn't bother me and it did allow some light into the room from the bathroom window (there is a blind to pull down to block the light and the non-existent view). Bed was comfortable with the conveniently placed light switches that one finds in Asian hotels. The low credenza that holds a flat screen TV also contains a safe and a small refrigerator. My favorite (though minor) amenity--TWO boxes of tissues--one in the bedroom and one in the bathroom. Shower/bath easier to use than some and the toilet options are in both Japanese and English (and on a wall panel so easy to read/use). I would stay here again any time. Price (16,000Y or $135 US) was not out of line.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed two nights and surprised how good it is. New, clean, modern, rooms have tub and shower. Bed in single worked for me (6'5"). Rooms are compact but comfortable. Nice toiletries, hair drier, Japanese style washlet toilet. Nice towels and Happi Coat. Coffee tea and Kettle. 1 bottle free water per night. Ac/heating with room control and ionizer. Comfortable bed and gave me non allergenic pillows (asked for 3). Cable TV with Video On Demand. Only downer no US news channels just BBC which is very repetitious. Check in and out efficient and helpful. Foreign exchange machine in Lobby (useful as using ATM with US cards proved impossible). Restaurant / cafeteria style at entrance which has a small bar but not a real hotel bar. Numerous excellent restaurants and bar/ cafes just outside on 4F. Restaurant entrance on 4F far left behind departures and checkins.Got good rate on internet travel site. There are cheaper options but being in departure area is so convenient. Good monorail and rail access to Downtown, Shinjuku, Roppingi, Akihabra, Harajuku etc.Will return. Thoroughly recommend.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel located in the international departure at Haneda airport. We stayed here only for 1 night. We booked for 2 standard rooms and requested a connecting door. When we checked-in, the friendly staff told us that we could get 2 rooms with a connecting door. Since we arrived at the hotel too early to use the rooms, we left our luggages there and we went to Shibuya for last minute shopping. When we came back, check-in staff informed us that our luggages has been sent to our rooms. Very efficient. The room itself was quite spacious for airport hotel standard. The hotel provides night gown as well. Comfortable beds, clean bathroom. Will definitely stay there again

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Airport hotel in International terminal (far end of departure area,upstairs) straight forward. Clean, small. Gay friendly. Plenty of grindr if that's what you want. No issues with guests though lift only allows to your own floor. Pretty good value for location and Japan. Small reasonable priced restaurant

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Great stay for my long layover on my way to Manila. Check in was a breeze. Everyone I encountered was friendly. The room was small and organized. Very clean as well. Was convenient that hotel was in the international terminal. Just walked out of the hotel to the check in counters.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I won't bore you with details of the hotel, this is well covered by other reviews and we would support all the positive comments. Instead, a simple anecdote reflecting the quality of service you will expect. We arrived in our hotel room late evening and expected to see all of our bags which had been couriered from our origin by a well known delivery service. However, one of the three bags was not ours and our flight was leaving the next morning! We contacted the hotel staff and they took over, contacting the company, making numerous calls, getting the site manager of the delivery company to see us (while they acted as a translator) and providing us constant feedback on progress, or should I say the lack of it.In the end we left without our bag but comforted by the knowledge that thanks to the administrations of the RPH staff our missing bag was properly flagged with the delivery company and action would be taken. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I was to arrive at Haneda at 11:00 pm for this trip, so I proposed to stay there for a night. When my flight arrived at Haneda, it was raining outside. To my surprise, we can access the hotel indoor and directly from the airport building. There is no need to worry about the rain outside! It took only 5 minutes to go to the hotel, its location is extremely convenient. Near its entrance, there are some restaurants where we can enjoy our "late" meal. Undoubtedly, I will stay there again if I am going to arrive late at Haneda at night one more time.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We were at the tail-end of our week-long Japan trip and wanted a hotel close to the airport for our return flight home. The hotel is not only close to the Haneda airport but it is actually inside the airport! We had a good night's rest and woke up just 3 hours before our 9:30AM flight. The limited lead time we had did not worry us as the airport check-in counters are right behind the hotel's exit doors.The hotel room is very modern and offered an in-room humidifier.The room package we availed excluded free breakfast but we were able to choose from the various airport restaurants.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed for a night before flying home and found it to be extremely convenient. We came from a ski trip in Hakuba, so we took the Nagano Snow Shuttle directly to Haneda International Airport Terminal. Our flight was not until midnight the following day, so we left our luggage with the concierge when we checked out in the morning.The Hollywood Twin room was expectedly small, but comfortable in all ways. From our room on the 6th floor, we had a nice view of the sunset, and Mt Fuji in the distance. The only issue I had with the hotel was that the staff lacked warmth in welcoming guests. Courtesies were perfunctory, and the staff displayed a businesslike coolness that was disconcerting.All in, I would stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Why did I use this hotel?1. I had a 850am international departure flight the next day2. I had children and elderly passengers with me 3. I could do a last minute shopping at the airport for souvenirs4. I could pack my bulky winter clothing into my luggage and checked it in with the airline. The hotel was at the side of the international terminal. It was on the departure floor, hence I could wheel all my luggage on the airport trolley into the hotel, their lift, right into my room. Very handy when you have quite a bit to carry and tired. And when I checked out, right to my airline counter!Check in was strictly 3pm onwards. I arrived at 2pm. They gave me an option to check in 1hour earlier at a fee of Y1,000 per room (I have 3 rooms). I would expect it to be free if rooms were available. But it was a reasonable amount. Rather than to wait or leave your luggage with the bell boy I supposed?Front desk staff could speak English.Room was big, modern, functional but not as luxurious as the one in Shiodome,Tokyo. I had a family room that could fit 4 beds, a sofa and still space for us to move around freely. My room faced the main road leading to the departure terminal, so it wasn't much of a view. The other side of the hotel faced the runway. Better view I supposed? But you do have an open/enclosed viewing gallery at the departure hall on level 5, hence the runway view might not be necessary.Sleep quality was good. In fact the pillow had two sides, one which is hard and the other soft. The pillow can be extended too. Yes, extended. At a loss on how to describe. See it yourself.Stable wifi in the room.There was a dressing room with a separate shower and bathtub. WC was in a separate room near the main door, so someone could be having a shower and another in the WC at the same time with no privacy issue. The hotel's water tank was made from wood, supposed to be anti-bacterial, eco-friendly and would last longer than 30 years. It gave the water a slight sweet taste and a nice wooden smell. Look out for that. There were ample restaurants, Mos Burger, Yoshinoya and a convenience store in the airport. The shopping at the airport -- before clearing immigration...it was adequate for last minute gifts like snacks and souvenirs. But just barely. It was no where near HK, Spore or South Korea's standards. Strange. After passing immigration, there were the usual plus some luxury brands offerings - but not much, Hence you might want to buy your gifts in Tokyo if you came across any. Electronics items were very limited, no where near Bic Camera. I thought Kansai airport (Osaka) was much better. Overall, a decent hotel but perhaps let down by the airport itself.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We touched down at Haneda Airport at around 1030pm and already made plans way advance to stay the night at the hotel before embarking on our journey the next day. We are not expecting much as this is an airport hotel that travellers seek to have a short stay before or after their flight. The hotel is located within the airport itself, it is easy to navigate to the hotel as the signs are appropriate. We did not even had to head out of the airport at all. Before reaching the hotel, there are also eateries around such as Yoshinoya and Mos Burger. Food options are easily accessible. The front desk personnel is so friendly to attend all our needs, the man serving us helped us to fax a letter within Japan with a charge and explained everything in adequate English. The room is cozy but decent for both of us, we could open both 24" and 30" luggage at the same time. The bed is very comfortable that we had a very good night rest! The best part of all is the water from the shower and taps. The water is stored in a wooden tank, which gives out a woody smell and different texture. It does not dry the skin after bath and it acts as a bath salt too! Good surprise from an airport hotel!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Room was huge. There's more space outside Tokyo and it shows with the room size. The hotel provided a cot at no extra charge, which was wonderful. The only oddity was that they could only provide a twin room, i.e. two separate single beds, if we wanted the cot. If it was a king bed, the room would be much smaller and not able to fit a cot.There was a separate bath and shower area as is the norm in Japan. They also had a separate cubicle for the WC, which makes complete sense. One downside was that we had to our toddler even though they obviously would have known, given that they set up the cot.The location was great, just off the check in area at the airport, and it was possible to push the luggage cart into the hotel lift and directly to the room. The corridors were dark and depressing, just like what airport hotels are expected to be.My main beef about this place was that reception staff were not well trained. One in particular didn't have good English and was not trained to hand us over to someone else who could. He came across as rude and standoffish, basically saying no to everything (when all we were asking about was details about how early we should checkout considering our flight departure times, and the details involved). We had to be firm about asking for another staff member to take over before we got someone with better English to take over. This would be fine in any other hotel in Japan except an airport hotel. Staff should at least be trained to hand over any language issues to someone who could understand and answer appropriately. This left a rather negative impression, so the rating is reduced by one star to three stars.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: LocationHotel is located within the international Terminal near the check-in island L and just around the corner- fairly easy to find as signage is offered and HND airport information staff very helpful. As your in the airport very accessible to any parts of Tokyo via JR line and buses plus the rest of the world etc.Room on 7th floor was rather small even for Japanese standards, for the price paid it seems a bit cramped even or me as a big westerner though just about ok for single traveller. The room offers a single bed but quite spacious but with only one pillow, though is comfortable. One side of bed is a mini side table built into unit that offers the touch light controls and bed side dimmer function. There is also an alarm clock, LAN slot and some 'jimbo' plug sockets (likely for some local phones but no USB unfortunately). Next to this is a small old style case- not sure you can sit on as it opens and is next to coffee table. There is portable pull out luggage rack. To the side of bed is a very small closest to hang some items, plus shoe horn and brush. Also hotel branded slippers are offered and a sleeping outfit. Facing the bed is a unit with TV on top- that offers 12 channels, many Japanese but none include BBC world news, CCTV and Korean. There is also some VOD at 1000Yen.Below is a tiny refrigerator that offers one complimentary bottle of water. Plus an easy to use SAFE, laptop size and kettle with coffee and tea sachets. A telephone is offered next to TV and a air machine. The room has a digital AC controls which worked well. The bathroom adjoins the bed room with see through windows though pull down blinds can be used for privacy. A combo deep bath and shower head is offered, plus a digital washlet. Amenities includes large dispenser bottles of body soap, shampoo and conditioner by Mikimoto. There is also a hair dryer and single amenities of toothbrush, shaver kit, brush and vanity kit plus hair dryer and plenty of towels. Overall a compact room but functional for sleeping but not for working on computer upright as no desk offered. There is also some views of the airport for those plane minded spotters. FacilitiesThe hotels offers free fast WIFI that is secure and can be used for multiple devices. There is a restaurant near lobby plus a smoking room and art gallery. There is also a massage service as mentioned in guide. Staff Staff are pleasant polite but regimented with struct guidelines that check-in is only allowed at 3pm with check out at 11am. I left at midnight so was allowed to check-in 30 minutes early, but with persuasion- she initially tried to charge me for 230pm check-in which seemed a bit over the top. They also charge a 100 yen tax despite a pre-pay booking as some form of city tax. Overall a perfect location for between flights as no need to leave airport, HND has lots of nice facilities and shops, restaurants etc on 4th floor (one level above) so a nice spot without having to wait for a shuttle service meaning can maximise sleep as check-in area is on same level as lobby. However slightly over priced for what you get, when say compared to Hotel mystays or Excel- which both offered a working desk at around the same rate or less. However it was 3 days prior to christmas so perhaps prices were unusually high. However as mentioned very convenient for international departures in between flights and comfortable room. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had a trip from Denver to Kuala Lumpur, with a long stopover in Tokyo. The wrinkle was that I arrived at Narita Airport, and departed from Haneda Airport.The best decision was to hop onto the shuttle bus from Narita to Haneda, and to decide what to do with myself once I got to Haneda.I had many hours to burn in Haneda Airport, and a nap was in order.The Royal Park Hotel had a room for me. Checking was fast and efficient. I was able to leave my luggage, including a bike box, with the concierge.The room was what one would expect in Japan. Compact, neat, spotlessly clean, and with all the mod-cons required.I had a good nap, and then a nice hot shower.My stay at Royal Park Hotel Haneda left me refreshed and ready for the final leg of my journey to Kuala Lumpur.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here for one night after arriving at the airport and going on to a Shinkansen the next day. Located on the third floor of the airport inside the terminal with some restaurants around. Their own restaurant is open for dinner until 1am and there's free wifi. Service was professional friendly and efficient - we were given a room on the executive floor and it was just right for a nights stay. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was fair, though there weren't many Western breakfast options unfortunately. Overall a great place to stay after a flight into Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here for four nights in Dec 2015. It is very conveniently located- at the airport itself and therefore if you land up at an odd hour you just walk a hundred meters or so to arrive at the hotel. Staff is polite and helpful. Housekeeping and general hygiene is excellent. Breakfast is sumptuous and restaurant appears very good. Connectivity to the town is easy and fast. You can pick and choose the mode. One thing missing at the hotel is a gym which I recommend very strongly to be set up.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had booked this hotel because it was right at the airport and we were landing pretty late in the night. We just needed a place to crash at. The hotel is very convenient right inside the terminal and was nice, clean and comfortable. Maybe I would not recommend staying here for a long stay since it is slightly expensive and far from the touristy stuff but definitely a very good option if you have a layover or need a place to rest before or after a flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This one of the largest hotel room that i have stay in Japan with the same price. The room is very nice, large. And the location is very strategic, especially when you have to catch earlier flight in the morning, just 5 minutes walk to the check in counter in the airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. Nice and friendly staff and clean rooms. Good variety in buffet breakfast. Convent location with the city just 45 mins away by train or metro from the airport which is also nice since it has several souvenir shops and good range of restaurants from economical (yoshinoya)to traditional expensive ones. Nice souvenir and toy shops in airport shops which surprisingly has same prices as souvenirs in places like akihabara. Nice view deck too on 5th floor. The hotel has a great view of tokyo bay, the tokyo bridge and even mt. Fuji on a clear day which fortunately for our 4 day stay was always clear.
user_name:
Marvin Jose M
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Excellent location, which offers "dry feet" transition from the terminal to the hotel and a very good comfort of rest despite the small rooms. An excellent choice for accommodation in anticipation of the flight interchange.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room I stayed was compact, but surprisingly well designed. Very modern and fresh!We arrived at the hotel at 12am. Check in was smooth, and the staff was polite and professional. There are several restaurants opening 24 hours located right outside of the hotel. If you want to use a convenience store in the midnight, I recommend to stop by Lawson on the first floor BEFORE checking in. The hotel is located at the end of the departure floor(third), so it will be a long walk to get there.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I arrived in Tokyo Haneda at midnight, on my way back to Singapore, to be told by gate staff that according to the system I never left San Francisco and I couldn't board my flight as it was full in every class.The next available flight was the next day, 11 hours away.I checked in to the Transit Hotel (Royal Park Hotel), with very low expectations. How good could an airport transit hotel be?It was perfect. Simple check in process, polite competent staff, quick and efficient.The room was simple, super clean, comfortable bed, great pillow, good climate control, great shower, all the basic amenities plus some nice added touches like a set of pyjamas (great for those with unexpected layovers like me!). It was very quiet, and dark with the blinds closed. An unexpected good night's sleep!They charge in 6-hour blocks, and the rate is very affordable.Super impressed.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Modern, clean room, with all the amenities you'd expect. A little small, but for the location that's to be expected. The hotel doors open right onto the international terminal, so perfect for an early flight. No super early alarm call was necessary for my 9am check in, and no shuttle bus to the terminal.The fact it's part of a hotel isn't something I was conscious of once checked in. The windows blocked external sound, and the bed was fine. So no frills, but perfectly serviceable with friendly, efficient staff at check in/out. I didn't eat there as there were plenty of options in the terminal. As for the price, it's a little on the high side, but you pay for the convenience. Overall, no complaints. I'll stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I arrived Haneda International Airport at about 11pm last Tuesday and decided to stay put in Royal Park for a night before heading to Tokyo city. The hotel is located in the airport itself and is at about 5 minutes walk from the arrival hall. Hotel staffs were extremely professional. Check in was hassle free and quick. The room size was rather small. It would be good for solo traveler or individuals travelling in a group of two. The Hotel provides the standard hotel amenities which are good in quality. This hotel would be a great option for individuals arriving Haneda airport late at night or if it is simply for layovers!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Modern clean, but a little cramped. We had 10 hours to kill before a flight after a transfer from Narita and I'm afraid didn't plan well expecting to sightsee. Feeling dreadful after the pervious long flight we investigated a room, which at £120 for a walk in wasn't too bad. It was very accessible, about as close as a hotel gets to departures. A great option for a real rest between flights, and 10% off at the hotel restaurant which was pretty good.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Expecting late flight landing is so relief just smooth checking in, no document confirmation necessary except passport verification. A very modern layout no doubt is small but after a long flight a hustle free room for resting is most comfort. Quiet room and the nite and morning view with the Rainbow Bridge across the bay! As we got a good rate for an early booking is worth the stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed here for one night on business whilst waiting for a flight transfer. I arrived at 1145pm and was greeted by friendly and courteous reception staff.The room was small but very comfortable and fine for a quick overnight.Food and wine were good and promptly served at a reasonable price.Perfect, easily accessed location for an overnight airport stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We spent the first night here during our 6 days journey in Japan. The receptionist was very welcoming and friendly. It was a great hospitality by the staff, something that i don't really see back in my country.The lobby was really clean and shiny. The room also was decent and clean. They provided robes as standard. Too bad it doesn't fit me size most japanese has a small body size. Our room do not comes with a closet, but they provided a basic wall hangar. More than enough since we only slept for a night and checked out early in the morning since need to catch the bus to kawaguchiko.Their pillow is different than the normal pillows. At first it felt kinda odd but eventually we found it comfortable. They also provided various bath amenities which was very convenient. The bathroom is equipped with a bidet, so it made washing easy.Definitely will stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a nice hotel for a night and very convenient for Haneda as it's attached to the terminal. Royal Park hotels are very reliable and you get what you pay for. They're a bit pricey but always a nice room and very clean (but, being Japan, can be a bit tight).I have stayed at this hotel twice now and I must mention the showers...The temperature can go from perfect to scalding hot in an instant. This is a pain and made very dangerous as the shower is in the bath and the surface is extremely slippery.Be careful!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Literally in the airport, great service including delivering a trolley for the luggage direct to our door at requested time. Clean modern room and also grabbed a late dinner in restaurant which was better than expected for hotel dining. The best thing was being able to walk the 1 minute walk to check in the next morning.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: this is the perfect hotel after traveling a long way or arriving late at night. We walked straight from the airport to the connecting building . The checkin was prompt and professional. The lobby was neat and inviting . The room was rather compact , 2 twin beds and a rather large sofa which doubled as a rollaway just about. The amenities in the room were plentiful . The darkening curtains were awesome ! We slept until 9:30 and did not see any light thru the curtains . We did not hear any noise from the airport either . Would recommend this hotel without reservation .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Great value for money. Not too far from central Tokyo and rooms compact but well designed. Extremely quiet and certainly easy to variety of restaurants of different price ranges. Would definitely come back.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed 3 nights between flights in and out of Haneda airport. Hotel located on the departure level was very convenient. Due to early arrival had to wait a few hours for checkin,but was able to check in early by paying an extra 1000 Yen per hour which I thought was reasonable. Transport into central Tokyo is very easy using the monorail. The station is only a couple of minutes walk on the departures level from the hotel. The single room was quite small,but very clean,comfortable and had all the amenities I needed. There is a food court in the airport terminal with a variety of restaurants catering to different tastes and budgets. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Super convenient, a bit on the pricey side, clean, modern, a little bigger than your average tokyo business hotel.On International departure level, grab a cart and checkin. Had a late arrival to HND, and a 6am departure next day. Was the obvious choice to stay there. They do NOT hold luggage for you but the long term luggage hold is a 1 minute walk on the same level. Stayed early October 2015, was around $140/night for a regular room. Fast ethernet or wireless. English speaking staff.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is located within the new Haneda Airport International Terminal on the same floor as the departure check in. The rooms are exceptionally clean, comfortable, quiet and the service is first class, as one would expect in Japan. The room was a little expensive but the convenience of being 5 minutes from check in was an important consideration as we had a morning departure. I recommend highly.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here one night as we arrived too late at night to check in to an AirBnB apartment. We arrived at midnight and were excited as it was the first night of our trip so were pleased to still be able to get a beer in the hotel bar.The room was tiny but immaculate (I think we booked the least expensive room, mainly as that was all that was available when I was making the booking). Not enough room to open both our bags, but it didn’t matter for one night. The hotel had clearly tried to think of everything and make everything as perfect as possible. Although the pillows were not really our thing – like bricks! There were also some switches next to the bed which lit up so you could find them – but as the room was so small the switches were close to my eyes and the light kept me awake!The breakfast was great – the best scrambled egg I’ve had in hotel in a long while. Charming and helpful staff.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed because we had a late night flight and didn't want to spend the last day hauling luggage across Tokyo.Great location, literally in the international check-in part of the airport.Hotel was very clean with good size rooms and excellent staff.Cleaning staff were exceptionally courteous and diligent.And, our room had a great view of Fuji across the city!Transport links meant we were easily able to go into Tokyo (25 mins) or Yokohama (20 mins) for the day.Hotel happily looked after our luggage and they have short stay rooms to freshen up or there's a shower room in the arrival hall.As usual, for this type of hotel, buffet breakfast was too expensive (2500 yen), so we gave it a miss.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed in this hotel overnight and it is a very convenient and comfortable option for anyone wanting to stop at the airport. The location is excellent, and the rooms are nicely decorated (although they are very small).

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: i left an important souvenir i bought for my daughter from universal studio japan 3 weeks ago in the room 305, is it possible if i can get it shipped to my country (indonesia)? i dont mind paying the shipping, if its possible please contact me through mail. rhandono@yahoo.com, thank you and very hopeful for the reply Royal Park Hotel THE Haneda Management, Rizky.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Absolutely wonderful hotel. It's such a pleasure to arrive at a hotel that provides great service and has rooms that are clean. The room smells fresh. You all all the amenities that you need. The hotel even provides PJs! Oh the pillow. I love their pillows and am wondering where I can buy them. Will definitely stay the next time I'm in Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here the night before our flight home. location was brilliant right in the international terminal meaning we could sleep right up till check in!! Hotel was clean, room was average size, toilettries and pjs provided. Strong wifi. Was good for what we needed. We didn't use the restaurant so cant comment on that. If you have an early flight from Haneda or have a short layover (only took 30mins into central Tokyo so you can pop in and see a few sights) i would defintely recommend it.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Good clean, convenient hotel located at the departure level of the international terminal. Breakfast starts at 5am so great for those early morning flights. There is a shuttle bus that also starts at 5am to the domestic terminal. Easy train ride to town.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I arrived late at night at Haneda International airport and checked into this wonderful hotel. The location is just perfect at the right wing of level 3 departure hall of Haneda International airport. The room is spacious and spot clean and beds are super comfy! Great place to stay for those arriving wee hours at night to Japan. Very convenient and the staff is very friendly and hospitable.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: the location is perfect. The entrance to the hotel is located at the international terminal so if you are arriving at the international terminal, you don’t have to venture out to reach the hotel We had a early morning arrival 6.30am and our next flight to Vancouver didn't depart until 9.30pm so we had a king room for day use 12 hours and the cost was ok , this was perfect for us and we also had use of the AVA business Lounge. a great Hotel to rest up before moving on .
user_name:
David H
Victoria, British Columbia, Canada

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is connected to the international terminal. Rooms are spacious and are connected to the lobby by a secured entrance (works with your room key). Internet station available. Could not be closer to check-in. No problems with noise. Pity it is not downtown, otherwise it would be a great place to stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As the title stated, the location is perfect. The entrance to the hotel is located at the international terminal so if you are arriving at the international terminal, you don’t have to venture out to reach the hotel. So that makes the hotel perfect for transit and late arrival travelers.My friend and I spent two nights at the Hollywood Twin Room (it was a 3D2N trip and we arrived after midnight so we decided to spend two nights there). It was a small twin room and we each carried a medium size luggage but we had no problem opening them at the same time in the room. It was small but cozy, comfortable bed, the bathroom was small but neat. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to all travelers!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel was good, the room was clean, the size was rather good and it was placed inside the international terminal of the airport. It is the perfect place to stay if you want to catch an early flight. A bit expensive but considering the location and the provided services it was ok. A wide range of amenities was provided.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My incoming flight arrived just before midnight at Haneda airport. This great Hotel was perfect before the start of my next day. English speaking staff, extremely courteous and very helpful. My double room was extremely comfortable, with very nice bathroom. The pillows however - which is typical of Japanese pillows are extremely hard. You might have to improvise with something else, don't expect your head to float into a soft pillow- it won't happen. :) You pay for this Hotel at Departure, not when making the booking. Location is everything. After collecting luggage and going through customs, take lift up to 3rd floor, find check in counter L which is at the end of the check in counters and you will see a sign next to it -this way to Hotel. Took all of 3 minutes to walk there. It is still within the airport complex. Perfect! Breakfast isn't included in the price - it costs Y2,500. I didn't eat breakfast there as I still had rations over from my flight!. You also get 2 bottles of complimentary water in the fridge.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: In the past, I hesitated to choose a flight that arrives at Haneda airport late at night because if I miss the last train, I will get stuck. In this trip, I decided to try this hotel since my flight arrived late at night. Also, I wanted to shop at the Haneda airport shops in the following morning. I love the Haneda airport's old "Edo" period type shops and I was looking forward to get some souvenirs there.This hotel is in the international airport on the departure floor. It was very convenient! We did not need to travel far after the long flight!!We were luckily upgraded to a bigger room and everything was perfect. Yes, it is a tiny space compared to an American hotel, but this is Japan! and it is in the airport!! Everything was neatly set up. Clean and comfortable beds and pillows, fridge, TV, all the amenities including toothbrush and toothpaste. In the morning, we walked down to the lower floor to get some breakfast at a convenient store in the airport. I love Japanese convenience store! Delicious bread, yogurt , coffee, personal portion of salad, etc. We brought them back to our room, and watched the world cup soccer game.Perfect start of our Japan trip.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had a 7:25 am domestic flight so we stayed here for one night , family of 4, booked 2 premium Hollywood rooms. Very clean, bedding, furniture, personal supplies are way better than the Shinjuku hotel we stayed for around the same price.Walked out to the middle of the terminal , they are many restaurants available, although all the good ones are packed so we just ate at a place that sells Curry rice, not that great though.If I have to find one flaw, it is the size of the bathroom, the distance between the seat and the wall in front is too little, this could be a personal thing though, I need more 'headroom' when I sit on the toilet to be comfortable....

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is connected to the terminal near to check in zone L. Throughout, it is extremely well furnished and equipped. Although it looks a little like a people factory, with its box shaped rooms and vast long corridors, it is perfect place to stay ready for an early morning flight. The rooms are luxuriously furnished with the bathroom separated by a glass wall. They could be improved with more pillows supplied and a desk type chair but that's probably of minor importance! Residents are entitled to a 10% discount at the restaurant/bar immediately next to the hotel.
user_name:
Chris B
Milton Keynes, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My family stayed here only one night. We had visited Kyoto and were flying to Hong Kong the next morning. Searching for a hotel, I found this gem. The hotel is actually in the airport on the international flight floor. We walked from our room, had breakfast in the hotel and literally walked across the hall to check-in. We were able to spend maximum time in Kyoto AND have a super easy transit to our flight the next morning. Also, the hotel was very, very nice; but the ease of flight was brilliant.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Haneda is a good alternative for arrival in Japan - much less crowded than Narita. I've used this hotel as my "pied-a-terre" for short stays - usually at an Expedia rate of about $150 USD. At that price, it is very good value. Once you clear customs, you walk through the terminal (which has not been very crowded when I've been there) to the opposite end and check-in to the hotel. Getting to sleep in a nice clean room right away, instead of having to take the train into the city allows you to start the next day raring to go. It is a straight shot into Yokohama or Tokyo (about 35 min to the latter). I like being able to recover away from the city crowds at night, back at the quiet airport. There aren't a lot of options for eating in the airport (or anything much to do - although there is a cool flight simulator that you can pay to play on, on the top floor), so you'll eat before returning to your room at night. I love the view of Mt Fuji from the terminal and the fact that I can walk leisurely in the terminal to the train station without having to navigate crowds. I notice that the price per room has crept up well over $200. Probably won't stay here more than one night at that price point. But, if you see a good rate, it's great value. Front desk speaks reasonable but not great English. Don't expect to rely on a concierge for recommendations.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If you are travelling out of Japan and need to stay near the airport, you should choose this hotel. It is at the terminal, so you walk straight in to the terminal. Only thing that didn´t work for me, was their small beds, so if you are 7 feet, don´t go there

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is VERY nice !!5 stars, I do not think so, but 4.5 maybe. They should write which terminal the hotel is, so it will be more easy for travelers to know where to get out of the train. There are 2 terminals and in both there are different hotels. But anyway, the rooms are very nice but very small too. It is connected right into the airport check inn area, which is very convenience, if you are using that terminal.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very Interesting Hotel. The water supply a stored in wooden reservoir. nice layout even though it is slightly smaller compare to other hotel rooms. You are allowed to take the airport cart all the way to the door of your hotel room :)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I can say the location is very convenient because it's inside the Haneda Airport. There are convenience stores within the area like 7-11 and Lawson. The room is very clean and I really love the pillows. I felt really secure during my stay here.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: It is just next door of Heneda International terminal, just 3 minute to the terminal, room is Clean and well equip, , staff with good attitude, helpful. It is a good choice for traveller who are looking for a convenient and comfort place.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room is so comfortable,the staff speaks good English. The room offers whatever that is needed for a night rest before we fly off again.Breakfast buffet can be better but no complains. There is a lot of things to eat at international terminal too. Will stay here again if I fly by Tokyo again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As everyone has mentioned, this hotel is incredibly convenient with its location in Haneda Airport. It was such a relief to have such a short trek to the hotel after a long, late arriving flight. Despite the late arrival, the hotel was still busy with the various travelers and airline crew coming through.You can opt for brief stays to overnight. The rooms are very clean and quiet, with a full range of toiletries. We paid for the hotel breakfast, which was a welcome treat, full of Japanese and Western options, including fresh fruit and veggies. The hotel and staff were a great welcome to Japan and a positive way to start off our trip.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel, attached to the International Terminal at Haneda, Tokyo, provides small, but fully decked out rooms at a reasonable price. There is a restaurant at the hotel entrance, but it is just a short stroll into the airport and the pre-security mall with many restaurants and shops to visit. Despite the small size of the room (not adequate for entertaining), there are many comforts that transit hotels do not offer: night shirt, slippers, wi-fi, fully automated toilet/bidet, shower/tub, refrigerator, and much more. The convenience is the biggest draw for me with the airline check in just a short walk on the same floor of the airport terminal. I don't rate many hotels excellent...but this one earned it!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A great hotel less than a minute from hotel entrance to check in desks! We asked for a room on a high floor facing Mount Fuji, and they fulfilled my request. We booked a Hollywood twin room, and this was spacious with coffee machine, lots of bottled water, fridge, ioniser etc. The bed was comfortable and bathroom had bath with shower and pillow! Our luggage was lost in transit from the previous hotel, but the staff tracked it down for us and delivered it to our door (which had a doorbell). I cannot stress enough how convenient it is for the airport, it has direct access to the departure lounge. We were at our check in desk in less than a minute. The picture I am posting is taken from the hotel entrance, the check in desks are at the first sign that says departures.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The ideal hotel for overnight stay before or after international flights.This hotel could not be any more convenient than its location at the Haneda international terminal ---not just near the terminal but adjoining the departure level. Once inside it is a quiet contrast to the crowds and confusion of the airport .The hotel is very modern and efficient,the rooms are small compared to American/Australian hotel rooms but very well equipped .Our flight arrived in the early morning as mostly happens on long haul flights and we usually are lucky enough to get into our room on arrival,Be warned this hotel reception stated they would not give us access to our hotel room until official check in time of 3 pm unless we paid for the previous night even though the room was vacant and hotel almost empty.Hotel has a small restaurant serving Japanese and western food but no other facilities such as pool and Gym.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My husband and I stayed here on the first night after arriving following a 12 hour night flight. The staff was friendly and the hotel reception was modern and stylish. The room was larger than we expected and our bed was comfortable. Surprising the room was completely sound proof- therefore you would not know it was an airport!! Thank you Royal Park Haneda!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived late booked into a very clean and beautiful room. The Japanese really know how to look after you. The bed was comfortable after 19 hours without sleep. You could not hear any noise from the airport In the morning we went down for breakfast and the layout was magnificent. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel was exactly what you need when you have a 7am flight. I'd have liked a swimming pool though. Modern, full of gadgets, free coffee to go as well as coffee making facilities in the room. Free newspaper if on premium floor. They also had a facial steamer in the room. Random but great fun. Bathroom was a great size.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Spent two separate nights here within the last two weeks and on both occasions this hotel surpassed expectations. Fantastic effortless service with genuine staff. Beautifully appointed rooms and lobby. Tailwinds restaurant delivered fabulous food on both visits. Extended check out at a mere ¥1000 per hour was no problem. The subway and train stations within the terminal make for easy and quick trips to fill in time before flights. To top it all off only steps away from the departure area.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Airport hotels on the premise are convenient for layovers, but this hotel is also great to kick-start your days in Tokyo. First day from airports often takes extra hours to get settled in, with a train or cab ride, or a wait for the shuttle for pick-up, while tugging multiple suitcases. After a long flight it was a delight to have a shower and a comfortable bed to stretch right away with minimal walking with suitcases and duffles. Considering the time we needed for settling in a hotel and ways to get there, this hotel was well worth the cost because it is just the left of the departure area. Because Haneda Airport is inside the city of Tokyo, I think the next morning one can get to any part of Tokyo with a short commute.
