It is also close to Odaiba for family travelers and shoppers - from Haneda Airport a bus ride is about 18 min, for 500 yen.Despite the proximity to the check-in area of the airport, the noise was surprisingly low and thoughts that went into to ensure security without intimidating guests were impressive. There was also a nice mall at the airport on the same floor too, which was worth spending a few hours itself (things were a bit pricey there but the mall was modeled after an old Edo-city, which was neat). When we asked for our suitcases to be stored for a couple of hours as we checked out to go to those shops, we were also nicely surprised. When we came back for our luggages, they were ready to roll out on a single airport cart (with no tip necessary, of course). The staff were truly professional; they knew how to keep appropriate distance from guests but ensure their stay would be comfortable. I would go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here for one night at the end of a Japan holiday. The hotel is literally next to (thirty seconds away from) International Departures. Took a Premium Double with brilliant view of Mount Fuji (what a way to end a trip!). Room was plenty big enough and particularly well appointed and modern. There are a mind-boggling array of dining options on the landside area of the International Terminal now. All of them looking pretty good and not your usual airport fare. Rooms are totally soundproofed and blackout. Slept very well before rolling out of bed and into check in. As with pretty much everything in Japan - this hotel is very well thought out and 100% convenient.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: 3mins from the departure area of the airport, therefore perfect for staying for the night before going back or for a short business meeting.Rooms tiny, even on the premiere floor (8F) and from my opinion overpriced. But that's the location surcharge I guess.Free wifi, checkin 3pm. Early checkin pays extra 1,000Yen an hour.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Royal Park Hotel The Haneda is at one end of the check-in area of the International Terminal at Haneda and can probably claim to be the most airport of airport hotels. If you’re high enough in the hotel (I was on floor 8) and the right side, you actually overlook the airport apron at the International Terminal. Picture attached with view from the plane with the terminal on the left and the Royal Park Hotel The Haneda on the right to show how close it is.My room was barely bigger than the very comfortable bed, fine if you don’t want to spend any time there other than asleep.Breakfast was good, with a great view of part of the city and then Mt. Fuji in the distance. It might have been the package I had, but it was nice to be able to use a free ‘Refresh room’ for an hour three days after my stay immediately prior to an onward flight.Pleasant, helpful staff made for a nice stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A nice hotel with cozy environment. I have booked this hotel because I arrived at Haneda airport at minding and will take early flight in the next morning. We can have a good sleep here amd really feel relaxation.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is extremely convenient to the terminal, so a really good plus for any early morning flight. As many people have mentioned, the rooms really are too small and hence not comfortable at all. It also seems like everything in the room is small, including the shower towels, so small they are not good for much (very soft cotton at least!). Check in staff not very helpful: we arrived early and went through the the full check in without being able to get into the room (it was before 3:00pm), we then had to go through a full check in again later on, and -on top of that - the employee at check in tried to convince us that we had to pay for the room, despite the fact that the room had already been paid for. Convenience of location is the only reason why I would come back.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I spent one night here as I had an early flight from Haneda. I was a bit reluctant because it was the most expensive option for hotels near the airport. But it was worth the money. Located just off the international terminal it was an easy walk from the Monorail. I was greeted and checked in by staff that were not only professional; they spoke very good English. Without asking they upgraded me to a premium room, gave me the WiFi code and provided a discount coupon for the restaurant.Of course the room was small but it was very well organized. Everything was exactly where you would expect it to be. It was clean and had anything one would need for an overnight, pajamas, toiletries, etc. My only complaint - the room was either stuffy or freezing. I couldn't seem to get the aircon to work right but it wasn't bad enough to complain to the staff. The room was very quiet.The restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced. They had a range of western and Japanese food and everything I saw looked well prepared and delicious. There is a full bar.Check out next morning was a non-event and the check in desk for my flight was just steps away. I will find an opportunity to stay at the Royal Park again. It was a real pleasure.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Room dimensions are too small even for just 2 peopleDefinitely designed for quick stay onlyOn the other hand, staff are very friendly and helpfulIt is within the Haneda airport which was very convenient when catching a flight

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed in Royal Park hotel for one night after arriving at Haneda at 10 p.m.It was a very smart choice:being tired after the flight from the USA,we were in the clean, nice and comfortable room in about 10 minutes.The hotel is located right in the International terminal and we just walked there through the airport building.It's brand new and we got a very good rest before starting our 21 day trip around Japan.Needless to say, that Haneda airport has a lot of restaurants,ATM machines,place to get JR pass and the line going to Sinagawa or Tokyo stations, depending where you need to go.Next morning we had a nice breakfast and in the early afternoon were in Kyoto starting enjoying the great city.I strongly recommend staying in this hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stole the title from another reviewer, because this is what it is. Our group had just collected our luggage after a 9 and 10 hour flight and we were exhausted. Imagine our surprise when the lady manning the information kiosk informed us that the hotel was just up the escalator to the right! The room had everything we needed to freshen up and get a nice rest before the next flight. The complimentary coffee was fantastic. The staff at reception could speak English fairly well (we missed this when we arrived at our final destination) and was very helpful. Breakfast was great: good introduction to Japanese cuisine, but with some recognisable Western treats to help one ease into this new culture.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel location is very convenient but the space is so tight even with the premium price.Ambience and the friendly staff are a plus.One restaurant within the hotel Tailwind you get 10%discount .Above the hotel lots of shops and other restaurants, so overall an excellent place to stay. If you are tired and you have couple hours before your flight then you can also do the refresh room for only 1000 yen an hour!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Attached to the terminal itself on the side of the departures hall, the hotel is great value for money for those arriving late and may not make the last train into town. Staff were friendly and spoke good English. The rooms are actually very good sized for Japanese standards. Sound-proofing was good and the bed was very comfortable.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is perfect if you have an early flight. The rooms are small but very comfortable. The breakfast is excellent, there is a buffet but meals can be also cooked on demand. The terminal has many restaurants therefore it is possible to have dinner there without any problems.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I arrived in Narita in the afternoon and my final destination was Shonai. Since flight to Shonai has to leave from Haneda, I took a shuttle from Narita to Haneda airport and stayed at Royal Park Hotel for one night. The hotel staff is very friendly. Although the standard hotel room is small and the view is extremely limited (building wall was my view, but I was not looking into any window), it is very clean and convenient. For dining option, I recommend walking out to the terminal and going to the food court. It is much cheaper and you will have a lot more choices in cuisine.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed here on a last minute booking when I realized I did not have time to get a train to Haneda in time for my very early morning flight.The room rate I paid online was fair and cheaper than waking up super early and taking a taxi to HND before the trains started.Checkin was crowded but the queue moved quickly.I ended up in a room on the Premium floor. I liked the free big bottle of water, and pyjamas to use. The room was very new and clean. Bed was small and too short for me, but adequate and still a better outcome than any alternative I could come up with.There was an ok view of the airport although not too much activity going on by the time I arrived.I would stay here again and recommend this if you arrive to late, or depart too early, to make use of Japan's excellent trains.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Super friendly welcome from the front desk - as typical in Japan, we got in late and they made our checkin process seamless. Albeit a small room, on par with others we've stayed at in Tokyo. Best thing about this airport hotel - it was so quiet in the room, you would never know you were at an airport, or near low flying planes. Super clean, and the best full on shower spray, hot, hot water, was a welcome relief after 16 hours of flying. And always have to give the thumbs up to the beer dispenser on the floor, just love that about Japan. Great for the late night arrival - chilly Japanese beer.And needing to catch a flight out the next morning, the front desk was helpful to ensure we knew the way to the bus to get to the domestic terminal which is a bit of a drive from the international terminal.Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Landed in Tokyo at 10:30pm and by the time we got through customs it was 11:30pm. It was nice to be able to walk to the hotel from the airport terminal instead of trying to take public transportation all way to the city. Front desk staff was plenty for that late at night. She spoke English and was very friendly and helpful. The room isn't huge but definitely is big enough for a couple. Room is clean, modern and well equipped. Only one English Channel on the TV but you can rent movies. WiFi is free and worked well.Shower had nice water pressure and temperature. Probably the most advanced toilet I've ever used. Heated seat, self flushing and bidet all built into one. Air conditioning took a few minutes to turn on but once it was going the room cooled down very quickly. Bed is a little hard but still very comfortable. Also had two large bottles of complimentary water.Definitely a great hotel if you're flying in or out of Haneda and need to be close to the airport. I would stay again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel is new an located at the airport Haneda. We use this hotel for our exploring Tokyo and around trip. It has plane and train connections in 5 minutes reach and all tourist information and services are located at the airport. Fast train provides connection to Tokio downtown in about 30 minutes.Hotel rooms are nothing special but very clean. Recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Yes Japanese hotels are small but this was reasonable. Hotel is very modern and clean. Staff was friendly and accomodating. SUSHI IN THE AIRPORT IS PHENOMENAL. DO NOT MISS OUT. Cons: You'd think being attached to an airport there would be more places to eat open late, but places close fairly early. And the more english tv channels are much desired. CNN gets annoying after 10 minutes.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As previous reviews say, the rooms are small. I was alone so it was ok, but I can see how tight it would be for a couple. But it was very clean and had everything (hair dryer, coffee maker...) that you need. The one annoying thing was the mini-bar which was virtually empty. You had to buy your own drinks from the vending machines in the hallway. There were movies in English (approximately $10 for 24 hours, unlimited viewing). But again, you had to go to the vending machine and buy a ticket with a code in order to activate this service. The staff was also polite, friendly and well trained (typical Japanese). And this hotel is conveniently located at one end of the international terminal.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If your looking for the fantastic Japanese service you've come to expect, skip this place, unless you are Japanese. The rudest front desk staff in Japan. Don't arrive early. Even if there is a room available, they will charge you a full rate if you want your room before noon (unless you are Japanese) or 3000 yen after 12. If you get upset they laugh and talk about you not knowing if you understand Japanese. The rooms however are nice and clean, but would not recommend this hotel to anyone not Japanese

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located with direct access to the International terminal at HND. Check-in was an effortless and pleasant affair, with an upgrade to a superior room provided without the need to request one.On arrival in our room we were surprised by the size, tiny doesn't come close! Everything perfectly serviceable, although the dehumidifier was a little loud and the housekeeping staff could preset the air-con to a manageable temperature so you don't have to leave it running and then head out to save from melting.Would stay here again, but only for the night immediately before a morning flight.
user_name:
Lord_Anderson
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Goodness this place is expensive for a tiny room. Annoyingly they put 3 trunk-like boxes in the room.... WHAT FOR?They are useless and take up valuable space. I must have kicked my toe on those effers twenty times.Location is what you pay through the nose for.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is located inside the Haneda Airport. Its perfect for those who'll be staying overnight in the airport. The hotel rooms have a fair size for only one person. Compact. Everything that you need is there except for a mini bar, which i don't mind at all. The bathroom is cute and equipped with all the basics. Toilet, bidet, toiletries, shower, tub, sink. The bed is enough to give you a god night rest. Clean room and sheets. The only thing i can point out is the size of the room. If you have too much luggage, you won't have much space to walk on to anymore. The staff are polite, professional and attentive to customer needs. If you need to eat out there are wide choices outside the hotel in the terminal. Fast reliable wifi is available too.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We had an early international flight from Haneda so decided to stay the night before to avoid early morning traffic congestion in Tokyo. The hotel is conveniently located in Haneda International Airport. The room was compact, quiet and clean. Staff were efficient and welcoming at checkin. The convenient location allowed easy access to a wide range of food and drink outlets in the terminal. Transport to Tokyo was good with bus, train and monorail access readily available. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: No complain for this hotel. Obviously, the location is perfect, directly connected to fright check-in place. So, you can also enjoy many attractive restaurants or souvenir shops easily. Though the room is small, the equipment is satisfactory and shower room is fine. price is not cheap, but compared with other Haneda hotel, this hotel is not expensive. Except location, overall there is no special thing , but I am still very satisfied.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: 3 times already stay in this hotel and i didn't get any problem....3pm check in is a bit annoying, but it is ok.. We can drop our lugage and going to eat at 4th floor of the airport and also go to observation deck...The staff is trying to be helpfull to us... But their english is weak.... Price was affordable... Room was ok... Not small for Japanese Airport Hotel... Big enough... You cannot compared to american standard size room...The staff recognized me at my second and third visit...Oh... The check in and check out also going well and easy !! Very easy

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: To locate the hotel on the 3rd floor departures level, just walk towards check in area "L" and you will see the hotel clearly signed, the entrance is tucked into the far corner.The hotel seems to have a strict policy on not checking in before 15:00 which of course results in a queue at 15:00. Reception staff were still clearing the queue at 15:20. It would be a good idea to plan for a later arrival.Our superior twin was a good-sized room with an open view towards the monorail. The shower was effectively in a wet room as it was housed, with the bath, in a tiled area quite separate from the washbasin and toilet. The room was smart and comfortable. The only issue we had was with the two coffee bags provided. Because the hotel mugs widened out considerably at the top, the coffee bags wouldn't fit safely on to the rims.There are vending machines for soft drinks and beers on each floor. At check in we were given a voucher for a 10% discount in the Tailwind restaurant and bar. We didn't visit the Tailwind as we had enjoyed an excellent tonkatsu meal in one of the many 4th floor restaurants while waiting to check in.In the terminal, as well as restaurants and cafes, there are a number of shops and a large observation deck. The nearest convenience store is at the entrance to the Keikyu Line.We spent just one night, between flights, at this hotel. For this purpose it was fantastically convenient. We would have been happy to spend two or three nights there as Haneda's transport connections make it a good base to visit Tokyo and Yokohama.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Directly connected to the International Departures, the location couldn't be better. Good but impersonal service. Carpet material in the corridors is not suitable for heavy suitcases. Rooms are tiny and claustrophobic. Expensive-looking decor, some of which makes one wonder where the money is spent. I should have thought a good-sized room and a functional structure were far more important than cosmetics. in an airport hotel. Pleasant but over-priced business hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After a long series of buses and flights, it is wonderful to be able to collect your bags and just roll your luggage cart directly to your room door. (And to find it waiting for you after your sleep!) Tiny room, but very comfortable and complete. There is even a small couch. Shower and hygiene supplies aplenty, comfortable bed, no disturbances. Good choice. I'd readily use it again coming through Haneda. [Late check-out may be available from 11 - 2 pm for 1000 yen/hour.]

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After visiting Mt Fuji, we took the bus to Haneda to stay at the Royal Park, as we had an early flight out the next morning. We were upgraded to the club level, the rooms though immaculate were small, but everything was extremely comfortable and well thought of. The decor was really nice, and the bathroom was of a decent size, with all amenities (robes, slippers, etc) provided. Free wifi was also provided, as was a voucher for a one-hour stay at the hotel refresh rooms, to be used in the next two weeks. The hotel is barely five minutes walk to the departure gate entrance (tip: use the departure gate entrance closet to the hotel, as for some reason, most people go to the other departure gate entrance, and there are long security lines, while at these ones, there is usually hardly anyone there!) In short, I was very impressed with the hotel. The staff were very pleasant. In addition, I had left a bracelet in the room, and only found out when I arrived at my next location. I called and they located the bracelet and kept it for me until my return to Tokyo! I will definitely be staying at the hotel again!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed 1 night at this hotel after flying in and before heading to Hiroshima. I guess I didn't have really high expectations for a hotel at the airport but this hotel blew by all my expectations with easy. First, the staff was so warm and friendly. Once we walked in and waited in the line to check-in there was a gentleman there who greeted us with a nice smile. The woman who checked us in was also very friendly and provided us with all the information we needed for our stay. We stayed in 3 different hotels during our trip to Japan and this one had the best staff.Room was small,yet a good size for Japan. Everything was clean.Location is a wonderful benefit if you are flying in late or just want a rest after a long flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Small rooms, as you;d expect at an airport hotel, but everything worked perfectly and the bed was extremely comfortable. A very short walk to check in means that I will certainly be using this hotel again.
user_location: Weston on the Green, United Kingdom
user_name:
JCCMOxford
Weston on the Green, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Needing an overnight stay between flights, I booked here with low expectations, so this little gem of a transit hotel was a pleasant surprise.The night flights seem to arrive all at once, judging from the lines at immigration, but the front desk was fully staffed and we were checked in with a bow and a smile in 30 seconds. Our room was at the end of a long corridor, and there was zero noise. Hard to believe we were still in an airport! The room was small with a double bed split into twins, crisp white linens, robes, slippers, fast wifi. And who doesn't love a heated toto toilet seat with built in bidet after a trans pacific flight! Powerful shower and nice toiletries with extra toothbrushes, razors, etc. nice to find in this price range. Bargain! The front desk was bright and cheery for a quick morning checkout, only steps away from airport security. I wish I could have stayed in Tokyo a while to find out if all of Japan is this efficient and polite.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed at the airport hotel for three days attending an offsite business meeting and not expecting much, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is small and won't satisfy someone looking for a full 5 star property but its proximity to the airport makes it extremely convenient.The rooms are small but clean and modern with some unusual random pieces of furniture..The hotel bar and airport restaurants also make the hotel more appealing. The staff were also amazingly helpful.I would stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Bring nothing but your toothbrush and toothpaste. They provide PJs, shampoo, conditioner, tea, coffee, bottled water, slippers. Clean rooms with wide twin beds, and a safe.It's in the third floor of the arrivals hall. Easy in and out. Even with the line of people at check in it only took 7 minutes. Steps to check in area.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: After striking such a cheap air fare to Japan I thought I'll spend some of the savings staying in an airport hotel rather than sleep on the lounge bench.The best thing about this hotel is you dont even have to leave the international terminal to get to this hotel. Just an elevator to departures and you're there.You get a nice sized bed in a compact but well thought room which is very clean and light with a non-modular built in bathroom. You even get two bottles of complementary mineral water.The only con I found was the corridor leading to the rooms. It was quite long, very hot and very humid. Not forgetting the use of thick carpet which felt like pulling your suitcase through the mud.Overall very happy, good nights sleep guranteed. Would recomend to anyone battling an overnight at Haneda.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed prior to an early flight to London. We had a room on the Club floor. It was just big enough but was immaculate and clean. Reception staff were welcoming and friendly. There are plenty of dining options in the hotel and just outside in the airport.In the morning you check out and walk straight into departures - it could not be better!Vastly better than staying in Tokyo and flogging out to the airport at the crack of dawn. Highly recommended and good value.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived at Haneda Airport around 630pm after a long, but relatively turbulence free flight from Vancouver (which was after another early morning flight from Edmonton). Needless to say, I was tired and cranky and my husband was equally as tired (but much less cranky). We disembarked from our ANA flight into a long hallway of gates (and nothing else - literally, this hallway was just exit gates to planes). Very little english. And NO direction on how to get to the Transit Hotel.I had done my research and I knew the transit hotel was within the secure area and I would not have to go thru customs and immigration to get to the OTHER Royal Park hotel at this airport. But we still wandered around this long hallway with dozens of passengers for about 15 mins. The "helpers" and security in this area speak very very little english and none either knew or understood what I was talking about when I asked where the transit hotel was. A fell passenger from our flight mistakenly directed us down to the end of the hallway. In order to find the transit hotel, you must go through the transit area to the international departure terminal. Since we arrived on an international flight, I figured that was where we were, but the departure and arrival areas are completely separate. You must go through security again in order to go UP to the international departure area. Once you figure this out, the transit hotel is easy to find on the departure level. The room was small, but we knew this going in. Its perhaps the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in. They provide literally everything you will need for a layover. Pj's, toothbrushes, toothpaste - you name it. The beds are hard and the pillows have instructions (read the instructions), but the room was worth its weight in gold for the fact that we could sleep before our 9am flight out to Hanoi. Having done the relatively same route-ish before (Vancouver - Seoul - Bali) all in one shot, I found the ability to be horizontal for 6 or so hours to be wonderful.There is no restaurant in this hotel, but the departures terminal was open when we made our way down for food around 8pm. the food selections are - odd, to say the least, but its nutrition that didn't come from the back of a plane, so its fine.Its pricey and if this hotel was in the middle of a city, I would have been outraged at what we got for the price, but the fact that you don't need to exit the secure area and hell, its a bed and washroom, makes it worth it on a long, overnight layover.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I booked a premium floor non smoking double room out of curiosity. The website for the hotel was user friendlyIf you make a reservation in advance you get better prices.The premium floor gives you a view of the planes, but as I found out, I was too jet lagged to care. Next time I will save my money and just try a regular floorThe room was clean and modern and had the usual amenities plus pajamas, slippers , 2 bottles of water, coffeemaker and a humidifierI opted not to have breakfast included which was a good thing as there are a lot of restaurants to choose from on the second floor.Since I was already checked in , going thru security was easy and worry free. I even got some last minute shopping done.This is not the hotel to make your base in Japan but is an ideal transit/ airport option.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Good place to stay for an overnight stopover at Haneda Airport which, by the way, has a tonne of things to see/do worth at least a few hours. Place was on the pricey side for an airport hotel, but you pay for the convenience of staying right at the airport. Service was excellent. Rooms were small though, and they did not have cribs available for children over 1, so we had to have our baby with us in bed. The two twin beds we had were smaller than most of the twins we had in other hotels in Japan. They were also hard, which we were surprised at as we had thought that the hotel was part of an international (or at least Asian) hotel chain (our experience has been that most of the hotels from international hotel chains in Japan did have softer beds).

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is new and very convenient, situated next to the check-in counter for international flights in Haneda airport. Check-in (at almost midnight) was smooth. Staff were helpful. Breakfast was good. Hotel amenities are superb. It is perfect for transit (or even for short stays in Tokyo). I would definitely stay there again if I have transit flights in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had an early morning flight back to UK so thought this would be a great option for a stress free start to the trip home. Some hits and misses for my stay+ Super convenient to T1 only a few steps away+ Good sized room+ Great wet room shower+ 1000Y ticket for movie theatre on tv gives great viewing options+ Lots of food options available in terminal- Seemingly rigid check in time arrive at 1.30 told check in time was 3 pm. This is not  expected at an airport hotel where flexibility is key to deal with travellers arriving  early after long flights etc- Room was too hot and AC was useless so bad nights sleep- Pillows are weird and difficult to get comfortable- Bed extremely firm- ExpensiveSo only an average score from me

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My family of 4 adults stayed in a deluxe twin room upon arrival at 11pm. It is extremely convenient as its entrance is on the same floor as the departure check-in counters. We were allowed to pushed the luggage trolley into our room. The room is comfortable for 4 adults although just a little cramp. We stayed there again one day before our early flight back to Singapore at 9am. There were plenty of restaurants/fast food for dinner. This time round, we stayed in Grand Fourth, a bigger room which is exactly how it was shown on their website. The service level, convenience and comfort matches that of a 6 star hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I couldn't believe how close this hotel was to the international airport. It took us less than 5 minutes to get from our beds to the airline check in counter. Everything about the hotel was fabulous. The rooms are well appointed with a very classic look, great sheets and bedclothes. The bed was very firm. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again and I don't say that often.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: If your flight arrives midday, consider staying here and re-energize before continuing your travels. Avoid getting into Tokyo during rush hour especially with luggage and infant. Located within the airport (no need to step outside), 24 hour cafe, restaurant and convenient stores in the area. Newly built historical museum on the top floor next to the hotel offers a nice walk area which connects to a patio to look at the planes landing and taking off. The room is super clean (built in the Fall 2014) and amenities are luxurious (crib for infant and Mikimoto shower elements). Breakfast option is well worth the price. Lastly, the water supplied to the room is from a holding tank built from cedar wood. It adds a relaxing sent during your shower. Interesting fact for this hotel and airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: One night stay before early morning flight to Heathrow. Great location, next to Departures and BA check in, could not have been more convenient. Staff welcoming, room ready for us although we were early. Room was quite small, but for one night, ok. Fridge, TV, coffee/tea making facility. Lots of toiletries in the bathroom. Felt the bar/restaurant pretty soulless, but plenty of places to eat and drink in the terminal building.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed at The Haneda for two nights. The first was the night we arrived in Tokyo, and we could not have been happier with our decision. Our flight was delayed so it was well after midnight by the time we cleared security/immigration. Fortunately the hotel was just a short walk through the terminal. The rooms are small, but clean, stylish, and well appointed. For the rest of our trip we stayed in Asakusa, which was accessible via a direct ride on the Keikyu line departing from the international terminal. We returned to the RPH for our last night before departing from Tokyo. We were able to spend some more time checking out the shops and restaurants in the airport, and it was nice having everything you need right outside the front door. The staff was friendly and helpful and everything about our stay was stress free. We even got to sleep in a little rather than worrying about time and rushing across town with our luggage. I'd definitely stay here again on a return visit to Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel was a perfect location for a 2 day stop with early morning Int'l departure flight. The entrance of the hotel lobby is just a 2-3 minute walk to the check in counter at Haneda Int'l Terminal. Connected to the terminal lobby. The monorail station is also located nearby in the terminal and only about 20 minutes to downtown Tokyo - Hamamatsu station. So all very convenient. My primary reason for staying at this hotel was due to a morning Int'l departure that I didn't want to fight the crowded train to get to Haneda and staying at the terminal was perfect!I have one negative comment about the hotel check in policy. I arrived at the front desk just about 2pm on the day of check in and had to pay ¥1,000 ($10.00) to be able to go to my room prior to the 3pm check in policy. Coming in from a domestic Japan flight I figured it was worth the ¥1000 yen and paid it. The odd thing is I had a suitcase delivered to the hotel when I arrived at Narita a few days before and that bag was already sitting in my room (which is a good thing) but to having to pay to access a room 1 hour prior to check in I thought was unacceptable and a little "nickle-and-dime" for a Japanese hotel. I travel extensively and this is the first time ever having to pay extra for a room that was already ready for me just to abide by the 3pm check in policy. So be sure you check in on or after 3pm or be ready to pay even if your room is sitting available and ready should you arrive early.Wifi is very slow but it works. Aside from the check in policy/charge and slow wifi this property is very clean and well kept for a 1 year old hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel was very slick and swish, express check in - warmly greeted and a great location. The bar was a hub of activity and the bar tenders great with English and excelled at customer service. Wasn't similar to being in an airport at all. Great insulation in rooms and triple glazed windows - we didn't hear a single plane despite the close proximity to the airport. This place is fantastic for plane spotters - very easy access to departures so perfect all round really.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed at the Royal Park Hotel in April 2015. We decided to stay here as we had a early morning flight back to the UK on the Sunday.Check in was easy and friendly and our room was ready upon arrival. The rooms are on the small side as most of the Japanese hotel rooms but well laid out and as there is a big window which lets lots of light in which helps. The bathroom was a great size with a full sized bath - I could have done with a bit more vanity space though.There is a small banquet seating area with a table and a desk area with a chair. There is no wardrobe but is a small hanging rack with hangers if required. The free wifi was really fast and had a stable connection. Overall, the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and really well decorated.There was a vending machine on our floor and also the ticket dispenser for the movies - you buy a numbered ticket for 1,000 yen and have unlimited access to your room TV's movie library. We thought we would only be able to watch one film but you can watch as many as you like. The hotel could not be more close to the airport check in desks - it is literally only a minutes walk from the reception desk. It is a very handy and great priced place to stay if you have a early flight the next day.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel in Haneda airport even though we were flying back to the UK from Narita as it was easy to get to from cruise port and convenient for travelling around Tokyo. The hotel is actually in the international departures terminal from where the monorail goes to Hamamatsucho and from there it is easy to travel anywhere in Tokyo. The bus to Narita also leaves form this terminal - we got the 6.25am bus so literally rolled out of bed onto the bus!.The hotel itself is modern, clean and comfortable. It is also very quiet and we managed to sleep very well. The room itself was quite small, but I think this is the norm for Tokyo. The bathroom was extremely well equipped and hi-tech! It was great value for money and if you are flying out of Haneda and want to stay in a convenient location in Tokyo this hotel would be absolutely perfect! Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Good place to stay if you are flying out early in the morning, as we were. The rooms are comfortable and very clean, the shower was fantastic and the loo was....very Japanese!Basic facilities are all here and the restaurant a little pricey but as there are many more cafes in the airport there is food for every budget. Some of the more popular places had long waits so we ate in the hotel restaurant - good pizza and good local food.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Like many other reviewers, I stayed here as I had a one-night layover at the airport. Finding the reception area was a little difficult but I managed to locate it after asking someone at an information desk. The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient. The room itself was very comfortable and clean - a little small but definitely enough room for myself. The wi-fi worked well and I recall a small tv in the room as well. I found the price to be comparable to many of the other hotels outside the airport - maybe just slightly more expensive. But, considering the short length of my layover, it was well worth staying here versus dealing with shuttles or public transport to reach the other locations. I would definitely choose to stay here again if I was in the same situation.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here for one night because we had an early flight and it turned out to be a good decision because this hotel is attached to the International terminal of Haneda airport. Just go up the escalators and the hotel entrance is located on the left hand side at the end of the corridor. Very clean modern hotel with free WFI/water. All the flight information is available from the TVs in the rooms so you can check for delays etc. Hotel has a great restaurant which serves excellent dinner and breakfast at a reasonable rate. There are several restaurants at the International terminal if you don't fancy eating at the hotel. The bedrooms are very small but perfectly adequate for a one night stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Arrived at the airport late at night and felt great that the hotel is directly linked to the airport. Modern, nice decor, and spacious room. And the price is really good. An excellent airport hotel indeed!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel was absolutely perfect from all aspects. The price is very good considering that we are talking about a hotel exactly inside the international airport. The staff very friendly and helpful. I loved the decoration and the whole style of the hotel; very sophisticated! The room was very comfortable. The only thing I may say I did not expect was that there was no wardrobe/closet in my room, at least (I don't know about the rest of the rooms), but there were hangers to hang your clothes to a metal stuck to the wall. But that was not that much of a problem. The bed was very comfortable, the bath also very nice with dark wood floor and door. The amenities are very nicely placed in a a separate box. Towels are very soft! The hotel is very new- just six months since opening- and you can feel it everywhere in the air! Definitely recommend it!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We landed at Haneda at 7:20 and booked two of the Refresh Rooms in order to have a shower and freshen up before catching the bus into Tokyo. The hotel is part of the international terminal, so just a short walk away. The rooms were small but equipped with a chair, sink, tv, free wifi and a shower. It was great to be able to shower and change after an overnight flight, and to have somewhere to leave the cases whilst we went to buy the bus tickets. Fantastic idea and good value at ¥2,000 per room.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Great price, small but fully functional and serviceable rooms, and no better way to spend the night before an early departure out of Haneda. Friendly check-in/out, decent restaurant, although the terminal itself offers more choice. One of the best in-airport hotels I have stayed in over many years of such stays. Highly recommended for business or pleasure travellers, but no really the place to spend more than a night tow unless you are an airport freak. But for what it is, it is great!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed 1 night in Holywood Twin Room. This hotel was perfect for what we needed. We had an early flight so location of Royal Park was fantastic. Directly at international departures terminal. Room itself- nicely decorated, efficiently furbished and clean. Staff - better english than at other hotels, nice and polite. Reccomend it. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights before flying home. We were late in booking for a hotel room in the city and the rates which they quoted were steep and so, we booked into this airport hotel and we have no regrets. The room is spotless and modernthough extremely compact and small. It is a tight space in the bedroom but the bathroom isadequate. It has the basic amenities and a good supply of good quality toiletries. The shower in the bathroom is perfect and that is sheer joy for me. Despite the locality of this hotel being in the airport , it is quiet and the view is beautiful from my bedroom which is on the 6th floor. Connectivity by rail is top notch in Japan and with our JR pass we were able to travel between Haneda Airport and Tokyo city with ease and speed. Just the day before our flight home,my daughter and I had booked ourselves on a Mount Fuji and Hakone-enfull-day tour. It was a good tour but by the time we got into the city it was late. And since it was our last day in Tokyo and as we were staying in the airport itself, we decided to dine and soak in the night life in the city. Our flight was at 11am but we did not have to rush or request for an early morning wake-up call as we just had to wheel our bags out of the hotel and straight into the international terminal. Cool , isn't it? We will not hesitate to stay in this hotel the next time we are in Tokyo! The beds and pillows are ultra comfy here. Had 2 nights of perfect sleep.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed here for one night before flying. Really modern room and clean although small. The hotel is in the airport. A few minutes to check in! The restaurant "Tailwind" was really good for dinner and breakfast. Good wi-fi connection. Would come back here any time.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I had business around the Haneda airport area and needed one nights accommodation before relocating to the city.This new modern hotel is literally minutes from arrivals, the rooms were extremely compact, not unusual for Japan, but provided adequate amenities and despite being right next to the flight gates were very quite ... unfortunately not the same can be said for some of the other hotel guests.Nevertheless if you need good quality accommodation right at the airport you will be satisfied.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Chose this hotel for one night because of its proximity to the International airport at Haneda, as I had a 9am flight next morning. I was checking in my bag at the airport desk just two minutes after checking out of the hotel! But this hotel is much more than just a convenient place. Its a quality, comfortable hotel staffed by the customary attentive and well mannered Japanese. In the room, the air-con and shower worked to perfection and the bed very comfortable with good pillows. I didn't eat at the restaurant - looked good but you are only a few minutes walk from lots of authentic Japanese (and Western) eateries. Great place for an overnight - I wished I was staying longer!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We have a very early morning flight to take so we stay at this hotel for a night. It connects to the international terminal so it is the best! The hotel is very new and very modern. It's the first time I see a hotel using a grey colour bath towel but I like this idea! The room is very small but it's Tokyo! I am very surprise that the hotel restaurant is not expensive as we are in the hotel, right at the airport! Great quality!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We are a family of 5. I booked the hotel on booking.com 3 months prior to our holiday during cherry blossom season when everywhere else was booked.The reason why I would book again is because logistics with 3 kids is a challenge in Tokyo. Haneda was surprisingly perfect for our needs.- 20 decent restaurants on the 3rd floor allowed the kids to try different foods at 7 and be in bed for 8.30.- one of my kids got sick and there was a pediatric doctor 10 minutes away in the airport.- hotel breakfast was a healthy option for the kids- brand new non smoking hotel instead of the typical tired 1980s air freshened variety.- decent firm and comfortable bedsOne tip - it is impossible to get from Narita to Haneda after 11 PM without spending 300 USD on a taxi.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed one night before our early morning flight to Paris.Super convenient, one minute from reception to check-in desks. Relaxing evening at the airport, had a nice sushi dinner in one of the many restaurants in the terminal.The room is of typical japanese stadard, not large but convenient for one night stay. No aircraft noise observed. Free, fast Wifi in the room.Did not try their beakfast, had some coffee airside before flight.The hotel easy to reach from central Tokyo by monorail (JPY 490), we even dragged some luggage without problems.Some reviews suggest that this not an economical hotel. We consider the one night room charge abt JPY 13,000 reasonable.Good choice for early departure/late arrival

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Booked through Expedia as part of a long trip. Flying in from north America and the next day to Viet Nam. Ultra convenient. Hotel is in terminal. 2 min walk to check in counter. Very clean and comfortable room. Restaurant stays open late and has good international selection. As we landed in Narita late the direct bus service to Haneda was not available so we took train. Was relatively easy: 2 changes. Information desk gave us all needed info. Platform staff was super helpful.. even helping my wife carry her luggage.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel is actually inside Haneda's International Terminal and just a few minutes by monorail from the other terminals - couldn't get more convenient if you tried! There is a screen in the hotel reception area with flight departure info so you can check your flight is on time before you leave!Prices's were reasonable, sleep quality good and room not a bad size compared to some other places we stayed. Bathroom has the high-tech heated toilets that you find almost everywhere in Japan and plenty of amenities such as toothbrush, toothpaste, shaving kit etc.Free wifi with a good connection and a free computer to print boarding passes.There is no restaurant or bar actually in the hotel (there are vending machines) but the Tailwind restaurant just outside is affiliated so you can charge meals to your room. Prices are a bit expensive but there are plenty of other places to eat in the terminal - which is one of the nicest airport terminals I've been in and has a brilliant observation deck!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Access to the airport was fantastic, straight through the doors to the terminal. The rooms were modern, clean, comfortable with great views of the city/Mt. Fuji. Luxurious bathroom and toiletries. Room facilities were good. Room service was great. Easy access to the rest of the city via the Monorail. Would stay again!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I used this hotel for one night after arriving from a flight from Fukuoka. This is a new hotel next to the international terminal at Haneda Tokyo Airport. Very convenient location especial if you arrive on a late flight. I stayed at the top premium floor which was perfect and very quiet. The rooms are not large however big enough with all amenities complete with coffee maker and drinks. I certainly would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Haneda is one of the nicer airport, plenty of shops & restaurants. Airport is clean, spacious and looks new. It even has platform to enjoy some open fresh air and watching the planes taking off and landing.So it's very nice to be able to stay just next door from from departure hall (basically hotel entrance is at one corner of the departure hall), especially if your flight departs early in the morning.eYou can relax in the evening at the airport, have dinner and do a little shopping, before retiring to bed and wakes up refreshed for your flight the next day without much stress of rushing to the airport not to miss your flight.Hotel itself is also nice, its new with modern decor (although room size is rather small). It's unlike the bland and rather boring 'Japanese business hotel'. I didn't hear any airplane sounds from the room.One drawback is you pay for the location. I think you can find other 'Haneda airport hotels' around Ota area with 20-50% cheaper price. But you need to take taxi, train or hotel shuttle to reach airport (and thus waste perhaps 30min-45min from hotel to airport).I want to give this hotel 3.5pts, if the price is more economical I would give this hotel 4 points at least....

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I decided to stay for a few nights here in a airport view premium room on the top floor. Reception was fast and easy and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room itself was small however this is nothing unusual for Japan; there was a table and chair, TV unit and fridge with a small cupboard. For those with larger luggage it can be a struggle to find space to open your bag fully but if you have smaller carry on sized bags you will be fine. The room (Premium Single) did have an airport view however it was via the bathroom. Sadly there is a mirror in front of the window which blocks the view and condensation builds on the window which also blocks the view when you take a shower. So sadly I didn't get much of a view except for a hazy JAL or ANA jet parked outside the window. The shower is fantastic with a decent flow through the shower head and the bath is a decent size. The usual amenities and shower toilet are provided. I found the bed comfortable and I didn't mind the pillow, I managed to get a decent sleep for every night I was there. Premium floor rooms come with a better view (probably better out of a room that doesn't have the window in the bathroom only), a pod coffee machine, free bottles of water and vouchers for various other facilities at the hotel. I didn't try the hotel restaurant but I did search around the food court next to the hotel and there is a decent range there. However Haneda is about 15 minutes from both Shinagawa and Hamamatsucho stations which all have restaurants and take away too. Access to and from the hotel is fairly easy. If you are arriving at the airport it is found in the international terminal on the departures level. If you are arriving from elsewhere you can transfer at Shinagawa or Keikyu-Kamata and take the Keikyu line to the terminal. If you are using a JR Rail Pass the Tokyo Monorail is included in the pass so head to Hamamatsucho on JR and then transfer to the Monorail and hop off at International Terminal. A very nice hotel and it is recommended especially when transiting and you don't wish to travel too far :-)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is located just in the Haneda international terminal and can be found easily after arrival. It is very convenient place just to sleep after late arrival before further trip. Regarding that it is an airport hotel, the price is very reasonable. The staff was helpful and the sleep was very comfortable. There is a breakfast available in the lobby, but the price is quite high, so we haven't tested.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The hotel is nice and the room comfortable. I loved the corridor which was being used to display original art; some of it very good. It was worth taking a few moments to enjoy it. The best thing is that it is oh so convenient for Haneda. You can roll out of bed and be at the departure gate 30 minutes later ;-)I found that I could hear other guests in the corridor very clearly.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We, 2 adults and 1 kids (4 years old) stayed one night at no view room which is blocked by other building wall in a couple feet away. Price was high compare with transit room rate even though we were able to stay only 8 hours. When I booked the room, I called receptionist if they will charge my son as third person even though we share the king bed and he said "Yes, even though 4 years old, he will be counted as one person". Okay, after browsing both English/Japanese reservation menu, found two things, 1). He was wrong, Japanese web site indicate no extra charge for kid without additional bed, 2) English menu always show higher price than Japanese. So I booked a room for 2 adults.We have checked in around 10:30 pm and a receptionist also say no extra charge for kid who does not use extra bed. I felt his respond was little bit rude somehow. Elevator was secured by room key and we need to return them to avoid penalty. Our room at 6th floor was not so small what I expected so I was able to open my luggage and Japanese style bathroom was awesome including hi-tech toilet and deep&small bath tub. King size bed was firm and comfortable but we have confused Japanese hi-tech pillow. You may also find and read the pillow instruction first. We did not use the restaurant however it looks over charged 2500 jpy. you may find another restaurant up stair of the airport terminal after 6 or 7 am. Check out was smooth and I would like to come back or try transit hotel part next time.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: For many years there was only one choice to stay overnight at the Haneda Airport, now a second one is here to enjoy. This new hotel is located at the end of the International Terminal, steps away from the Edo theme restaurants and shops. It's very convenient for the late arrivals and early flights. Rooms are spacious with very nice decor. Fast check in and check out, and very nice staff.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This was a great idea! Our flight was at 9:30 AM and we would have to be at the airport by 6:30 AM! So we decided to stay at the airport. What a nice surprise! The hotel is brand new, it almost felt like we were the first ones staying in our room. The bathroom is perfect. The hotel is right next to international departure check-in, which was great for us! We literally saved hours and slept way more. We also had dinner at the airport, which had a lot of places to eat (most Japanese style, and it was exactly what we wanted as a last Japan meal). If you have an early flight, I wouldn't think twice!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We stayed here for one night earlier this month and our experience was good for what it’s worth with minor caveats. For starters, the hotel has a modern minimalist appeal. It is conveniently located on the 3rd floor inside Haneda Airport’s International terminal which is near the departure area. The subway system was also nearby so it was easy and cheap to get to areas like Shibuya, Shinjuku, etc. It was about 45 minutes of travel time during busy hours. Considering it was at the airport, the noise level was not a problem. The customer service was good overall. The receptionist was super friendly and spoke good English. Plus, there was no lineup during check-in making it super-fast. In terms of room features, the free Wi-Fi worked flawlessly, the lighting system was high-tech and their toilet system has enhanced capabilities. I’ve never thought I’d get excited using a toilet until I’ve used this one. Room amenities also included a safe box, fridge, kettle, alarm clock, bathrobes, slippers, tooth brushes, combs, shavers, shampoo and conditioner, soap, body wash, etc. Another great feature is the vending machine on our floor which sold beer for about a dollar or two (100 – 300 yen). Now for the caveats, the room was fairly small and the mattress was too firm for my liking so I had trouble sleeping. Also, only two pillows were provided and I need a side pillow. For this reason, five stars will not be rewarded. However, I would definitely come back here if I have another overnight layover.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The Royal Park is part of the Haneda International Terminal. A two minute walk from hotel room to check-in desk makes this a great stopover stay.Haneda is close to Tokyo centre and the monorail or rail line make it an easy journey into the city.The room was fairly small but perfectly adequate. Check-in was efficient although they stuck to a strict 3pm check-in rule which I find irritating for an airport hotel. That said, we left our bags and checked in later - staff had already placed all our luggage in the room for us.Good amenities in the room and free wifi. We didn't eat in the hotel.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Directly located on the departure level of the international terminal and therefore very convenient. If you arrive at a domestic terminal there is a free shuttle bus bringing you there. Sufficiently large room with separate toilet and shower / bath tub room. Very nicely decorated and everything very clean and quite new. Free wifi as well. I paid yen 29000 for a night incl of breakfast which is buffet and quite ok. Had wished to have a room with a view, but anyhow. I will come back

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Excellent location on floor 3F of the international terminal. We got our bags and went straight to the hotel. Easy check-in, free wifi, and nice amenities in the room. The shower head was like a rain shower - lots of water. It was a little disconcerting at first because the bathroom has a glass door and at first glance you don't realize that you run the shower onto the floor, after closing the glass door. Very comfortable beds, nice and non smelly even though we were given a smoking room. Wifi was fast and easy to login to. Skip the hotel breakfast at 2500¥! We walked a bit out into the airport and there are enough food shops to satisfy - closest is Yoshinoya at 7 am for grilled salmon and eggs with miso soup and rice for only 500¥. We would return just for the convenience!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: the hotel is next to the Haneda airport international terminal. Modern room at ok size (superior twin). I got a room with Mt. Fuji view.Breakfast does not offer a big variety of choice but the quality is good.I like the design of their entrance (the one connected to the airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We arrived into Tokyo late so decided to stay at a hotel near the airport and then proceed with our journey the following day. This hotel could not be more conveniently located. One floor up from the arrivals hall, just to the side of the departures hall. The hotel is new and beautifully appointed and check in was efficient. We could have done with somebody to help us lug our bags up to our room but that was just a minor point. The room itself consisted of 4 separate beds and easily accommodated 2 adults, 2 children and all of the luggage required for a family of 4 travelling for 2+ weeks (including a huge ski bag). The room was exceptionally clean, bathroom well stocked and functional and beds a little on the hard side but comfortable. The only thing that could be improved on was the bed pillows - they are literally a rice bag within a cover - although to be honest we were all so tired that we didn't care. Our onward journey the next morning could not have been easier to access from here - a stroll across the departures hall and we were at the monorail. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: So glad I chose to stay at Royal Park hotel the Haneda the evening before next morning departure. The hotel just flows into the international departure lobby and I only needed to wake up 30 mins before checking-in time. Besides the convenience, it is also a new hotel with Japanese sensuality - with elegant decor and modern, quality amenities. Although small in size, the single comfort room I booked has enough comfortable space for one person. I will certainly stay at the same hotel again when coming through Haneda airport.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed one night before early departure. It is so convenient as I could stay in the room until 45minutes before the departure time and just walk down. made life so much easier. Staff were all very polite and well trained too. Room was meticulously clean. One thing that got to my attention was that the room wasnt exactly sound proof, and I could hear people talking in the hallway. Besides that, it was a pleasant stay.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: A new hotel located in Haneda Airport. New and very modern Royal Park offers security, comfort, and convenience. Rooms are expensive and tiny however. If you don't want the hassle of a shuttle bus and are willing to pay Roy Park is a great choice but with simply a 10 min shuttle bus ride you can get basically the same size room for half the price with breakfast which my stay did not include.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Stayed at the Royal Park Haneda Transit Hotel due to an overnight connection with a 14 hour layover. I had booked the Royal Park Haneda that's outside the secure area but we were misdirected by airport staff and ended up at the newly opened "transit hotel" which is actually inside the secure area. The staff was very helpful and transferred our reservation so we could stay at the transit hotel instead of schlepping through immigration and customs to get to the proper hotel.Though the full hotel is cheaper as reservations are by full day vs transit hotel which is by hours, the cost came to about the same as we only had about 10-11 hours for stay due to transit security, etc.The rooms are very clean and comfortable, though on the small side. The hotel also provides free snacks, tea, coffee and hot soup, which is nice. In addition, there are plenty of food options on the airside terminal. Some shops are open 24 hours. It was definitely a fun experience to leave the handbags, etc. at the hotel and explore the airside terminal leisurely without having to worry about catching a flight. Even though the hotel is inside the airport, the rooms have excellent sound proofing and there's no audible air traffic noise.If you are just transiting through Haneda and need to get some rest in between flights, I highly recommend checking out the Royal Park Haneda Transit Hotel. Much simpler than going outside the secure area and shuttling to a hotel. On the other hand, if you want to use your layover to explore Tokyo, you'd be better off staying at the hotel outside the secure area.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Tokyo stopover.Opened on October 1st and we were among the first customers. We stayed one night en route to Nagasaki on a domestic flight and again after 3 weeks of domestic travel as far north as Sapporo with ANA. The special air fare available to foreigners and purchased outside Japan is highly recommended and fitted well with our International flight schedule. Obtain a day pass for the trains from the ticket dispenser at Haneda and then just 15 minutes on the monorail to Hamamatsucho station and a brisk walk across to the Tokyo Tower if you like but better to go to the World Trade Centre on the way and from here get the best view of the Tower and the best view of the surrounding area, save the expensive entry to the Skydeck at the Tower and avoid the kitsch shopping. The rail pass gives you a discounted entry at the WTC.The hotel ticks all the boxes and we will use it again.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Brand new good hotel for transit. Excellent bar, I had a friendly a good chat to bar tender. Clean with excellent shower facility, not to say the least quiet. You will have a good sleep if transit to your next journey.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Great location on the same floor as Departure Terminal of Haneda International airport. Smooth check in and check out. We had read many comments about the hard beds but they were fine for us. The bathroom was quite spacious and nice. One negative is that there is limited room service and the one restaurant they had was just about ok. Our room overlooked a carpark and was very quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you have a connecting or early morning flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Hotel is connected with short aisle to departure floor in the terminal. Very convenient to move around with bags. Even it is practically a part of terminal building I could not hear any air graft noise at all.I was given a room in Premier floor and it was more than expected. I have got used to Japanese airport hotels where rooms are small or even smaller. Typically for toilet you better know what for you go there are prepare your approach accordingly, but Park Hotel in Haneda is different. Room was with double bed and I still had space to move around. Talking about space, please keep in mind I'm talking airport hotel - room is not big in category good business hotels.Hotel is new and rooms are designed to modern travellers needs and standard. Power points are on small desk, wifi speed good and lighting sufficient. Drinking water was provided in two sizeable bottles to replenish dehydrated traveller. Toilet is goon in size and well equipped. Full set of toiletries and toilet seat with scary many buttons and functions. There is only one restaurant - Tailwind. It left somehow mixed feelings. In a way it tries to be fine dining, but it is located on corridor and feeling in restaurant is like any cafeteria in the busy airport. I did't dine there thus no comment on food.Knowing the travel times in Tokyo during morning peak hours, I will surely come back to this hotel for the night before early morning flights.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is located inside the international terminal building and is convenient for transit to international flights. Our room was small and yet cozy. One minor thing I want to mention; there was a leaflet in the bathroom which explained about their water storage tank but it was only written in Japanese. Considering the location of the hotel, it should be written in other languages too. (It said their water storage tank is made of Japanese cypress and therefore water may smell as such. Don't worry, the water was ok.)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Had to stay overnight in Haneda to catch connecting flight. This hotel was perfect. It was pouring rain when we arrived so it was great to simply stay in the hotel. No shuttles, no hassles. Rooms were fine and quiet. Haneda airport has a wonderful shopping and eating area.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: i stayed here on my last day in tokyo. we had a 12am flight so i thought it would be convenient, the hotel allowed a late checkout of 6pm for a fee which was great. the airport was right where international flights check in. hotel was new and modern seriously amazing. would book again if had an early/late flight.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: In the airport.Excellent for night flight.Free shuttle bus between terminal.The room was clean and very good services.The internet (with free wifi) was good.It's worth to stay.Highly recommended.
user_name:
Li S
Hong Kong, null, Hong Kong

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: We've been in the hotel only for 9 hours and most of the time for sleeping.The best of this hotel ia the location inside Haneda international airport terminal. so no matter what time your arrival time. It's still convenient to reach the hotel. Also Yoshinoya upstair was the saviour before you get to sleep.To continue with local flight you have to take free bus shuttle to domestic terminal.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I’ve become a more frequent user of transit hotels in recent years. I find them to be more convenient and far less stressful than city centre hotels, especially for short term layovers. THE Royal Park Haneda is a relatively new transit hotel located in Haneda’s International Terminal. What’s more convenient it that it is located on the 3rd floor (3F) departures level which makes I booked a double room for my wife and I and I found the size of the rooms to be decent by Tokyo standards. I would say possibly even above average in size. The rooms were also modern looking, clean and, most importantly, quiet. I did not hear a single jet engine blast during my stay.The bathroom is fully equipped with a shower + bathtub (separate fixtures but all in the same bathing room). The toilet is full-featured like many toilets in Japan: heated seat, built-in bidet and fan. The Japanese really have bathroom comfort down pat!One hint: while there is a single power plug on each end table, there are also additional plugs to be found both in the bathroom, near your exit door and you can also find some extra power ports inside your in-room safe (go figure!)

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is on the left side of HND international terminal departure hall, it's new and at ¥18,500/night, I think it's really worth it for a quick stop over. The room is not ridiculously small like many of the hotel in Tokyo, it's very cosy and comfortable. Bed and bath room are of very good standard. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I felt compelled to write a review for this excellent hotel. Despite having stayed in Park Hyatt Tokyo and Hilton on this trip, this is the hotel that is most noteworthy. It is located very conveniently in Haneda airport itself. On the same floor as the department level of the International terminal. It's the left hand most side of the terminal when you are facing the departure doors. Walk past a few restaurant, and then past a pair of sliding doors and you are there. You don't need to brave the outside environment anymore.Very new. Stickers still on the shower implements. Top notch hansgrohe products with consistent temperature at high pressure. Very soothing. WC is in an adjoining but separate cubicle. Convenient if there are 2 of you.Beds are smallish. No double beds in my room. Just 2 largish singles. VOD on the TV. For those with an early morning flight, it is probably the most convenient, and cheaper option than forking out another fistful of Yens for another night in the Park Hyatt, Scarlett Johansson not withstanding.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very new and modern hotel right at the international terminal. Stayed for one night in December prior to morning flight. Walk to check-in in 5 mins, service is great and staff very friendly. The design is quite modern and a little dark, but functional. Rooms are fantastic, with big bathrooms and views of Tokyo or the actual runway. Free internet is fast and no limit on number of devices.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The location was the main attraction as I was arriving on an early flight and had business nearby to Haneda airport. I received a room upgrade on arrival, which was great as otherwise I am guessing the room would have been very small indeed. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. On the 2nd floor I couldn't hear any noise from the airport. Good shower, bathroom very clean. I had breakfast at the hotel restaurant on one day which I thought was a little too expensive, unless you have the time to eat your way through the food available.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Comfortable room tug away in the quiet corner of Haneda International Terminal. Convenience access to restaurants in Edo-Market area. Brand new room with clean comfortable bed and in-room amenities. Each room also has air purification/humidifier machine. Highly Recommended.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Arrived at Haneda Airport after midnight. The Royal Park was located in the terminal and a perfect place for an overnight stay. it was a little difficult to find as the signage wasn't very clear but the airport information staff were very helpful. Check in and check out was efficient. The room was small (as they are in Japan) but totally functional. Very quiet and comfortable sleep. Very well priced room. Did not use the restaurant.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: I stayed there for one night. The hotel is located 3rd floor of Haneda International Terminal. Very convenient location. Although room is small, it is quite new and modern, and I like the nice room and bathroom. Room is quite and I had a good sleep. If you transfer at Haneda airport, this is your best choice!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Summary: Typical tiny Japanese hotel rooms, but very convenient hotel as it is connected to the international terminal. Everything is new (but a little odd)Good for quick layover..The Good: -Convenient access to airportThe bad: -No room service and only restaurant closes at about 11 PM (really sucks when you arrive late on flight and are hungry)-Typical Japanese style VERY tiny rooms.. No place to set up your laptop and work in room. Just work on bed. -Difficult to find an electrical outlet.-Weird "appliances" in the room. Never could figure out if it was a humidifier or air cleaner. -No clothes storage/closet-Restaurant is geared toward Japanese, not much edible for a picky westerner.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This hotel is interconnected with airport ,so it was just walk outside is departure hall. So you dont need to rush to get a train to there but instead of walking few mi nutes to get your early or late flight. The room is small but stylish ,and staff is friendly ,for short stay is ok .

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Perfect if you have morning flights from Haneda. The room is quite small, but with space and comfortable enough to rest. The breakfast is marvelous, with many Japanese and continental styles options.For dinner, there are more affordable options in the airport restaurant area. I suggest you to try a traditional ramen noodle.I don't suggest this hotel to a long stay because is a little far from the downtown.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Room is not tiny like other hotels in Tokyo. A lot of amenities, and since it just opened recently, I had no issue using the bathtub (usually old bathtubs have stain on it that keeps me from using it).Service was good. And super convenient as it locates next to the check-in counters in the International Terminal departure hall.The restaurant doesn't seem to offer much, but there are a lot of delicious choices in the departure hall so won't be an issue.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: The room are very small, but it's okay, it's well arranges. I think this hotel is usefull when you arrived late, no need to take bus or subway, the hotel is very well placed. You can have also a breakfast for 2500 cloae to the hotel. The people working in the hotel are nice, they want to help but they don't know so much the airport. My question was : where to take the bus to go to YCAT?... Not able ro answer!

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: As all other hotels around the world which is located inside of airports, this hotel is also not quite unique, romantic, or luxurious. Actually, this hotel is literally a part of Haneda airport terminal itself. So if you want to go inside, you have to come up to the 3rd floor of the terminal and enter. As far as I know, there's no entrance on the ground floor which is a bit annoying. If not, my bad. However, rooms of this hotel is quite big when compared to hotels with similar room fare that are located in the middle of Tokyo. And, because it's the Haneda airport, so connectivity to downtown Tokyo or anywhere near is not bad at all. You can use cab, train or bus as you want. Morning buffet was so and so but not bad. And surprisingly, I couldn't hear any noise from outside. So took a good rest. All in all, a better choice for the people who has some knowledge and experiences about metropolitan Tokyo and wants to stay near airport with a bit bigger (relatively) room.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: This is a very nice airport hotel.. typical of Japan, the rooms are very small.. but also very adequate . the staff are all very nice and helpful and the location is perfectly located within the airport.. close to check in counters and close to metro lines into the city.for an airport hotel.. this is a very good one by its standard.there is no 24hr room service but this can be said for the majority of hotels in Tokyo.. there is however some 24hr restaurants within the airport just a few meters from the hotel entrance.

hotel_name: The Royal Park Hotel Tokyo Haneda
review_body: Very nice hotel directly connected to Haneda international dept/arr terminal. The room was, as expected in Tokyo, a bit small, but still decent size and very clean. Rest assure no noise from outside. Plus Haneda airport now has many things to do and eat! If you have early start, definitely recomend to stay in this hotel and spend evening in Narita airport.
